loans.name: Dios Guia Mi Camino Group

texts.es:
El grupo ¨Dios guía mi camino¨, integrado por 2 mujeres  y 1 varón, quienes están por 3era solicitando crédito para el crecimiento económico de sus negocios. 
Jeannette es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, de 31 años, quien desde 5 años de dedica a la venta de frutas. Con la ayuda de su pareja saca adelante a sus 4 hijos de edades 19, 8, 4 y 1 edades respectivamente. Con el crédito comprara frutas como sandias grandes y medianas, aguacates y mangos. Asi podrá seguir aportando para la mejoría del su hogar y poder sacar adelante a sus hijos. 
Las demás integrantes son Karla, de 35 años dedicada a la comercialiazacion de compra y ventas de cosechas desde hace 16 años. y Juan quien comercializa productos químicos en los mercados.
texts.en:
The group "Dios guía mi camino¨ is made of 2 women and 1 man. They are requesting their third loan for the economic growth of their businesses.

Jeannette is the coordinator of the solidarity group. She is 31 years old, and has been working selling fruit for the past 5 years. With the help of her partner, she is helping her 4 children, aged 19, 8, 4 and 1, to move forward. 

With the loan, she will buy fruit such as large and medium-sized watermelons, avocados, and mangoes. That way, she can continue contributing to the betterment of her home, and be able to bring up her children. 

The other members are Karla, 35, who works in buying and selling agricultural products for the past 16 years, and Juan, who sells chemical products in the markets.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as large and medium-sized watermelons, avocados, and mangoes.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the KES 64,000 loan to buy a new motorcycle. His business goal is to be a transport manager within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin is a married man with six children. He describes himself as successful. He operates a carpentry business where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy timber and other carpentry materials. He hopes that in the future he will have better living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy timber and other carpentry materials.

loans.name: Jose Silvestre

texts.es:
José, de 46 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, debido a que su familia era de escasos recursos económicos, él se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas desde su juventud junto a su padre y a su abuelo, aprendió a trabajar y a amar la tierra gracias a ellos, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

José, se dedica a cultivar la tierra desde que estaba muy joven, actualmente tiene 14,000 metros cuadrados, para sembrar maíz y 7,000 metros cuadrados de frijol, también tiene otra fuente de ingresos por medio de la pesca, pero su actividad principal es la agricultura.- José, tiene más de 20 a¬ños de cultivar sus propios granos básicos y es de esa manera como lleva los ingresos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades de él y de su esposa.

El crédito será utilizado para comprar abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos, con este crédito el podrá tener los insumos necesarios para poder aplicarlos en el momento indicado y de esa manera asegurar una buena cosecha y tener mejores ingresos y ganancias para su familia. 

José, sueña con seguir trabajando y sembrar más; también sueña con construir su casa y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José, who is 46 years old, didn't have the opportunity to go to school because his family was of scarce economic resources. He has done agricultural work since his youth, alongside his father and his grandfather. He learned to work and to love the land thanks to them. He is married, and his partner does domestic work.

José has cultivated the land since he was very young. Now he has 14,000 square meters for planting corn and 7,000 square meters of beans. He also has another source of income through fishing, but his principal business is agriculture. José has more than 20 years of experience raising his own basic grains, and it is in this way that he brings in the necessary income to cover the needs of himself and his wife.

The loan will be used to buy compost and fertilizers for his crops. With this loan, he will be able to have the necessary supplies in order to be able to apply them at the indicated time and in this way assure a good harvest and have greater income and earnings for his family.

José dreams of continuing to work and planting more. He also dreams of building his house and improving the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Tuyuvanwe Group

texts.fr: Grâce à l'expérience acquise de ses parents, Voisin a commencé à cultiver le paddy depuis 1986. Pour lui, c'est une culture rentable car elle aide les gens à progresser. comme pour exemple, à la dernière récolte, il a pu réaliser 200$ après déduction des coûts d'exploitation. Souvent heurté par les difficultés liées aux maladies de plantes, les moyens financiers, l'inondation ou la carence en eau; il souhaite à la longue produire doublement afin de mener à bien les projets familiaux tels que la scolarisation des enfants, l'alimentation et l'amélioration de l'habitat. Président du groupe TUYUVANWE, voisin est distinctif sur la photo à travers un carnet rose qu'il tient entre ses mains.
texts.en: Voisin began to farm his paddy in 1986 thanks to the experience he acquired from his parents. He believes farming is profitable because it helps people progress. For instance, he was able to earn $200 from the last harvest (after deducting operation costs). He is frequently hindered by difficulties related to plant diseases, financial resources, flooding, and water shortages. His long-term goal is to double his crops so that he can achieve his family plans: feeding and sending his children to school, and fixing his house. Voisin is the president of the TUYUVANWE group (he is the man with the pink card is his hands).

loans.use: to buy hoes, phytosanitary products and fertilizer.

loans.name: Matonge Group

texts.fr: Dans son milieu, les parents ont l'habitude d'apprendre aux enfants les tâches qui leur permettront de se prendre en charge une fois devenu adultes. Tel a été le cas de Byamungu qui a appris l'agriculture de ses parents en 2012. Avec cette petite expérience qu'il a déjà, il constate que la riziculture est la plus rentable de toutes car à la récente production il a pu capitalisé deux cent cinquante dollars. Toutefois, il trouve que le manque de moyens financiers, l'insuffisance d'eau et les maladies des plantes posent souvent problème; cela ne l'empêche pas cependant de songer à élargir son étendue culturale dont il espére une bonne production afin d'assurer la scolarité de ses enfants et l'amélioration de son habitat. Président du groupe MATONGE, Byamungu porte un chapeau sur la photo.
texts.en: In Byamungu's area, parents tend to teach their children tasks that will allow them to earn a living when they become adults. Such was the case for Byamungu, who learned to farm from his parents in 2012. With the little experience he's already had, he believes that growing rice is most profitable, since his latest crop earned him $250. He finds, however, that financial resources, water shortages, and plant diseases often cause problems. Nevertheless, this does not discourage him from dreaming of expanding his fields. He hopes that a good crop will help him send his children to school and improve his house. Byamungu is the president of the MATONGE group, and he is wearing a hat in the photo.

loans.use: to maintain fields, and to buy plant protection products and fertilizer.

loans.name: Yobinson Mariano

texts.es:
Una apuesta muy grande por mejorar y ampliar su negocio casi en un 200% está realizando el señor Yobinson, un trabajador del campo que se dedica a la cría de aves y el cual está solicitando un apoyo económico para poder expandirse.
Con el monto de capital aunque sabe que es muy alto le permitirá la compra de 1000 aves y adecuación de galpones para albergar los animales, dicha ampliación va de la mano con los acuerdos a los cuales ha llegado con diferentes empresas las cuales están dispuestas a comprar su producción y esto para Yobinson representa una oportunidad que no puede desaprovechar y pide a todos los lectores y prestamistas que lo ayuden a evolucionar y transformar su negocio.
texts.en:
Yobinson, a worker in the countryside who devotes himself to raising fowl, is seeking financial support to be able to expand. He is making a bet that he can improve and grow his business by about 200%.

While he knows that the amount of capital is high, it will allow him to buy 1000 birds and enough sheds to shelter the animals. This expansion goes hand in hand with agreements he has made with different companies who are prepared to buy his product.

For Yobinson this represents an opportunity that he can't pass up. He is asking all the readers and lenders to help him to evolve and transform his business.

loans.use: , who hopes to make a big bet on growth, to buy 1000 birds and build shelters.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to stock up on powdered soaps, sugar, beauty creams, etc.

loans.name: Iurie

texts.en:
Iurie is a 48-year-old manufacturer from Ungheni region in Moldova. He is married. His wife, Elena, is a saleswoman in a building materials shop. They have one granddaughter. Iurie has been producing small mills for 15 years. These mills are used by farmers to husk corn and sunflowers. He sells his manufacturing in an open-air market in Ungheni city.

Iurie wants to expand his production due to high demand for these mills. He will use this loan to buy parts for the construction of mills. In this way, he will increase his family's level of life.

loans.use: to purchase parts for the construction of mills

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en: Dennis is a married man. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to service and maintain his motorcycle. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to service and maintain his motorcycle.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be a go-getter. He operates a retail business where he sells beverages and refreshments. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy beverages. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially independent.

loans.use: buy beverages.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a married woman. She has six children. She operates a retail business where she sells onions, tomatoes, and fish. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes and fish. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes and fish.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to buy a taxi within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more milk to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and spare parts to continue improving his workshop and to be able to give his children a better quality of life.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana de 45 años de edad casada, tiene un hijo que dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 14 años  a la venta de diferentes productos como golosinas, frescos, cuajada, rosquillas, etc. 
Doña Ana está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de maíz, huevos, aceite, café, arroz, cuajada, etc. para poder elaborar su producto y las ganancias que obtenga con sus ventas  le permitan salir adelante en su negocio y con su familia.
Doña Ana es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma, su sueño es mejorar su negocio y ver crecer a su hijo.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2015.
texts.en:
Ana is 45 years old and is married with one child who depends on her. She lives in a community in San Lorenzo, a valley in the south of Honduras. She has her own home and for 14 years she has earned a living selling different products such as sweets, fruit juice, cottage cheese, doughnuts, etc.

She is asking for a loan to buy corn, eggs, oil, coffee, rice and cottage cheese in order to be able to make her products. What she earns from her sales allows her to progress with her business and her family.

Ana is a hard working woman with the desire to get ahead. She is very happy to continue working with Prisma, her dream is to improve her business and see her child grow up.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2015

loans.use: to buy corn, eggs, oil, coffee, rice, cottage cheese, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ana de 35 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hija  en su casa propia, vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras y se dedica desde hace 10  años al negocio de venta de ropa y calzado, también vende hamacas y plásticos.
Doña Ana  es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida está solicitando el préstamo para surtir su negocio con hamacas, zapatos, sandalias, blusas, camisas, etc. espera que esta inversión le permita poder salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Doña Ana es una clienta subsiguiente y espera poder seguir con Prisma, uno de sus sueños es crecer con su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias para poder seguir apoyando a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras,  Julio del  2015.
texts.en:
Ana is 35 years old and lives with her husband and her daughter in their own home. She lives in a community in the south of Honduras and for ten years has earned a living selling clothes and shoes. She also sells hammocks and plastic items.

Ana is an entrepreneurial woman with the desire to get ahead and she fights every day to improve her quality of life. She is asking for a loan to stock up her business with hammocks, shoes, sandals, blouses, tops, etc. She hopes that this investment will allow her to get ahead and improve her quality of life and that of her family.

Ana is a subsequent client and hopes to be able to continue with Prisma, one of her dreams is to grow with her business and increase her earnings to be able to continue supporting her family.


San Lorenzo, Honduras, July 2015

loans.use: to buy hammocks, shoes, sandals, blouses, tops, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Digna Yamileth

texts.es:
La joven Digna Yamileth de 25  años de edad, vive con su esposo y su  hijo  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 5  años al negocio de venta de ropa nueva y de segunda, sandalias, fajas, cosméticos, gorras, botas de hule, y tenis,  vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Pespire  al sur de Honduras.
Digna Yamileth es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, están solicitando el préstamo para la compra de más productos como blusas, vestidos, camisas, faldas, pantalones, etc. espera que esta inversión que realice a su negocio le permita mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Digna uno de sus sueños es crecer con su negocio y también desea iniciar un proyecto nuevo de tener una pulpería en su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras,  Julio del  2015.
texts.en:
Digna Yamileth is a young 25 year old who lives with her husband and her child in their own home. For five years she has earned a living in the business of selling new and second hand clothing such as sandals, belts, cosmetics, hats, rubber boots and tennis shoes. She lives in a community which belongs to the municipality of Pespire in the south of Honduras.

Digna Yamileth is an entrepreneurial woman with the desire to get ahead in life and she fights every day to improve her quality of life. She is asking for a loan to buy more products such as blouses, dresses, tops, skirts, trousers, etc. She hopes that this investment in her business will allow her to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

One of her dreams is to grow with her business and she also wants to start a new project which is to have a grocery store in her house.



San Lorenzo, Honduras, July 2015

loans.use: to buy blouses, tops, skirts, trousers, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Luis David

texts.es:
Luis David es un joven que carga con una enorme responsabilidad, con tan solo 18 años ya es padre de dos muchachos, el mayor de 5 y el menor de 3, tuvo que realizar grandes sacrificios para mantener a su familia, de momento está dedicado de lleno al trabajo, es un artesano que realiza manillas, pero ya que no genera los ingresos suficientes para mantener a su familia, desea incursionar en el mundo del comercio, es por ello que necesita el apoyo de los prestamistas para comprar sombreros artesanales y distribuirlos en la vereda, cabe aclarar que el sombrero es un accesorios muy usado en los pueblos.
Luis David aspira que estas dos actividades le permitan generar el sustento suficiente para alimentar y darle una excelente calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Luis David is a youth who carries an enormous responsibility. Though only 18 years old, he is already a father of two boys, the older of which is five and the younger of which is three. He had to make great sacrifices in order to support his family.

Currently, he is fully dedicated to his work. He is a craftsman who makes bracelets, but since this does not generate sufficient income to support his family, he wants to venture into the business world. For this reason, he needs lenders' backing in order to purchase handmade hats and distribute them on sidewalks. It is clear that the hat is a widely used village accessory.

Luis David hopes that these two activities will allow him to generate enough to feed his family and give them an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to start a side business as a merchant by purchasing handmade hats for sale.

loans.name: Domy Rosalinda

texts.es:
Domy es una joven de 22 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a sus hermanos y padres en una comunidad denominada San Andrés Semetabaj. Domy para obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa se dedica a la elaboración de blusas típicas, esta actividad lo realiza ella desde hace cinco años, gracias a su gran creatividad y esmero por su trabajo tiene mucha clientela y esto la ha favorecido a ella, pero Domy tiene la necesidad de remodelar su casa porque ya se encuentra en muy mal estado y esto le preocupa a ella por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales como Block, cemento entre otros.
El gran sueño de Domy es pode graduarse para conseguir un trabajo estable para mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en: Domy is a young 22 year old. She is single and lives with her siblings and parents in a community called San Andrés Semetabaj. To get her income and support her parents with the household expenses, Domy works making traditional blouses. She has been doing this work for five years. Thanks to her great creativity and care for her work, she has a lot of customers and that has benefitted her. However, Domy needs to remodel her house because it is in a very bad state and that worries her. For that reason, she is asking for a loan to buy materials such as cement blocks. Domy's big dream is to be able to graduate to get a stable job and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy blocks of cement to remodel her house.

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es:
Tomas es un gran hombre, tiene 31 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 9 y 13 años, ellos viven en una comunidad del cantón panimache. Tomas para brindarle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica, desde hace ocho años decidió elegir una actividad que le permitiera obtener un buen ingreso, y desde ese entonces se dedica a  la compra y venta de cinchos para damas y caballeros, y su esposa lo ayuda porque ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de ropa típica. Tomas con el afán de surtir mejor su negocio ha considerado necesario solicitar un  préstamo para comprar más cinchos de varios estilos, colores y satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes. 

El gran sueño de Tomas es que pueda contar con su propia casa, para darle a su familia lo mejor.
texts.en:
Tomas is a great man, he is 31 years old and he is married with a beautiful family. He has three children, aged between 9 and 13 years old. They live in the region of Cantón Panimache.

Eight years ago, Tomas decided to pursue a career that would allow him to have a better income, in order to give his family greater financial stability. Since then he has earned a living selling and buying belts for men and women. His wife helps him because she also has a business selling traditional clothes. As Tomas is eager to better stock his business, he has considered it necessary to ask for a loan to buy more belts in different styles and colours in order to satisfy the needs of his customers.

Tomas' greatest wish is to be able to have his own house so that he can give his family the best.

loans.use: to buy and sell belts for men and women.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: para la compra de maíz, leña, manteca, cuajada, etc.para su negocio.

loans.name: Kusisqa Llanqasunchis Group

texts.es:
La socia Rosa Elena pertenece al banco comunal KUSISQA LLANQASUNCHIS,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Maranura,provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 36 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia cría estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de alimentos y animalitos.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Rosa Elena belongs to the Kusisqa Llanqasunchis loan group. The group is located in the Maranura district, province of La Convención and department of Cuzco.

Rosa Elena is 36 years old, is married and has 2 children. She alternates her daily jobs, working in a business raising small animals. She raises these animals to later sell them to her clients who ask for her. She has been doing this business for a while, and it is going well for her thanks to the determination that she puts into her business every day. She wants to be able to keep working like this to continue to support her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy food and small animals.

The other members are thankful for the given loan and they promise to pay their established dues.

loans.use: to buy food and small animals.

loans.name: Nael's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 26 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé en novembre 2004. Il est composé de femmes  qui habitent le même quartier. Les membres vivent dans  la bonne entente et sont solidaires. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'embouche.
NAEL debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est âgée de 52 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 garçons.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle compte faire de l'embouche en allant acheter 4 moutons. Elle mène cette activité depuis des années. Elle achète les quatre moutons à 160 000 FCFA. Elle achète aussi deux sacs d'aliment de bétail à 24 000 FCFA l'unité. Elle les élève et au bout de quelques mois les revend à 90 000 voire 100 000 FCFA l'unité.
Les bénéfices récoltés serviront à assurer les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
This 26-member group is part of the banc villageois which was created in November 2004. It is made up of women who live in the same neighbourhood. The members get along well and help one another out. Their main activities are trade and animal fattening.
Nael, standing at the right of the photo and raising her left hand, is 52 years old. She is married and the mother of three boys. With the loan she received, she intends to fatten some livestock by purchasing four sheep. She has been carrying out this activity for years. She purchases the four sheep for 160,000FCFA. She also buys two bags of livestock feed at 24,000FCFA per unit. She rears them and after a few months she sells them for 90,000, sometimes 100,000FCFA per head.
The income earned will help to provide for the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy some sheep.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 39 years old and married with six children. With five children in school, Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy variety of items to sell and other supplies to use in her business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 6 years. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy variety of items to sell and other supplies to use in her business

loans.name: Jlg-001-Melathaliyampatti Group

texts.en:
The sanitation crisis in India is a result of poor infrastructure and lack of education. Kamatchi, the leader of a group of 4 women, living in Kulithalai, in the state of Tamil Nadu has understood the importance of having a toilet at home. But she does not have the means to build one.

She is 32 years old and lives with her family of 6. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. Due to this lack of sanitation facilities, the family member are at risk of infection and fall ill often, spending a significant portion of their savings on medical expenses each month. The women and daughters in her family are exposed to the additional risk of molestation. Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for Kamatchi and family. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick.

So, together, they seek a loan of Rs. 56000 to build a toilet at home. Your loan will help these families access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

loans.use: to build toilets in their homes, for the health and welfare of their familes

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is 39 years old and has five children, with three children who are in school.

Marita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Marita requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marita has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Santos Antonio

texts.es:
Santos es un hombre de 24 años de edad, es soltero con una familia de un hijo que tiene 2 años, esta querida familia vive en una comunidad de Chichicastenango.
Santos para llevar el pan de cada día a la mesa de su familia, desde hace 5 años se ha dedicado a la venta de accesorios para teléfonos celulares, este negocio está ubicado en una de las calles principales de su comunidad, él cuenta que eligió esta actividad porque en su comunidad nadie cuenta con un negocio de este tipo por lo que le es muy rentable, pero por ser uno de los negocios más rentables es necesario mantenerlo siempre con mucha mercadería sobre todo con los productos más recientes, es por ello que él solicita un préstamo para comprar mercaderías como; audífonos, cargadores para celulares, estuches entre otros. El gran anhelo de Santos es instalar un nuevo negocio en otro punto de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Santos is a 24 year old single man. He has a family with one son aged 2 years. This dear family lives in the region of Chichicastenango.

To put food on his family's table every day, Santos has earned a living for the last 5 years by selling mobile phone accessories. His business is situated in one of the main streets in his town. He says that he chose this business because no-one else in his town has a business of this type, so it is very profitable. However, as it is one of the most profitable businesses it is necessary to always have a lot of merchandise particularly of the most recent products. This is why he is asking for a loan, to buy merchandise such as; headphones, mobile phone chargers, cases and other items.

Santos' greatest wish is to set up a new business elsewhere in the town.

loans.use: to buy accessories for telephones; headphones, mobile phone chargers, cases.

loans.name: Korany

texts.en:
Korany is 56, married and has 5 children. He works in the post office but the income from his job is very low and can't cover his family's monthly expenses.

He has a small grocery store project and is requesting a 6000 EGP loan to buy grocery products such as oil, pasta and rice. He will also help one of his sons with his marriage expenses.

loans.use: to buy grocery products for his store, such as oil, pasta and rice.

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor is a 30-year-old farmer from Busila village in the Ungheni region of Moldova. For a couple of years he has worked as a construction worker in Russia. He is married. His wife, Doinita, is a housewife. She helps Igor manage the farm. For one year, he has had a small farm based on raising cows for meat. Now, he wants to diversify their production to include selling milk. For this startup, Igor wants to use this loan to buy three cows. 

As a result, Igor will be self employed and can fulfill his dream of having own business.

loans.use: to buy cows for producing milk.

loans.name: Visoi Dairy Commercialized Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Emmilliana, a member of Visoi Commercialized Dairy Self Help Group. She is sixty seven years old, married and has ten children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 and she was able to acquire skills and knowledge on enterprise management.

She rears dairy goats as well as poultry farming as an economic activity. The skills from enterprise and financial management training have enabled her run the enterprise well. She is borrowing a loan to buy fodder and poultry feeds. This will enable her get more income due to increased produce from her goats and poultry enterprise.
Emmilliana will be able to meet her family’s basic needs such as better shelter, clothing and improved diet.
She is grateful for Kiva and their lenders for the help and support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fodder and poultry feeds. This will enable her get more income to support her family with basic needs.

loans.name: Isac

texts.en:
Isac 41 years old is married and supports four children. He is in motorcycle transport business. He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Visionfund Kenya to maintain and service his motorcycle, to be able to serve his customers to satisfaction.

He plans to use the gained profits to repay his loan and educate his children. He hopes to improve family living standards.

loans.use: to maintain and service his motorcycle to be able to serve his customers to satisfaction.

loans.name: Jlg-003-Rethinampillaipudhur Group

texts.en:
The sanitation crisis in India is a result of poor infrastructure and lack of education. This group of 3, led by Pappathi, living in Kulithalai in the state of Tamil Nadu has understood the importance of having a toilet at home. Pappathi is 20 years old and have a family size of 4. They do not have the means to build one. With no access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private: in dense bushes or isolated fields. They often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves. This puts them at risk of infection, molestation or attack, and even insect or animal bites.

Seeking to improve their situation, they seek a loan of Rs. 42000 to build toilets in their homes. As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses. Your loan will provide all 3 families access to improved hygiene and a better way of life.

loans.use: to improve sanitation facilities in their homes by installing toilets.

loans.name: Thusur Jlg - 009 Group

texts.en:
Mariyayee is the leader of the Thusur JLG - 009 group. Janagi, Dhanalaxmi, Mallika and Lakshmi are the other members of the group. Mariyayee is 28 years old and lives with her family in Tamil Nadu. She earns her daily wages by doing manual labour on agricultural fields.

She wants to supplement her income and ensure there is a more steady source of income to support her family. To this end, she underwent training from Gramalaya Microfin Foundation in millet growing. Now, she, along with the other members in the group is seeking a loan to start a business from home. She is confident of earning a higher income.

Mariyayee and Lakshmi want to start their millet business while the other members will start home-based businesses in making mixed spice powders. The income from the business will help them boost their income and save more in the long run for their children's education, and for any emergencies that may arise.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to start her millet business.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is 48 years old, she is married and is a business women. She is applying for a loan of $ 600.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. And with this loan she wants use to buy more clothes such as women shirts, children's clothes, jackets, trousers and other clothes to sell. She has a shop of second hand clothes and she also selling in the market.

Emilia has been involving in business activities a year ago. She started with her own working capital of $500.00. She is earning a good income from selling her second clothes because many people like to buy them. They are cheap and unique, when compared to new clothes. So she is still happy to do her business. She also has animals like pigs.

loans.use: to buy women shirts, children's clothes, jackets, trousers and other clothes to sell.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 55 years old and has ten children. Adelaida is widowed and has one child in school.

Adelaida is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Adelaida requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Adelaida has been in this business for 9 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Adelaida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 52 years old, married and has 5 children. She has a small grocery store and is requesting a 7000 EGP loan to buy more grocery products such as oil, pasta and sugar.

She believes the income from the project will allow her to help her husband with the family income and guarantee education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products such as oil, pasta and sugar.

loans.name: Eid

texts.en:
Eid is 32 years old, married and has 3 children. He has a small carpentry business and takes care of his aging mother.

He is requesting 10000 EGP loan to buy more wood to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy wood to expand his carpentry business

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en: Sabah is 52, widow and has 5 children of whom 3 are married. She has a small poultry business and is requesting a 2000 EGP loan to buy more birds such as ducks, chickens and geese, to generate more income for her children and help them with their marriage expenses.

loans.use: to buy more birds such as ducks, chickens and geese.

loans.name: Jlg-016-Kulithalai Group

texts.en:
Kannagi has formed a JLG with her friends in Kulithalai, in the rural part of Karur district,Tamil Nadu. Kannagi has a family of three members including a child. Her monthly saving is just Rs. 1,700.

Kannagi's income is not adequate for her family to access basic necessities like toilets in their home. They have to trek long distances at dawn to use the fields to relieve themselves. This family, especially their women and daughters, are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites.

All the three members of the group work hard as daily wage laborers to support their families, and save diligently. Taking matters into their own hands, Kannagi and her group want to build toilets for themselves in their own homes. They seek a loan of Rs. 42000 to cover the cost of raw materials and labor for constructing these toilets. Your loan will help their families access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

loans.use: to construct toilets in their respective homes, for the health and safety of their families

loans.name: Edena

texts.en:
Edena is 39 years old and has seven children. Edena is married and has three children who are in school.

Edena is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Edena requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Edena has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Edena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en: Lucas is a married man, with 2 children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells sugarcane. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be transport. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugarcane.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugarcane.

loans.name: Farahanitra Zanoarisoa Bakonirina

texts.fr:
Bakonirina est une femme courageuse et travailleuse de 45 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère de trois enfants dont les deux premiers ont déjà leurs propres emplois tandis que le dernier âgé de 12 ans est encore à sa charge et scolarisé.
Comme activité source de revenu, elle dirige un magasin général il y a maintenant 15 ans. Auparavant, elle travaillait dans une entreprise de zone franche dont le salaire est très faible, incompatible avec les travaux effectués. En plus, elle avait à entretenir et élever seule ses enfants depuis le départ de son ex-mari car il ne l'aide point dans aucun domaine.
Sa priorité est la réussite de son enfant, c'est pourquoi, malgré sa situation, elle ne se plaint jamais et ne baisse jamais les bras, elle continue à avancer et à lutter, elle travaille dur pour ça et pour son avenir.
texts.en: Bakonirina is a brave and hardworking woman who is 45 years old. She is divorced and mother to three children; the two elder children are already working while the youngest, who is 12 years old, is still in her care and at school. She has had an income-generating activity managing a general store for the past 15 years. Beforehand she worked in a company in the tariff-free zone where she had a very low salary for the work she did. Furthermore she had to look after and raise her children alone after her husband left, since he does not support her at all. Her priority is for her last child to succeed and that is why, in spite of her situation, she never complains or gives up, but rather continues to battle on and work for that and for her future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of dried vegetables, flour, sugar, salt, coffee, rice, etc.

loans.name: Cardinal Nsubuga School

texts.en:
This is Daniel. He is the Head teacher of Cardinal Nsubuga School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Mungunyu in Kasese with 420 students. Cardinal Nsubuga School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Cardinal Nsubuga School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Daniel ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Mariira Vision Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the picture is Nancy, 56 years old, married and has five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2015 to access financial management and enterprise development training. Since then Nancy has been able to acquire these skills and she has been able to grow her business by seeking new market for her produce and improving her yields. Her economic activity is growing kales, spinach and tomatoes which enables her meet her daily basic needs.

She is applying for a loan to enable her purchase seedlings, fertilizers and pesticides which will improve productivity in her farm. This will see an increase in her income and she will be
able to maximize utilization of her farm by adding more crops which will be a boost in her produce and income. A portion of the income will be re-invested back in the business and the rest in improving their day to day living and getting better education for her children.
She is thankful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay back promptly.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for better production, thus improve her standards of living and paying school fees for her children.

loans.name: Las Chuguelences Segundo B Group

texts.es:
Sebastiana es una mujer de 30 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad de Chichicastenango. Sebastiana (la primera del lado izquierdo) es una muchacha que día con día se esmera mucho para obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su padres con los gastos de la casa, ella desde hace diez años se ha dedicado a la elaboración de ropa típica eligió esta actividad porque en su comunidad mucha gente viste de traje típico por lo que era muy rentable.  Gracias a su gran trabajo mucha gente la busca y solicita de su tipo de producto, ella ahora se ha dado cuenta que es muy necesario invertir un poco más y por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para la compra de hilos de tipo seda, alemán, y lustrina.
El  gran sueño de Sebastiana es contar con un negocio propio donde pueda ella vender su propio producto y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is 30 years old. She is single and lives with her parents and siblings in a community of Chichicastenango. Sabasitana (the first to the left) is a girl who, day-by-day, strives to get her income and support her parents with the household expenses. For ten years, she has worked making traditional clothing. She chose this job because, in her community, many people wear traditional clothing and it is very profitable.

Thanks to her good work, many people search for her and ask for her products. She has realized that it is very necessary for her to invest a little more, so she is asking for a loan to buy silk and other types of threads.

Sebastiana's big dream is to have her own business where she can sell her own products and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy silk and other types of thread.

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es:
Tomas es un hombre trabajador, honrado y muy humilde, él tiene 42 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia de cinco hijos de las edades entre 16 y 3 años, esta querida familia vive en una comunidad de Chichicastenango.
Un padre responsable, luchador y entusiasta es Tomas pues para obtener sus ingresos él trabajaba de albañil, pero por la crisis de trabajo que su país enfrenta él se encontraba desempleado, pero esto fue el motivo que lo incentivo a él para trabajar como carpintero, y gracias a este trabajo su familia vive sin necesidades. Su trabajo como carpintero tiene sorprendido a mucha gente, porque fabrica muebles de buena calidad y de bonitos estilos; esto ha beneficiado a Tomas por lo que tiene la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de materiales de carpintería y compra de madera, esto lo hace con el fin de satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes. El gran sueño de Tomas es que su carpintería sea mucho más grade.
texts.en: Tomás is a hard-working, honest and humble man. He is 42 years old, married and has a loverly family of five children between the ages of 3 and 16 years old. This dear family lives in a community of Chichicastenango. He is a responsible, determined and enthusiastic father, because to get an income he used to work as a bricklayer but his country had a job crisis and he was left unemployed. This was his motive to work as a carpenter and thanks to this job his family lives without necessities. His job as a carpenter has surprised many people because he makes good-quality furniture in pretty styles. This has benefited Tomás, so he needs to ask for a loan that he will use to buy carpentry materials and wood. He is doing this in order to better meet his customer's needs. Tomás's big dream is that his carpentry becomes much bigger.

loans.use: to buy carpentry materials and wood.

loans.name: Maybel

texts.en:
Maybel, 43, is a married woman with five children, four of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Maybel has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her business.

Maybel has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can continue to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rimma

texts.en:
Rimma is a market entrepreneur from Novaya Kahovka. She rents a vending pavilion from market administration offering women's and teenage clothing items for sale. Rimma launched her venture 17 years ago and ever since she has been trying to continuously grow her trade investing all her energy and resources in it. Rimma is 49, divorced with two grown un daughters.

Rimma is seeking 31 000 Grivnyas to buy seasonal clothing for school teens, as well as uniforms that always sell well before the beginning of a new school year.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing for school teens, as well as uniforms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes, corn, pork rind, tomatoes, rice, beans, and other products to improve her sales.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia es una  universitaria de 32 años. Actualmente se encuentra trabajando en una pequeña empresa como asistente. Ella decidió seguir estudiando a pesar de haber tenido muchos obstáculos en la vida es por ello que le gusta la carrera de Administración porque es necesario contar con profesionales capaces de tomar decisiones que generen valor económico y social en una empresa. Además de dedicarse a su trabajo y estudios en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar vóley con sus amistades. Comenta que quiere especializarse en Recursos Humanos. Ella solicito el préstamo para poder pagar sus pensiones de la universidad. ya se encuentra a 2 años de terminar su carrera. Se siente muy agradecida con las personas que le ayudan a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: Silvia is a 32 year old college student. Right now,  she is working in a small business as an assistant. She decided to continue studying despite having had many obstacles in her life. That is why she chose the major of  Business Administration, because it is necessary to have professionals capable of making decisions that generate social and economic value in a business. In addition to doing her work and her studies, in her free time she likes to play volleyball with her friends. She remarks that she wants to specialize in Human Resources. She asked for this loan to be able to pay for her college tuition and she is 2 years away from finishing. She feels very grateful to the people who are helping her achieve her goals.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois  a été créé le 17 Mai 2015 lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement vient d’entamer son neuvième cycle et  compte des femmes qui habitent toutes la même localité. Elles jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Fatou (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 05  enfants. Elle est vendeuse d’huile et d’arachides.

 Avec ce nouveau crédit elle compte acheter 10 sacs de 50 kg d’arachide à 10000f le sac et d’autres condiments pour le revendre en détails dans son village.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte s’occuper de ses enfants habillements, soins médicaux  et acheter des chèvres pour aire de l’embouche.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois was set up and inaugurated on 17th May 2015. This group, which has just begun its ninth loan cycle, is made up of women who all live in the same town. They all get on well together and there is a good group spirit. Their main activity is running small trading businesses.

Fatou (who is standing on the far right with her hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is married and has five children. She sells oil and groundnut. With this new loan she is planning to buy ten 50 kilo sacks of groundnut at 10,000 francs each, as well as other condiments, which she will sell on a retail basis in her village.

With the profits she makes, she is planning to provide for her children's clothing and medical expenses, as well as to buy some goats to fatten up.

loans.use: to buy ten 50 kilo sacks of groundnut at 10,000 francs each and other condiments for retailing.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marites is 44 years old and has one child in school.

Marites has a buy and sell crabs business in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more crabs to sell and other supplies to use in her business.

Marites has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Marites would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more crabs to sell and other supplies to use in her business

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 50 years old and married with six children. With three children in school, Marlyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Marlyn has been in this business for 9 years. 

In the future, Marlyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Myla

texts.en:
Myla is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Myla is 26 years old now.

Myla has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Myla requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed.

Myla has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Myla would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed

loans.name: Gamanfel

texts.es:
Gamanfel tiene 66 años de edad, sin hijos a su cargo. Vive en el distrito de Pomahuaca, que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, Región Cajamarca, en la sierra Norte de Perú.

Gamanfel se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, tiene una pequeña bodega que se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio. Negocio estable con buenas referencias, con una experiencia de 10 años en el rubro. El destino del crédito será para invertir en la compra de mercaderia para aumentar el stock de su negocio, de esta manera generar mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gamanfel is 66 years old, with no children under his care. He lives in the district of Pomahuaca, which is located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region in the northern sierra of Peru.

Gamanfel sells groceries. He has a small store located in his house. His business has good references, and he has ten years' experience in the area. The loan will be used to invest in buying merchandise to increase his business' inventory. In this way, he will generate more income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to increase her business' inventory.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita, 55, is a married woman with seven children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Anita has a business making and selling bags in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy the raw materials needed for her bag-making business.

Anita has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and to continue sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy the raw materials needed for her bag-making business.

loans.name: Solime

texts.fr: Agée de 29 ans, Solime est une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants vivant ensemble à Tokoin. Pour soutenir sa famille, Solime vend des produits de beauté dans son salon de coiffure en s’approvisionnant une fois par mois au marché. Solime réalise sa rentabilité dans son activité et pour bien satisfaire aux besoins de ses clients, Solime désire ce prêt pour commander des mèches, tissages et pommades afin d’agrandir son stock et aider son mari à couvrir les charges du ménage.
texts.en: Solime is 29 years old, married and mother to two children; they all live in Tokoin. In order to support her family, Solime sells beauty products in her hairdressing salon and gets her supplies once a month from the market.  Her activity is profitable and in order to satisfy customer demand, she would like this loan so she can order hair extensions, hair weaves and creams to build up her stock and help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy 21 sets of hair extensions, 10 sets of hair weaves and two dozen creams.

loans.name: María Asunción

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 25 años de edad, es feliz mente casada con una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 6 y 8 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Maria es una madre de familia que se sacrifica por brindarle a sus hijos la mejor atención, ella desde hace 10 años se dedica a la compra y venta de aguacates por matas, con esta labor ha logrado mantener y sacar adelante a sus hijos, aunque para mejorar sus ingresos también cuenta con una pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Maria con el afán de seguir prosperando con su negocio de aguacates ha decidido, solicitar un préstamo para utilizarlo como capital y seguir comprando más aguacates por matas. El gran anhelo de Maria es comprar su terreno para tener donde construir su casa.
texts.en:
Maria is a 25 year old woman. She is happily married and has a beautiful family with two children, aged 6 and 8. This humble family lives in the community of Sololá.

Maria is a wife and mother who makes sacrifices to offer her children the best care. For 10 years, she has worked buying and selling avocados by the tree. With this work, she has been able to supper her children and get them ahead. To improve her income, she also has a small grocery store. In order to keep prospering, Maria has decided to ask for a loan for her avocado business to use as capital and continue buying avocado by the plant. Maria's big wish is to buy a plot of land to have a place to build her house.

loans.use: to buy avocados by the tree.

loans.name: Kagnité

texts.fr: Kagnité est une femme mariée dynamique qui vit à Agoè avec son enfant et son mari. Kagnité est âgée de 26 ans et  s’active énormément pour avoir une bonne situation financière. Kagnité est une revendeuse de pagnes qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Kagnité nécessite ce prêt pour commander des pagnes de hautes et moyennes qualités afin de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière remarquable  pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Kagnité is a dynamic married woman who lives in Agoè with her husband and child. She is 26 years old and works hard in order to have a good financial situation. She sells "pagnes" (brightly-colored pieces of fabric) and gets her supplies twice a month from the market. In order to achieve her objectives, Kagnité needs this loan so she can order medium- and high-quality "pagnes" and thereby meet customer demand and gain significant financial autonomy so she can help her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy 15 pieces of medium and high-qualilty "pagne" fabric.

loans.name: Essohouna

texts.fr: Mère de cinq enfants, Essohouna est une femme mariée âgée de 50 ans résidant à Agoè. Essohouna prépare et vend à domicile de la boisson locale faite à base du mil et s’approvisionne du nécessaire deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sacs de mil, Essohouna demande ce prêt  pour financer son achat afin de gagner des bénéfices pour venir en aide à l’éducation  scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: Essohouna, who is a 50-year old married woman, is mother to five children and lives in Agoè. She prepares and sells a local drink made from millet from her home, and gets the supplies she needs twice a month from the market. Essohouna is requesting this loan to finance the purchase of sacks of millet so she can make enough profit to help out with her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of millet.

loans.name: Mariama Aladji's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois  a été créé le 17 Mai 2015 lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement vient d’entamer son neuvième cycle et  compte des femmes qui habitent toutes la même localité. Elles jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama Aladji (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 03  enfants. Elle est vendeuse d’huile et de sucre.

 Avec ce nouveau crédit elle compte acheter 04 sacs de sucre à 2500f le sac et 20 litres d’huile raffiné à 15000f pour le revendre en détails dans son quartier.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte aider son mari dans la dépense quotidienne et s’occuper de ses enfants habillements, soins médicaux …
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois was set up and inaugurated on 17th May 2015. This group has just entered into its ninth loan cycle and is made up of women who live in the same town. They get on well together and there is a good group spirit. Their main activity is running small trading businesses.

Mariama Aladji (who is sitting on the far right of the photo with her hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is married and mother to three children. She sells oil and sugar, and with this new loan she is planning to buy four sacks of sugar at 2,500 francs each and 20 liters of refined oil at 15,000 francs each, which she will sell on a retail basis in her district.

With the profits she makes, she is planning to help her husband to cover the daily outgoings and to provide for her children's clothing, medical expenses...

loans.use: to buy four sacks of sugar at 2,500 francs each and 20 liters of refined oil at 15,000 francs each to retail in her district.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 46 years old, and married with two children to provide for. For twenty three years, she has been earning an income through selling fish in her community, while her husband fishes to support the needs of her family.

She wants to augment their situation to provide an improved living standard for her family. For this, Nena is taking a loan to buy new fishing nets. 

She is a new member of GDMPC, and with her access to it, her goal of improving her business will become easier and brighter.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Abra Yvette

texts.fr: Avec deux enfants à sa charge, Abra  est une femme mariée qui vit à Agoè  pour exercer ses activités. Agée de 48 ans, Abra est une marchande de toute catégorie de sacs de friperies. Abra s’approvisionne de ses marchandises une fois par mois au marché et demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de sortie  et d’écolier afin de gagner  une marge bénéficiaire assez élevée pour pouvoir couvrir les charges quotidiennes dont elle éprouve et veiller à ce que les enfants soient dans de bonnes conditions de vie.
texts.en: Abra is a married woman with two children in her care and she lives in Agoè where she carries out her business. She is 48 years old and sells all sorts of second-hand bags. She gets her supplies once a month at the market and is requesting this loan so she can order handbags and school bags and make a reasonably good profit to cover her daily outgoings and ensure good living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to buy 30 school bags and 10 handbags.

loans.name: Dienabou's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois  a été créé le 17 Mai 2011 lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement vient d’entamer son neuvième cycle et est composé de femmes qui jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Diénabou(debout à l’extrême droite avec la main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée 22 ans, mariée et mère 03 enfants. Elle est vendeuse de sucre et de lait.

 Avec ce nouveau crédit elle compte acheter 03 sacs de sucre à 18000f le sac et 20 litres de lait à 4000f le litre pour le revendre en détails.

Les bénéfices sont destinés à la nourriture quotidienne.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois was set up and inaugurated on 17th May 2011. This group has just entered into its ninth loan cycle and is made up of women who get on well together and benefit from a good group spirit. Their main activity is running small trading businesses.

Diénabout (who is standing on the far right of the photo with her hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is 22 years old, married and mother to three children. She sells sugar and milk, and with this new loan, she is planning to buy three sacks of sugar at 18,000 francs each and 20 liters of milk at 4,000 francs per liter; she will sells these on a retail basis.

The profits she makes will be used to buy everyday food.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of sugar at 18,000 francs each and 20 liters of milk at 4,000 francs per liter, for retailing.

loans.name: Alexis Enrique

texts.es: Alexis de 32 años es un microempresario residente en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, conocida también como “La Heroica”; proclamada así por el Libertador Simón Bolívar. Como se encuentra localizada a orillas del mar Caribe, su clima es muy cálido y prevalece entre sus habitantes el consumo de bebidas hidratantes. La abuela de Alexis palpo la oportunidad de iniciar una Refresquería y años más tarde, se la entregó en herencia. Alexis mantienen un variado surtido de bebidas gaseosas, energéticas, alcohólicas, jugos naturales y mecatos, para todos aquellos que deseen calmar su sed o simplemente tener un rato de esparcimiento.  En la actualidad aplicó a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar bebidas al por mayor. Con esta inversión su costo será más bajo y sus ganancias mayores. Su meta a futuro es continuar trabajando en su negocio para que cada día sea mas prospero.
texts.en:
Alexis is 32 years old and he is a micro-entrepreneur. He lives in the city of Cartagena de Indias, also known as "La Heroica" as it was called by the "Liberator", Simón Bolívar. As it is located alongside the Caribbean sea, its climate is very warm and so the consumption of hydrating drinks is prevalent among the inhabitants.

Alexis' grandmother took the opportunity to start a refreshment stall and, years later, he inherited it from her. Alexis keeps a varied stock of fizzy drinks, energy drinks, alcoholic beverages, natural juices and cakes, for all those who wish to quench their thirst or simply to have a short time to relax. Currently he is applying for his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy wholesale drinks. With this investment his costs will be lower and his earnings higher.

His future goal is to keep working in his business so that it is more and more prosperous every day.

loans.use: to buy wholesale drinks.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es un padre de familia ejemplar, él tiene 57 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia, Juan está muy satisfecho porque gracias a los préstamos a los que ha tenido acceso a logrado superarse, Juan con el apoyo de su familia y el esmero que le ha puesto a su cultivo, ahora ya cuenta con el negocio de venta de verduras y esto para Juan y su familia significa que si se puede superar, poniendo corazón a las cosas que se hace, Juan viendo la probabilidad de seguir mejorando sus condiciones económicas nuevamente solicita un préstamo en esta ocasión lo invertirá en la compra y venta de verduras, pues ya cuenta con muchos clientes por lo que ellos esperan satisfacer mejor a los clientes con más productos. El gran anhelo de Juan es comprar más terreno para que sus hijos cuenten con suficiente terreno.
texts.en:
Juan is a model parent. He is 57 years old, is married and has a beautiful family. 

Juan is very satisfied because, thanks to the loans he's gotten, he's managed to be successful. Juan, with the support of his family and the hard work he has dedicated to his crops, now has a business selling vegetables; and for Juan and his family, that means they can get ahead in life, as long as they put their hearts into what they do. 

Juan saw the possibility of continuing to improve his economic situation and is requesting a loan again. This time he will invest it in the purchase and sale of vegetables, because now he has a lot of customers and hopes to satisfy them even more with more produce. 

Juan's greatest dream is to buy more land so his children have enough land.

loans.use: To buy and sell vegetables

loans.name: Luis Bayardo

texts.es: Luis es un microempresario que posee una amplia experiencia en marroquinería, lo que le brindó la seguridad y fue su pilar fundamental para iniciar su propio taller en el que se especializó en la fabricación de Bolsos de diferentes texturas y diseños.  Esta actividad la inició en el año 2005 y su base de clientes es bastante significativa puesto que la calidad de sus productos es excelente y sus servicios postventa le garantizan seguridad al comprador.  En la actualidad aplicó a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en materias primas que garanticen un incremento en su surtido.  Su meta a largo plazo es poder exportar sus productos, sin embargo Luis es consiente que debe continuar muy aferrado a su negocio para cumplir con sus propósitos.
texts.en: Luis is a micro-entrepreneur who has a wide experience in the leather industry, which offers him security and was his fundamental pillar to open his own shop, in which he specializes in making bags of different textures and designs. He began this business in the year 2005, and his customer base is rather significant due to the excellent quality of his products and his post-sale services guarantee security to the buyer. Currently, he applied for his first Kiva loan through the intermediary of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in raw materials which will guarantee an increase in his stock. His long-term goal is to be able to export his products, however Luis is aware that he should continue to keep a strong hold on his business to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to invest in raw materials for his leather shop.

loans.name: José Adelmo

texts.es:
Adelmo, de 21 años de edad, está acompañado, su pareja es ama de casa y tiene dos hijos pequeños, solo estudio hasta primaria.

Adelmo, se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente siembra maíz y frijol para vender y para consumir; él ha dedicado toda su vida a cultivar y gracias a Dios siempre ha logrado salir adelante.

Adelmo, necesita del crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como: abono, fertilizantes y pesticidas para sembrar frijoles, debido a la sequía las cosechas se perdieron y es necesario volver a sembrar y eso implica gastos.

Los sueños de Adelmo, son tener una casa propia, que su hijo estudie y que su familia tengan una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Adelmo, age 21, lives with his girlfriend, who is a housewife and has two children. He only studied through elementary school. 

Adelmo works in agriculture, specifically growing corn and beans to sell and for consumption. He has dedicated his whole life to growing crops and, thank God, he has always been able to come out ahead. 

Adelmo needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies, such as compost, fertilizers and pesticides to grow beans. Because of the drought, he lost his crops and has to plant over again, and that implies a great deal of expense. 

Adelmo's dreams are to have his own house, for his child to study and for his family to have a better life.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies, such as compost, fertilizers and pesticides to grow beans.

loans.name: Maria Elia Del Carmen

texts.es: Con 36 años de edad María ha demostrado ser una mujer muy trabajadora que todos los días se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, actividad que le permite sostener la economía de su hogar, apoyada en su negocio desde hace 5 años. María vive junto a sus dos hijas de 6 y 15 años de edad y un varón de 16 años a los que ha logrado sacar adelante con el apoyo de su esposo. María anteriormente logro mejorar su vivienda, gracias al apoyo de un crédito con el cual repello su vivienda he instalo el piso al cuarto dormitorio, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito esta vez para mejorar sus ingresos económicos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cremas, lociones, champú, maquillaje, entre otros productos.
texts.en: At 36 years old, María has shown herself to be a very hard-working woman who each day earns her living with her business selling beauty products from catalogs, work that allows her to sustain her household economy, supported by her business for the past 5 years. María lives with her two daughters, ages 6 and 15, and a son, age 16 who she has managed to get ahead with the support of her husband. María previously managed to improve her house, thanks to the support of a loan with which she re-plastered her house and installed a floor in the bedroom, so she asks for another loan, this time to increase her income, so she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in creams, lotions, shampoo, makeup and other products.

loans.use: to invest in creams, lotions, shampoo, makeup and other products.

loans.name: Digna Emerita

texts.es:
Digna, de 44 años de edad, es madre soltera, es maestra y tiene tres hijas, pero solo dos viven con ella.

Digna, es maestra desde hace mucho tiempo, pero también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogos, ella emplea su tiempo libre a la comercialización de dichos productos y también los fines de semana sale a venderlos, tiene más de tres años de dedicarse a este negocio y asegura que ha sido una gran ayuda a su economía.

Digna, necesita el crédito para abastecerse de productos de belleza, porque tiene que hacer los pedidos y pagarlos al momento en que se los entregan, para luego ella ofrecerle a sus clientes, pero actualmente no tiene suficiente dinero para poder pagar el pedido.

Digna, sueña con ver a sus hijas graduadas de la universidad y que tengan una vida plena.
texts.en:
Digna, 44, years old, is a single mother, a teacher, and has 3 daughters, but only two live with her.

Digna has been a teacher for a long time, but she also works selling beauty products from catalogs. She spends her free time selling these products and also, on the weekends, she goes out to sell them. She has been working in this business for more than three years and says that it has been a great help to her economic situation.

Digna needs the loan to stock up on beauty products because she has to make the orders and pay for them when they are delivered, to then offer them to her customers, but at the moment she doesn't have enough money to pay for the order.

Digna dreams of seeing her daughter graduate from university and having full lives.

loans.use: to stock up on beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her store with more products, like rice, beans, bread, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Jessica Johanna

texts.es:
Jessica, de 33 años de edad, es muy trabajadora, está acompañada, vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos que están estudiando.

Jessica, se ha dedicado a la venta de productos de primera necesidad desde hace varios años y considera que le a brindado muy buenos resultados. 

Jesssica, necesita el crédito para surtir su tienda con productos como arroz, frijoles, pan y café, ella quiere tener surtida su tienda, para ofrecer lo productos básicos a sus clientes. 

Jessica, desea casarse con su pareja y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jessica, 33 years old, is very hard-working, is partnered and lives with her partner and two children who are students.

Jessica has worked selling basic products for a number of years and feels it is offering very good results.

Jessica needs the loan to stock her business with products such as rice, beans, bread, and coffee. She wants to have her store stocked to offer basic products to her customers.

Jessica wants to marry her partner and give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her store with products such as rice, beans, bread, and coffee.

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maritza, de 34 años de edad, es madre solter y solo vive con sus dos hijios que están estudiando.

Maritza, tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa en su casa, tiene pocos meses de dedicarse a este negocio, pero a pesar de eso considera que le está generando buenas ganancias y ahora se a convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos para su familia.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar más ropa para su negocio y de esa manera seguir generando ingresos.

Maritza, sueña con poder arreglar su casa, para vivir más seguros y más cómodos; pero también quiere que sus hijos continúen estudiando y puedan graduarse de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Maritza, 34 years old, is a single mother and only lives with her two children, who are students.

Maritza has a small business selling clothing from her house, she has been working in this business for a few months, but despite this, she believes it is generating good earnings and now it has become her primary source of income for her family.

She needs the loan to purchase more clothing for her business and, in this way, continue generating income.

Maritza dreams of being able to fix up her house, to live more securely and more comfortably, but she also wants her children to continue with their schooling and be able to graduate with a university degree.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for her business.

loans.name: Luis David

texts.es:
Luis, de 31 años de edad, está acompañado, vive con su pareja, sus dos hijos y su madre, su esposa es ama de casa y su madre la ayuda con un negocio que tienen juntos.

Luis, se dedica a la venta de granos y otros artículos de primera necesidad y junto a su madre son los  dueños de la tienda.

Luis, necesita el crédito para comprar productos para su tienda, para tener más variedad.

Luis, desea en un futuro poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y tener un patrimonio para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luis, 31 years old, is partnered, lives with his partner, two children, and his mother. His partner is a homemaker and his mother helps with the business they have together.

Luis works selling grains and other basic products and he and his mother are the owners of the store.

Luis needs the loan to purchase products for his store to have more variety.

Luis wants to be able to give his family a better quality of life in the future and to have a legacy for his children.

loans.use: to purchase products for his store, to have more variety.

loans.name: Armando Juan

texts.es:
