Armando Juan tiene 37 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Armando se dedica a la venta de verduras, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 5 años aproximadamente, con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales, ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de mayor cantidades verduras, frutas e implementar con mas productos su negocio y de esta manera tener mayor seguridad cuando realiza sus ventas.
texts.en:
Armando Juan is 37 years old, lives with his wife and children in Cayaltí district, a community which works in agriculture, trade and animal husbandry, located in Chiclayo province which belongs to Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Armando works selling vegetables, he has worked in this business for approximately 5 years, with very good personal and work references. He has asked for a loan to purchase vegetables and fruits in greater quantities and to establish more products in his business and, in this way, have more security when he makes his sales.

loans.use: to purchase greater quantities of vegetables and fruits and establish more products in his business.

loans.name: Bernabe Oscar

texts.es: Oscar es un joven universitario de 23 años. Actualmente se encuentra cursando el noveno ciclo de su carrera de Educación. El decidió estudiar esta carrera porque le gustar enseñar lo aprendido especialmente a los niños. Comenta que quiere especializarse en Educación Primaria. Ademas de ser un joven muy aplicado en sus ratos libres le gusta salir a jugar con los niños de su barrio. Para obtener algún ingreso particular trabaja esporadicamente dando clases particulares a algunos niños que necesitan reforzamiento en sus cursos.El solicito el préstamo para poder pagar sus pensiones de la universidad. Se siente muy agradecido con los socios de Kiva por ayudarlo a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Oscar is a 23-year-old university student. Currently he is studying in the ninth term of his Education degree. He decided to study this degree because he likes teaching, especially children. He says that he wants to specialise in Primary Education.

As well as being a very hard-working young man, in his spare time he likes to go out and play with the children in his neighbourhood. To get some extra money he sporadically gives private classes to some children that need reinforcement in their classes.

He is asking for a loan to be able to pay his university fees. He feels very grateful to the Kiva members for helping him to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Erick Anibal

texts.es: Erick es un joven universitario de 21 años. Actualmente se encuentra cursando el cuarto ciclo de la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Civil. El decidió estudiar esta carrera porque le gusta el análisis, diseño, planeación, construcción, operación o control de cualquier obra de infraestructura. Además de ser un joven muy aplicado en sus ratos libres toca guitarra y le gusta jugar fútbol. El solicito el préstamo para poder pagar sus pensiones de estudios, ya se encuentra a tres años de terminar su carrera. Se siente muy agradecido con los socios de Kiva por ayudarlo a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: Erick is a young university student, age 21. Currently, he is in his fourth term of his professional degree in civil engineering. He decided to study this major because he likes analysis, design, planning, construction, operation or control of whatever type of infrastructure project. In addition to being a very diligent young man, in his free time, he plays the guitar and likes to play soccer. He asks for the loan to be able to pay his school fees, since he is three years from finishing his degree. He is very grateful to the Kiva members for helping him to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dressmaking supplies, a flatbed sewing machine and an overlocking sewing machine.

loans.name: Juana Reyna

texts.es:
Juana, de 55 años de edad, es una mujer muy activa y trabajadora, es madre soltera de 4 hijos, pero todos son independientes y tienen sus propias familias.

Juana, se dedica a la venta de granos básicos y al cultivo de los mismos, ella sale a vender frijoles, loroco, pipianes, tomates, etc en los cantos cercanos a su vivienda, para poder tener un fuente de ingresos. 

Juana, necesita el crédito para comprar abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para su milpa, pues ella cultiva para vender y así poder comprar lo que necesita en su hogar.

Juana, sueña con tener una mejor calidad de vida en su vejes y vivir de los cultivos que sus hijos le den.
texts.en:
Juana, 55 years old, is a very active and hard-working woman. She is a single mother of 4 children, but all are independent and have their own families.

Juana works selling basic grains and growing them. She goes out to sell beans, bell peppers, squash, tomatoes, etc., in the cantons near her home to be able to have a source of income.

Juana needs the loan to purchase manure, pesticides, and herbicides for her cornfield because she cultivates to sell and, so, to be able to purchase what she needs for her house.

Juana dreams of having a better quality of life in her old age, and to live from the crops that her children give her.

loans.use: to purchase manure, pesticides, and herbicides for her cornfield.

loans.name: Michely Ladis

texts.es: Michely por tradición familiar aprendió a elaborar comidas rápidas, ella creció en un hogar donde el sustento fue logrado a través de la comercialización de asados y embutidos, así que toda la vida ha estado ligada a esta actividad y su conocimiento en el campo es muy amplio, razón por la que decidió iniciar su propio negocio en año 2011.  Ella ofrece una variada carta de comidas; carne asada, pechuga a la plancha, churrasquitos, pinchos y chorizos, que vende desde su local los fines de semana a partir de las 5 p.m. hasta la media noche.  En la actualidad aplicó a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar carnes, salsas y aderezos.  Con esta inversión logrará dinamizar sus ventas y con ello maximizar sus ingresos.  Ella es madre de tres hijos y su meta a futuro es comprarles una vivienda.
texts.en: Michely, by family tradition, learned to make fast foods. She grew up in a home where sustenance was gotten through selling barbecued foods and cold cuts, and so her whole life has been tied to this work and her knowledge of the countryside is very broad, so she decided to open her own business in the year 2011.  She sells a varied menu of food, barbecued meat, grilled breasts, grilled meat, kebabs, and sausages, which she sells from her retail space on weekends from 5 pm to midnight. Currently, she applied for her first Kiva loan through the intermediary of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to purchase meats, sauces and seasonings. With this investment, she will manage to boost her sales and, with that, maximize her income. She is the mother of three children and her goal for the future is to purchase a house for them.

loans.use: to purchase meat, sauces and seasonings.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas, de 57 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, pero todos son mayores de edad y viven en sus propias casas, él vive con su esposa que es ama de casa.

Tomas, se ha dedicado a la agricultura toda su vida, gracias a estas labores, a podido sacar adelante a su familia.

Tomas, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar frijol, porque se acerca la época de sembrar y de la cosecha poder vender y para la alimentación.

Tomas, desea seguir trabajando mientras pueda.
texts.en:
Tomas is 57 years old. He has three children but all of them are older and live in their own homes He lives with his wife who is a housewife.

Tomas has worked in agriculture all of his life. Thanks to this work, he has been able to support his family.

Tomas needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies for planting beans because the season to plant is near and he will be able to sell the harvest and have food. Tomas wants to continue working while he can.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to grow beans.

loans.name: Marta Cristina

texts.es: Marta tiene 27 años de edad, vive muy feliz junto a su hijo de 6 años, su hija de 12 años edad y su madre. Marta es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable que quiere darles lo mejor a sus hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta comida y platos típicos, actividad que realiza en su hogar, lo que le permite estar pendiente de sus hijos, es así como saca adelante a sus hijos y ayuda económicamente a su madre. Marta solicita un crédito a FUSAI para poder invertir en su negocio, ella quiere mejorar las condiciones del lugar donde vende comida y  platos típicos, de esta forma mejorar el servicio que brinda a sus clientes además  así poder darle a sus hijos un futuro mejor,  para lo cual invertirá en: mesas, sillas y láminas para mejorar su negocio y brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en: Marta, 27 years old, lives happily with her 6-year-old son, her 12-year-old daughter and her mother. Marta is a very hard-working and responsible woman who wants to give her children the best. She works selling food and traditional dishes, work that she does in her home, which allows her to be close to her children, and this is how she gets her children ahead and helps her mother economically. Marta asks FUSAI for a loan to be able to invest in her business. She wants to improve the conditions of the place where she sells food and traditional dishes, and in this way improve the service that she offers her customers in addition to being able to give her children a better future. So, she will invest in tables, chairs, and metal sheeting to improve her business and offer her customers more comfort.

loans.use: to invest in tables, chairs and metal sheeting to improve her business and offer her customers more comfort.

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es: Norma tiene 43 años de edad es madre soltera y vive muy feliz junto a su hija de 8 años en su  vivienda  propia y humilde. Norma quiere dar lo mejor a su hija es por ello que desde muy  tempranas horas del día se levanta a preparar almuerzos para distribuirlos al mediodía a las afueras de una fábrica, es así como brinda el sustento diario y de esta forma busca un futuro mejor para su hija. Norma solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: carne, pollo, arroz, maíz, sillas, mesas y materiales para mejorar el lugar donde vende sus productos y brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes,  un mejor servicio y esta forma poder  mejorar sus ingresos económicos y así dar un futuro mejor a su hija.
texts.en: Norma is 43 years old, a single mother, and lives happily with her 8-year-old daughter in her own humble house. Norma wants to give the best to her daughter and, for this, she gets up in the very early hours of the day to prepare lunches to sell at midday outside a factory. This is how she offers daily sustenance and in this way she seeks a better future for her daughter. Norma asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in meat, chicken, corn, chairs, tables, and materials to improve the place where she sells her products and offer her customers more comfort, better service, and in this way be able to increase her income and, so, give her daughter a better future.

loans.use: to invest in meat, chicken, rice, corn, chairs, tables, and materials to improve the place where she sells her products and offer her customers more comfort.

loans.name: Mallides Esther

texts.es: Mallides es una creativa mujer de 49 años, que aprendió con facilidad a elaborar diademas, hebillas, balacas y ganchos con el apoyo de una amiga que tomó un curso de bisutería y le regaló unas cuantas horas para contarle sobre las técnicas, tejidos y demás detalles importantes.  Hoy en día en su negocio cuenta con cinco años, engalanando los cabellos de niñas residentes del sector en el que reside al sur de Barranquilla. En la actualidad aplicó a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar materiales como elástico, cintas decorativas y nylon.  Con esta inversión reactivará su surtido y con ello sus ventas. Mallides es madre de dos hijos a quienes les ofrece bienestar con los frutos de su trabajo y su meta a futuro es ampliar su producción para incrementar sus utilidades. Así mismo su meta familiar es comprar un apartamento.
texts.en: Mallides is a creative woman, 49 years old, who easily learned to make headbands, buckles, hairbands, and clips with the support of a friend who took a jewelry course and gave her some hours to show her all the techniques, weaves, and other important details. Today, her business has been adorning the hair of girls living in the sector where she lives in the south of Barranquilla for five years. Currently, she applied for her first Kiva loan through the intermediary of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase materials such as elastics, decorative ribbon and nylon. With this investment, she will reactivate her stock and with that, her sales. Mallides is the mother of two children to whom she offers well-being with the fruits of her labor and her goal for the future is to expand her production to increase her profits. She also has a family goal of purchasing an apartment.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as elastics, decorative ribbons and nylon.

loans.name: Martha Patricia

texts.es: Martha de 47 años es una comerciante independiente que ha logrado brindar bienestar a su familia a través de la incorporación que realizó con una empresa especializada en ventas por catálogos.  Hace cinco años cuenta con el apoyo de sus vecinos, amigos y familiares a quienes les vende una gama muy amplia de productos y  le sirven de puente para contactarla con nuevos clientes.  En la actualidad aplicó a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar prendas de vestir, calzado, cosméticos, cremas corporales y perfumes.  Con esta inversión responderá a encargos y tendrá un stock para promover ventas.  Su meta es duplicar las ventas antes de fin de año y a futuro construir un nuevo apartaestudio en su predio.
texts.en:
Martha is 47 years old. She is an independent merchant who has managed to provide her family with well being through the alliance she has with a company specializing in catalog sales.

She has been doing this for five years and has the support of her neighbors, friends, and relatives. She sells them a range of products and they serve as a bridge connecting her with new clients.

Currently she is applying for a new Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy clothing, shoes, cosmetics, body creams, and perfumes. This investment will allow her to respond to orders and to have stock to promote sales. Her goal is to double sales before the end of the year and in the future build a new studio apartment on the premises.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, cosmetics, body creams, and perfumes

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 46 years, and married with four children who use the previous loan to buy school uniform materials, and zips and other textiles for selling. Using the profits,e as managed to improve on his family's standards of living,pay fees for his children and pay back his loan on time.

Justus has been selling clothes and also offering tailoring services for the last ten years to earn a living. Justus is still dreaming of being the biggest supplier of school uniforms in his area. However, he is faced with a challenge his business being seasonal and limited capital.

Justus will use the loan to buy more school uniform materials for selling.

loans.use: to buy more school uniform materials for selling.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 35, married and has 6 children. He takes care of his aging parents and has a small cattle fattening business.

Mohammad previously requested a 5000 EGP loan and successfully repaid it on due dates. He is requesting another 10,000 EGP loan to buy 2 heads of cattle to expand his project and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy 2 heads of cattle, to expand his cattle fattening business

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is an entrepreneur from Pavlograd. She is 40 with a daughter who is 20 years old. She works at a big local market downtown Pavlograd selling office supplies, artificial flowers and toys. She owns her vending locations that she bought and paid off years ago. Ludmila has thirteen years of experience working in this sphere of trade.

Ludmila is requesting 31 000 Grivnyas to buy merchandise and diversify assorted inventory for sale at her vending kiosks.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and diversify assorted inventory for sale at her vending kiosks.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He has 1 child. He operates a food cafe where he cooks food for sell. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. His business goal is to own a hotel within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Fuente Para El Desarrollo 1 Group

texts.en:
Juana is one of the members of the Fuente Para el Desarrollo (Font for Development) 1. They are micro-business people who sell clothes, natural products, shoes, artisan crafts, etc. They are in the city of Samana, a tourist town in development. Their town is still rural but is a great natural escape, and these borrowers use this to sell their products to people visiting their town.

Juana is a single woman. She lives with her family in her simple and rural home structure. Juana is very excited to be receiving her 11th loan from Esperanza International. She has successfully paid off her previous loans and taken steps to grow her business. She started her business around six years ago.

She will invest her new loan in purchasing miscellaneous products like cosmetic and beauty products. She will use her earnings to re-invest in the business while she saves to have a successful and sustainable business. Juana thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous cosmetic products and other beauty supplies

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 50000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, spices, noodles, fish, vegetables, etc. for her food vending business.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, spices, noodles, fish, vegetables, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more sugar, soaps, salt and cooking oil for selling.

loans.name: Thusur Jlg - 008 Group

texts.en:
Chitra is a 33 year old married woman. She lives with her husband in Namakkal district of Tamil Nadu in the southern part of India. She wants to start a business making and selling sarees embellished with semi-precious stones own as the income from agriculture is not enough and is seasonal in nature. She wants a permanent source of income. She is confident that the new business will bridge the gap between her current earning and her household expenses. The other members of the group also want to engage themselves in various income generation activities like saree stone work or masala powder making business.

They seek a loan which will help them to learn the basics about the business and then start their micro enterprise. The other members will use the loan to buy stock and inventories to start their respective businesses. Therefore, they all joined hands to form the group and applied for a loan for expanding their businesses. Your loan will help them contribute more to the household income. They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to start her own saree embroidery business

loans.name: Baatarsuren

texts.en:
Mr. Baatarsuren, 41 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been making and selling wooden frames to local people since 2005 at outdoor market. His wife stays at home, doing house chores. Their children study at university.

He is requesting a loan of 2000 USD to buy wood, glasses and tubes for working capital. By doing so he can continue to run his business which is the main income source for his family.The borrower is very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to increase his working capital in order to continue to make and sell wooden frames.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 22, single, lives with his family in the same house and has a small grocery store store. He is requesting a 7000 EGP loan to buy a refrigerator and some grocery products such as rice and oil to help his parents with the family income.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and some grocery products such as rice and oil.

loans.name: Moenindre

texts.en:
Moenindre is 49 year old and lives together with his wife and 5 children. He is a house painter by profession while his wife works as a cleaner. In his spare time, Moenindre cultivates
rice on an area of 1 hectare.

His painting business is growing so much so that he now needs a transportation van for carrying his material and equipment to his work spots. He used to do this on his motor cycle.

For this, he applied for a loan of SRD 6000. With the purchase of the van, Moenindre can work and earn more and take better care for his family. He dreams to become a main contractor in his region.

loans.use: to buy a van for transportation of his house painting materials and equipment.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en: Virgilia is applying for a loan of $ 1000.00 to improve her horticulture business.She is married and she has a garden where she planted beans and she takes a loan to run her horticulture business.  After the harvest she sells.  And she is happy with this loan because it will be improving her business for the future.

loans.use: improve her funds for her horticulture business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married, 54 years old and has 5 children. Her husband is a teacher and some projects must be encoded, that's why they decided to engaged in computer business. She has been running this business for four years.

It really nice to hear that they really gained more income. She was able to send their children in school, provide the family needs. She wants to increase and expand her business. Virginia's plan for her future is to save money to sustain their daily needs and for the education needs of her children when they got into college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for printing documents and layouts

loans.name: Phượng

texts.en:
Mrs Phượng is 28 years old and she is married She has had a retail business selling dry food and general things for 5 years.
Phượng lives in Tinh Gia district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.Her family is a low-income household in village.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is the latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

This is Phượng first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her dream come true.
With her business profit, Phượng hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Analiza dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell used clothes business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase additional used clothes to sell for her buy and sell used clothes business.

Cecilia has been in this business for 25 years. Cecilia earns more income from meat vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional used clothes to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a thirty- one-year-old woman who is married with four children and living in Kasese, Uganda.

Mary sells timber in addition to owning a bar and a butchery to generate income for her family. She is faced with the challenges of price fluctuations and limited capital. Mary requests a loan to buy construction materials to build her residential house which will help her achieve her dream.

She is thankful to Kiva for the support they give to people after realizing increase in her profits for 300,000 to 500,000 with which she is using to build her dream house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Ricardo is an enthusiast entrepreneur, happy and a hard worker, He is 37 years old, married and works every day to improve the living conditions for his family, his crops and his way of living. In other words, with his work he wants to make a radical change in his life, he does not want to only survive, he wants to work to get ahead and change his present.

Ricardo makes a living, growing carob. He grows carob in his farm and distributes it in the market or to third parties. He works to achieve his dream, to pay for his children’s education and so that with the technical knowledge they can acquire the family business and transform it.

To increase productivity, to be competitive and have a larger crop he needs supplies and working capital. However, since it this is not the carob season he does not have the money. For this reason he requests a loan to purchase farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, irrigation, pesticide and insecticide and he will use the rest of the funds for improvements.

loans.use: purchase farm supplies, such as seeds, fertilizers, irrigation, pesticide, insecticide.

loans.name: Talib

texts.en:
Talib is 55 years old and married with 3 kids. Talib is from Agjabadi and he is a merchant. He is a responsible and respected person. He doesn’t earn enough money. So his son is helping him. Besides he has a serious problem in his family member’s health.

Talib needs some money because his wife is so ill. Talib loves her much. So he is looking forward to cure her and bring happiness to family. He has to purchase some medicine and take her to a better hospital. Talib is hoping KIva lenders will show their support for him.

loans.use: to purchase some medicine and take his wife to a better hospital.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima 48 years old, is married and supports five children. She is a small scale farmer. She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Visionfund Kenya to add a dairy cow to stabilize her dairy farming activity to raise more income.

She plans to use the gained profits to repay her loan and provide more animal feeds for her cows for more milk production. She hopes to be financially stable and improve family standards.

loans.use: to add a dairy cow to stabilize her dairy farming activity to raise more income.

loans.name: Dionila

texts.en:
Dionila is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dionila is 60 years old now.

Dionila has a buy and sell personal product care business in the Philippines. Dionila requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like lotion, roll on, etc..

Dionila has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Dionila would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like lotion, roll on, etc.

loans.name: Jlg-016(A)-Kulithalai Group

texts.en:
The sanitation crisis in India is a result of poor infrastructure and a lack of education. This group of three self-inspired women, led by Banumathi, living in Kulithalai, Tamil Nadu has understood the importance of having a toilet at home. But they lack means to access them.

Banumathi lives with three persons in her family including a child. The monthly saving is Rs.1,500 only and the average monthly expense of her family is Rs.1,000. With no access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private: in dense bushes or isolated fields. The women and girls, seeking privacy, often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves. These unsafe sanitary practices make them vulnerable to infections, and the lack of privacy exposes them to molestation or worse. Hence, taking advantage of the awareness initiatives, they now seek a loan of Rs. 42000 to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help these 3 hardworking rural Indian families to access basic sanitation, and consequently, safety, improved health, medical savings, and improved productivity.

loans.use: to build a toilet in the homes of all the three members of the group.

loans.name: Jlg-001-Mudhaligowndanur Group

texts.en:
Chellammal, a 35 year old lady having a family size of 4 from Kulithalai, in rural Tamil Nadu has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. Chellammal's family is one of the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. They are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites. Joining hands with 3 others whose families all face similar problems due to a lack of sanitation facilities, Chellammal has formed a group and is hoping to address this issue.

Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for Chellammal and family. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. So, together, they seek a loan of Rs. 42000 to build a toilet at home. As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses.. Your loan will provide all 3 families access to improved hygiene and a better way of life.

loans.use: to fund the installation of toilets in their homes.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine at 23 years old works as a smallholder farmer. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Eldoret, in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. For the past 5 years she has been involved in mixed farming and her main source of income has been growing maize, vegetables and tomatoes. She also keeps dairy cows. Irine has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

Although she has made profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with the challenge of timely delivery of produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up; “I have to do something for my family,“ she said. Irine mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that helps aspiring women like her.

She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Irine is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to market has been a challenge, which is why she has suffered so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price, and through this loan Irine is going to achieve her dream and goals. Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle but Irine feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help women so that they can gain respect and equality. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Irine will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market and also, she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. She is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farm work. With your loan, she will improve her living conditions and assure her family of a secure future.
Like Irine, many poor smallholder farmers await for your help. Get inspired, make a loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for speedy delivery of her farm produce to market

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya lives in Pavlograd with her 6-year-old son and a mother. She is a single parent taking care of her son and looking after her elderly mother. Natalya works in a local banking institution as a call agent.

As any woman Natalya loves to turn her house into a real home. She works hard to pay the bills and it is always difficult to find any extra funds to make interior improvements with all the current needs she has to face every day. This time Natalya needs to buy a good stove for her kitchen which is a must have for their small family at this point.

She needs 8 000 Grivnyas to invest in this purchase.

loans.use: to buy a good stove for her kitchen

loans.name: Kisinga Vocational School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Reuben. He is the Head teacher of Kisinga Vocational School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Kasese with 700 students. Kisinga Vocational School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1000 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Kisinga Vocational School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Reuben ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a Kiva borrower. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful business lady. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, cement, sand, and gravel among other items in order to expand the area of her business.

loans.name: Juaquim

texts.en: Juaquim is applying for a loan of $1,000.00 to repair  his house. He is married and he has three children.  He will use the loan to buy sand, cement and  wood.  He is very happy with this loan because it will help him to repair his house for the benefit of the family

loans.use: to buy sand, cement and  wood

loans.name: Hayam

texts.en: Hayam is 25, married and has one child 1 year old.  She lives in her husband's small family house. She has a small fattening business and is requesting a 5000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to increase her income and save to afford building a separate apartment for herself and her husband.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Bayarmaa, 42 years old, lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as janitress at a private firm since 2014. Her husband operates an excavator at a mining field.

The house they live in has been deteriorated over the years and it needs urgent repair. She is requesting a loan of 2000 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. As a result, she and her husband will live in comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollutant into air.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to burn less coal for heating.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: corrugated metal sheets, wood, nails and wire to improve the roof of her home.

loans.name: Raise Poultry, Raise Our Dreams - N2Ttiếnqtrung Group

texts.en:
Mrs Xuân is 53 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Xuân lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the income from this job is unstable because when some diseases on poultry happen, they would be dead and she has nothing to sell. So she will be in trouble with finances.

The main hardship that Xuân faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2013, Xuân joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Xuân has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Xuân is the leader of N2TTiếnQTrung, which consists of 4 members

With her business profit, Xuân hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy laminated metal sheeting, beams, pins, wire, and cables in order to install a meter to be able to help his family live in a decent home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corrugated metal sheeting, wood, nails, and wire, etc. in order to give her daughters a better quality of life.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 60 years old and married with seven children, one child still in school, Thelma works very hard to provide for them.

Thelma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, noodles, spices, milk, drinks etc.

Thelma has been in this business for 2 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, noodles, spices, milk, drinks  etc

loans.name: Thusur Jlg - 007 Group

texts.en:
Jayanthi is a 33 years old woman who lives in Namakkal district of Tamil Nadu. She stays with her family with two children and her husband. Jayanthi had been engaged in daily wage earning through cultivation. It gets difficult for her to make ends meet with the small monthly income that she and her husband bring in.

She has decided to take the plunge and start her own business; she wants to get trained in the saree semi-precious stone work and start her own business to support the family. She believes that this will help her support the family. She seeks the loan to start the business of saree stone work.

Jayanthi is joined by 4 women who also lack the capital to start their businesses. They have ambitious plans but lack the funds to implement them. Your loan will help these women start their businesses and contribute to their family income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to start a business of saree semi-precious stone work.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 37 years old, widowed, and has five children who attend school. She raises pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years.

Alicia requested her fifth loan from NWTF for 11,000 PHP, which she will use to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Terezinha

texts.en:
Terezinha is taking a loan of $ 600.00 to improve her business.She is married and she has one child. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family.

She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as hats, toothbrushes, soap, shampoo, clothing and body lotion. .She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200.00. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future

loans.use: to buy hats, toothbrushes, soap, shampoo, clothing and body lotion.

loans.name: Jlg-009-Keelathaliyampatti Group

texts.en:
Viji is 42 years old, and lives with her husband and two children Kulithalai, in rural Tamil Nadu. She is a daily wage labourer who works hard to make ends meet. Viji has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. Viji's family is one of the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Joining hands with three others whose families all face similar problems due to a lack of sanitation facilities, Viji has formed a group and is hoping to address this issue. Without access to a toilet, her family members walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. Due to this lack of sanitation facilities, they are at risk of infection and fall ill often, spending a significant portion of their savings on medical expenses each month. The women and daughters in their families are exposed to the additional risk of molestation. 

Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for Viji and family. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. So, together, they seek a loan of Rs. 42000 to build a toilet at home. As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses, and they will repay the loan amount on time. Your loan will provide all 3 families access to improved hygiene and a better way of life.

loans.use: to construct toilets and improve sanitation facilities in their homes.

loans.name: Fuente Para El Desarrollo 2 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Berky is one of the members of the Fuente for Development 2 & 5. They are micro-business people who sell clothes, natural products, shoes, artisanal crafts, etc. They are in the city of Samana, a tourist town in development, bordered by the Atlantic coast and rich in natural resources. Berky is associated with Esperanza because she needed to work to get ahead.

Berky is very excited to be receiving her 13th loan in Esperanza International. She has sucessfully paid off her previous loans and taken steps to grow her business. She started doing business more than 6 years ago with a loan from Esperanza International and she decides to sells catalog products like cosmetics, perfume and others women products from a popular women cosmetics bland.

She will invest her new loan to increase her inventory and sells more products tan she do now. She will use her earnings to re-invest in the business, while she saves to rebuild her house. Her biggest dream is to have a sustainable business. She thanks you all for your support!!

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and perfume from a catalog for resale

loans.name: Hanet

texts.en: Hanet is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be social. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits. She hopes that in the future, she will expand business.

loans.use: buy more stock of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Las Mashitas Group

texts.en:
Santo Tomás Chichicastenango or "Chichi" draws visitors from throughout the world due to their rich cultural traditions, stunning traditional dress and wonderful market held twice each week. The vast majority of the population is Maya K’iche and is primary language spoken there.

Eight enterprising women have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Mashitas” who are mainly textile and jewelry artists. Their products (especially traditional blouses called “huipiles”, purses, and caps) are in great demand, especially with tourists. The ladies are all married and have an average of five children. They share a common goal of seeing their children have access to the highest levels of education and enjoy a better quality of life.

Sebastiana, a 52 year old mother of 10 children, has only completed three years of formal education. She is keenly aware of the tremendous value of education and works hard so that each child has an opportunity to attend school. They are all in elementary school or high school! Sebastiana has a successful textile business and creates various styles and sizes of purses, woven cloth balls (called “hacky sacks in the U.S.), and “huipiles” or traditional colorful blouses.

Due to the popularity of her textiles, Sebastiana is requesting a loan from Kiva investors to purchase more supplies, increase and diversify her inventory. She would like to buy 3,000 balls for “hacky sacks”, a good quantity of purses and caps all to meet the demand of her clientele. Sebastiana has already completed three loan cycles with Friendship Bridge. She has successfully managed her loans to firmly establish herself as a credible businesswoman, increased her earnings and diversified her inventory of textiles.

Sebastiana and her friends in the Trust Bank extend their thanks to Kiva investors from throughout the world for the kindness and generosity in funding these much-needed loans. The ladies are slowly opening the door to a more prosperous and brighter tomorrow benefitting themselves, their families and their community in Chichicastenango, Guatemala.

loans.use: to buy 3,000 balls for “hacky sacks”, a good quantity of purses and caps for her textile business.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es: Flor tiene 41 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos de 12 años y 4 años de edad a quienes están dándoles todo el cuido necesario, es una mujer trabajadora que siempre busca la manera de salir adelante para que no les falte lo necesario el esposo también aporta para los gastos del hogar, Flor se dedica a prestar sus servicios en un centro educativo como maestra lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia y sostener la economía del su hogar. Flor desea instalar tuberías de aguas negras en su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tubos, pegamento, cemento, arena, mano de obra ya que quiere brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Flor is 41 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and two small children who are 12 and 4 years old. They are giving their children all the care that they need. She is a hardworking woman and is always looking for ways to progress so that her children do not want for anything. Her husband also provides an income to cover the household expenses. Flor works as a teacher at an educational centre. This has enabled her to help her family progress and to sustain her family's economy. Flor wants to install sewage pipes into her home and for this reason she is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy pipes, glue, cement, sand, and to pay for workers so that she can provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy pipes, glue, cement, sand, and to pay for workers so that she can provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
Faustino tiene 59 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,sin carga familiar en el distrito de La Peca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chchapoyas, región Amazonas, en la Sierra norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente al comercio y crianza de ganado menor.

Faustino se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su vehículo (mototaxi), actividad que realiza desde varios años, cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Faustino espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Faustino, age 59, is in a common-law marriage without dependents. He lives in the La Peca district, which is in the Chachapoyas province in the Amazonas region in the northern highlands of Peru. Life in the community is peaceful. The inhabitants mainly work in commerce and raising small livestock.

Faustino provides transportation services to passengers in his vehicle (mototaxi). He has been engaged in this business activity for several years. He has experience in the sector and very good personal and work references in the area.

The loan will be used to make repairs and for maintenance of his vehicle, which is now in bad condition. By doing this, Faustino hopes to offer his customers better service, which will generate greater earnings. This will then improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to pay for repairs and maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Ketaki

texts.en:
Ketaki is a 28-year-old, rural woman from a small village, Kururpara of Kandi in West Bengal. She is a mother of two children (a son and a daughter). Both the children are studying in different grades.

She is a housewife. Ketaki’s husband is engaged with a cottage cheese business. He buys milk from different dairy farms and prepares cottage cheese and paneer in his home to sell in the markets, as well as in the local sweetmeat shops.

Now he wants to expand his business, thus he needs abundant milk. Due to lack of adequate capital he cannot purchase enough milk. So as a responsible wife, Ketaki applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase milk in a bulk amount. She hopes this loan will give a boost in her husband’s business and improve her family’s financial status. She dreams to provide good and higher education to her children so that they can establish themselves in their future lives.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for funding her.

loans.use: to purchase milk in a large quantity from the dairy farms for the cottage cheese business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 49 years old and widowed with three children.  With one child in school, Rebecca works very hard to provide for them.

Rebecca runs a general store  in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, canned goods, junk foods, and other groceries.

Rebecca has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, canned goods, junk foods, and other groceries

loans.name: Shikha

texts.en:
Thirty-nine-year old Shikha is an enterprising lady who lives with her family in Kandi of West Bengal. Her family consists of her parents and a brother. Shikha is illiterate but can sign her name.

Shikha runs a puffed rice business. Locally, puffed rice is called "muri." Puffed rice is a type of puffed grain made from rice, commonly used in breakfast cereal or as snack foods, and served as a popular street food in India. It is usually made by heating rice kernels in a sand-filled oven. Puffed rice is very much popular in rural areas.

Shikha makes puffed rice in her home and supplies it in her neighborhood. Gradually, her customers are increasing. Now she wants to expand her business by serving more customers, which will also increase her income. But the problem she is facing is inadequate capital to invest in her business. Thus, she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy good quality rice in bulk at a wholesale rate.

Now she hopes she can satisfy her customers' demand by making more puffed rice. She expects a good profit from her business with the support of this financial help.

Shikha is grateful toward her lenders.

loans.use: To buy good quality rice and necessary materials for her puffed rice business.

loans.name: Jlg-013-Parali Group

texts.en:
Radha, a 24 year old lady having a family size of 3 leads a group of 3 in Kulithalai, Tamil Nadu. She has no access to toilets, and therefore her family to resort to open defecation using the false privacy of nearby fields and surrounding shrubbery. Due to this lack of sanitation facilities, they are at risk of infection and fall ill often, spending a significant portion of their savings on medical expenses each month. The women and daughters in their families are exposed to the additional risk of molestation.The group members come from similar backgrounds, working hard to sustain their families. 

Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for Radha and family. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. So, together, they seek a loan of Rs. 42000 to build a toilet at home. Your loan will help their families access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

loans.use: To improve sanitation facilities in their homes by installing toilets

loans.name: Risil

texts.en:
Risil is 48 years old, married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Risil has selling used clothing retail business in the Philippines. Risil requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more used clothing to offer for sale.

Risil has been in this business for three years. In the future, Risil would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to offer for sale.

loans.name: Ailen

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ailen works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Ailen is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to  buy fish nets, gasoline, and other supplies to use in her business for her fishing business.

Ailen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other supplies to use in her business

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz tiene 42 años de edad, conviviente, vive con su conyuge y su hijo en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Luz se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 8 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Luz espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luz is 42 years old and lives with her spouse and son in a rural area of Oyotún district. This is located in Chiclayo province in the region of Lambayeque, which is on the north coast of Peru. The citizens of this district primarily work in agriculture, cattle ranching and commerce.

Luz earns a living through breeding and selling small animals such as chickens, hens, ducks and turkeys amongst others. She runs her business from her own house. She has 8 years of experience in the business, and great personal and work references in the area.

The loan that she is asking for will be used to buy a larger quantity of animals like hens, ducks, turkeys, chickens and others, and also to buy balanced food for them. With this, Luz hopes to offer a better product to her clients which will allow her to generate more income and finally increase her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals and balanced food for them.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge es un estudiante de la carrera de administración de empresas, por medio de su carrera quiere abrirse camino y ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Es un estudiante responsable, comenta que proviene de una familia muy luchadora y emprendedora que lucha.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con su estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Jorge is a business administration student. He hopes his studies will open the door for him and help his loved ones.

He is a responsible student. He said it comes from a hardworking and enterprising family that fights for success.

He is requesting this loan to pay university fees, so that he can continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Mrs Nhung is 46 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture as a farmer for more than 10 years. Nhung lives in Tinh Gia district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the income from this job is not high enough to cover the life cost and for her to save money.

One of the most critical difficulties is that her latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.
This is Nhung first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her small dream come true.
With her business profit, Nhung hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Cosmenita

texts.en:
Cosmenita is 48 years old and has nine children. Cosmenita is married and has four children who are in school.

Cosmenita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Cosmenita requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Cosmenita has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cosmenita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lourdes is 55 years old now.

Lourdes has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Lourdes has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Lourdes would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Azizahan

texts.ru: Азизахан, 50 лет, есть 5 детей, замужем. Образование у нее среднее, работает в школе учителем начальных классов, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, стартовав в 1985 году. Благодаря упорному труду Азизахан, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы, 2 овцы. На 1,03 Га земли выращивает кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Азизахан обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, также мечтает открыть продуктовый магазин рядом с домом.
texts.en:
Azizahan is 50 and married with five children. She has a high school education and works as a schoolteacher for younger grades. She also works in animal husbandry as an additional source of income for her family, a business she started in 1985. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has two cows and two sheep on her farm as well as 1.03 hectares of land where she grows corn. Her monthly income is about 9,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Azizahan has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 KGS to purchase livestock for fattening and resale. She plans to put profits from the loan into further expanding her business, and also dreams of opening a grocery shop near her home.

loans.use: to buy some livestock for fattening and resale

loans.name: Rosantina

texts.en: Rosantina is applying for a loan of $1,500.00 to improve her business. She is married and she has five children. She is running a business selling shoes, socks, bags and toys in front of a main road and she is making a good income from selling shoes, socks, bags and toy.  And she wants to buy more stocks with the loan. She is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She started her business in 2011 with her own working capital of $70.00

loans.use: to buy shoes, socks, bags and toys.

loans.name: Suvalakshmi

texts.en:
Suvalakshmi is a 32-year-old woman of a small village in Kandi. She is blessed with a daughter and a son. Her daughter is a student of grade 2, and her son is now a kid. In spite of having education up to grade 6, Suvalakshmi has a keen interest to give education to their children. Her husband can just sign his name.

Suvalakshmi is busy in housekeeping, while her husband runs a small masonry business. He makes foundations (centering) for houses in their rural area. The profit that comes from this business is not sufficient for them to cover their family expenses. As his business is the only source of income for the family of four, he needs to expand his business to earn more to make both the ends meet. But the main obstacle is he lacks adequate necessary masonry tools due to inadequate capital.

Suvalakshmi always takes care for her family’s well-being and so decided to give financial support to her husband by taking the loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) so that her husband can buy more necessary supplies like cluster, wood, bamboo, ropes, a spade, a hammer and other tools for making firm foundations for houses.

She hopes the family economy will improve to provide her children’s best education to establish them and expand her husband’s masonry work. This will enable them to earn more profit, and they can hope to employ some laborers in their business.

She is very much obliged to Kiva and BJS, as they came into her life as a light of success.

loans.use: to purchase necessary masonry supplies for her husband’s mason work.

loans.name: Putul

texts.en:
Putul is a 30-year-old housewife from Raypara of Dhupguri. She is a mother of three children (one son and two daughters). Her daughters attend school, but her 16-year-old son is a daily wage laborer with no consistent income. As she is a housewife, the entire family depends on her husband's income.

Her husband deals in timber but his income is undependable. As it is very difficult to run the family with the low income, Putul is unable to provide all necessary study materials to her children. Her younger daughter, 15-year-old Lalita, is a student of grade 10 in Dhupguri uccha Balika vidyalaya. She possesses average intelligence that scored average marks in her last annual exam, for which she is investing all her time and effort to improve herself to score good marks in her first board exam, which will begin next year. Putul also likes to bring up her children to become what they wish to be in life.

As she could not afford to pay all the expenses for her daughter's education, she is requesting a loan from Kiva via BJS to give her financial assistance to pay for her daughter's school fees, private tuition fees and exam fees, and to purchase study materials and a bicycle. She also wishes to provide her children a decent education and career.

Putul and Lalita thank Kiva and BJS for being so generous and helpful.

loans.use: to afford all the expenses of her daughter's education.

loans.name: Tình

texts.en:
Mrs Tình is 32 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture farming food for more than 10 years. Tình lives in Tinh Gia district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the income from this job is not high enough to cover the life cost and for her to save money.

One of the most critical difficulties is her latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.
This is Tình first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her small dream come true.
With her business profit, Tình hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy, 34, is a married factory worker with three children, all of whom attend school.  They live in the Kampong Chhnang Province in Cambodia. She has worked in the factory since 2007. Her husband is a 40-year-old taxi driver. Sophy and her husband can earn approximately $18 per day. 

This is her second loan cycle with Kiva. Sophy’s present house is old and she would like to buy construction materials to renovate it and also to buy more soil to fill the yard around her house. 

She does not have enough finances, so she needs a loan. With this loan, she will be able to have a proper house for her family to improve their living standard. In the future, she wants to support all of her children in earning a higher education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to renovate her house.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia 32 years and she did not lose competitiveness in business. Flavia opened her business in 2011, with a capital of $500.00. 4 years of efforts already running, so now she has planned to expand her business with a bigger store.

So she is requesting a loan of $ 1,500.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. With this loan she wants to buy more goods such as water, noodles, tea, sugar, sauces, crackers, coffee, including soft and hard drinks and other things to sell. She is very hopeful with this loan she can be improving her management, so that she can be increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy water, noodles, tea, sugar, sauces, crackers, coffee, including soft and hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Noura

texts.en: Noura is 25, married and has a son and a daughter. She has a small fattening business.  After fattening the cattle, she uses the milk to create butter and cheese for sale and for domestic use. She is requesting a 5000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to expand her project.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian se esfuerza para poder ser alguien en la vida, es por ello que está estudiando y pone todo de sí para poder salir adelante. Está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería comercial, y comenta que por medio de sus estudios quiere también ayudar a su familia.
Cristian es una persona muy sacrificada que pone todo de sí para ser un buen profesional. Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de su universidad, y así continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Cristian is trying to be someone important in life and for this reason he is studying at university and is doing everything he can to improve and develop. He is studying a degree in commercial engineering and describes how he also wants to use his studies to later help his family.

Cristian is a selfless person who does everything he can in order to be a true professional. He is asking for this loan to cover his university expenses and to thus be able to carry on with his studies.

loans.use: cover his university expenses.

loans.name: Bunroeun

texts.en:
Bunroeun is 55 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She earns main income from selling sweets and snack foods and has been in this business since 2008.Her husband is a 69 year-old rice farmer. Among her four children, one is a factory worker, other one runs the delivery service and two attend school.

Bunroeun is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy a trailer for her son to run a delivery service. With this loan, she will have enough finance to buy a trailer for her son, so they will be able to have better traveling conditions and get more income. In the future, she would like to purchase a small truck for her son to run the service and send her youngest children to high school.

loans.use: to buy a trailer for her son to run a delivery service.

loans.name: Tươi

texts.en:
Mrs Tươi is 42 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture growing industrial crops for 6 years. Tươi lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is the latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build toilet.
This is Tươi first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her small dream come true.

With her business profit, Tươi hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Sokhean

texts.en:
Sokhean is a 36-year-old married mother with three children living in the Kampong Chhnang Province in Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables since 2006. Two of her children attend school. Her husband is 36 years old and he has a motorcycle with a trailer to run a taxi service. Sokhean and her husband can earn about USD12 per day. This is her second loan cycle with Kiva.

Now she would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle for her husband to run a taxi service. This loan will help her have enough finances to buy a motorcycle and have better traveling conditions. In the future, she wants to expand her business, to save money to renovate her house and support her children to go through high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her husband to run a taxi service.

loans.name: Salve

texts.en:
Salve is 41 years old and married with five children. With two children in school, Salve works very hard to provide for them.

Salve runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Salve has been in this business for 6 years. 

In the future, Salve would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Donavie

texts.en:
Donavie is 24 years old and single.  

Donavie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, eggs, canned goods, and other groceries.

Donavie has been in this business for 6 years. 

In the future, Donavie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama Mujeres Emprendedoras, este grupo se formó en la Ciudad de Santaní, se encuentran en el primer ciclo con 17 integrantes, todas mujeres humildes, trabajadoras y con deseos de superación.
Se destaca entre ellas la Sra. Ignacia, integrante de este comité, cuenta con un salón de belleza en su propia casa, realiza trabajos como cortes de cabello, peinados, tintes, maquillajes, manicura y pedicuro, aplicación de pestañas postizas entre otros. Tiene una clientela bien formada debido al buen trabajo y amabilidad. 
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su peluquería para poder seguir con su buen servicio a sus clientes, y de esa forma también poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The group called "Mujeres Emprendedoras" (Enterprising Women) was formed in the city of Santaní. It is in its first cycle and has 17 members, all of whom are humble and hardworking women that want to improve their lives.

Ignacia is a standout member of this group. She runs her own beauty salon from her home. She cuts, styles and dyes hair and also does make-up, manicures, pedicures and applies false eyelashes. She now has a well-established clientele due to her good work and her kindness.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies for her beauty salon so that she can carry on providing her clients with good service and therefore also carry on supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Her name is Nelly, aged 42, from the province of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Happily married to Nede, a driver, she has three children of whom two are in high school and the other is in elementary school. Her husband's salary as a driver is barely enough to raise a family which drove Nelly to find ways to augment their income. 

Nelly thought of starting a small general store which she has been operating for seven years. She sells dry and packaged commodities directly to consumers. All products are essential food items. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store means a lot to her family since it has helped a lot in meeting their needs.

She is now humbly seeking a Php 10,000 loan to fill her store with canned goods, instant noodles, soda, toiletries, etc. Although there are times she has difficulty collecting her receivables from some of her customers, she is still thankful that God provides for their daily needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help. 

Nelly dreams of owing a big grocery store someday and, more importantly, to see her children finish college. She values education for it is a path for them to improve their own children's quality of life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration by studying the Word of God.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is the latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build toilet.
This is Thuấn first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her small dream come true.

With her business profit, Thuấn hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy and for her children to go to school.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a man dedicated to his work. At age 44, he spends every day of the week on his mixed farm, tirelessly working. He is one of the most hardworking and dedicated men on planet earth. He is based in Kanyakine a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. He is happily married to Lydia, who adds additional income to support their family. They have 3 children.

For the past 10 years he has been engaged in mixed farming, and through selling milk, eggs and a variety of food crops he has earned a decent income. Like many farmers in his village, he also plants trees on his farm to complement the region's natural forests.

Although Paul makes profits selling his farm produce at the market, the biggest challenge he faces is lack of water to irrigate his farm and water for home consumption. Paul comes from an area where there is no water connection and he is always forced to walk for a long distance for this “precious commodity." Paul faces challenges carrying water on his back because of his failing health.

Paul is seeking a loan to buy a water tank and water pipes. Most of the farmers in Kenya depend on rain-fed agriculture but Paul wants to change that notion and start irrigation farming. Through the loan he intends to harvest rain water (which always goes to waste) and store it in the tank. He intends to buy pipes that will be used to pump water from the river directly to his farm. With your loan, Paul will be saved the trouble of walking a long distance in search of water, and he will have enough water for home consumption. Irrigating his farm will boost productivity since water is an important requirement in the germination of crops. Paul is very excited about this project and hopes his dream will be achieved through the loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders. Increased productivity means increased income and this will translate to improved living standards. He will use the additional income to improve and secure the future of his children. Paul’s hope for the future is to live a fulfilling life.
Kindly make a loan to him!

loans.use: to purchase a water tank and water pipes

Cecilia wishes to cement the floor of her home as well as put in doors and windows. This is why she is seeking a loan through FUSAI to invest in sand, cement, gravel, doors, windows, and to have better, more secure living conditions for her children.

Eufemia is 45 years old and has two children. Eufemia is married and has two children who are in school.

Eufemia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Eufemia requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Eufemia has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Eufemia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Mimi

texts.en:
Mimi is 33 years old and married with two children are presently in school. Mimi works very hard to provide for them.
