Mimi runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, shampoo, milk, drinks, spices, soap, snack foods, bread, eggs and personal care products.

Mimi has been in this business for nine years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future Mimi would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, shampoo, milk, drinks, spices, soap, snack foods, bread, eggs and personal care products.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is 46 years old and married with eight children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Theresa is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pig.

Ma. Theresa has been in this business for two years and also additional income from motorcycle transportation.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 51 years old and married with four children. Edna works very hard to provide for them.

Edna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, shampoo, milk, drinks, spices, soap, snack foods, bread, eggs and personal care products.

Edna has been in this business for 20 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, shampoo, milk, drinks, spices, soap, snack foods, bread, eggs and personal care products.

loans.name: Lelibeth

texts.en:
Lelibeth is 31 years old,and married with three children, two of whom are in school.

Lelibeth is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Lelibeth requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lelibeth has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lelibeth would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Chhieat's Group

texts.en: Chhieat’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Chhieat makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom is a 40-year-old married homemaker with five children who lives in the Takeo Province of Cambodia. Her husband is a 25-year-old construction worker. Three children attend school and two are workers.

Together, they can make approximately $15.66 per day. She has decided to take out a loan because she needs money to buy cows to fatten and breed for calves to sell. With this loan she will be able to have enough money to buy cows. 

In the future, she wants to save money to buy more cows, renovate her house and help her children to earn a higher education.

loans.use: to buy cows to fatten, and breed calves to sell.

loans.name: La Solucion Group

texts.es:
El comité LA SOLUCION, ha sido creado para trabajar en equipo y dar apoyo a cada una de ellas. Se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, actualmente son 17 integrantes, todas ellas son mujeres trabajadoras y humildes. 
Una de las integrantes que se caracteriza por ser  muy emprendedora es la Sra. Martha quien se dedica a la producción y la cría de animales, y  vende sus cultivos por la zona. Poco a poco y con sacrificio ayuda a su familia y trata de darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de balanceados para sus animales y también de semillas para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
The committee La Solucion [engl. The Solution] was created to work as a team and give support to every single member. They are on their fourth loan cycle in the Women's Committee Program. At the moment, there are 17 members and they are all hard-working and humble women.

One of the members is Martha, who is characterized by being very entrepreneurial. She is earning a living with growing plants, raising animals, and selling her crop in the area. Little by little, and with sacrifice she helps her family and tries to give them everything she could not have.

She is requesting this loan to buy food for her animals and seeds to grow.

loans.use: to buy food for animals and seeds to grow.

loans.name: Mavhash

texts.en:
Mavhash was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1995. She is single, educated, confident, honest and a punctual person. She is a teacher at a secondary school, where she has good practice and can communicate with students. She is well known among friends and colleagues.

She wants to help educate her sister, because it is not easy to find a good job now. Unfortunately she has no money to support her sister, but she has an idea to get a loan for her sister’s education. She came to IMON and requested a loan to pay her sister’s education costs at university. She is willing to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders kindness.

loans.use: to pay her sister’s education costs at university

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1966. She is married and has three children. She is experienced and challenged woman, because she passed down and high steps in her life. She started her business in small store selling CD and DVD disks. She work hard and tried to attract more clients. And now she has permanent clients who are interested to visit her store. She widens her business and rented a bigger store for trading. She increased her assortment adding toys for selling.

She feels herself bad. She is planning to get a loan from IMON and Kivato increase her business and to be treated at hospital. Half of her loan will be spend on health and rest for business. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to increase her business and to be treated at hospital and also to buy stock for her store

loans.name: Pisey

texts.en:
Pisey, 40, lives with family members in a rural village of Kratie province and is a mother of four dependent children. She needs to support three children in school. 

Pisey grows cassava to earn income to improve her family's living conditions. She also grows rice and works as a laborer for others as her additional income. 

Her cassava has not grown well, which impacts her income. She has farmed cassava for 22 years and can make about 21,000 KHR per day. For Pisey, this is her third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

She fully paid back her past loans which she used to upgrade her family’s living conditions. She will spend her loan portion to buy seed and fertilizer and pay for plowing fees to produce better yields. She hopes that she can get a good yield from her farmland to increase her family’s income more than last year.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer and pay for plowing fees to produce a good yield.

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn is 57 years old and married with six children, one of whom is.still in school.  

Bebelyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Bebelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Bebelyn has been in this business for 15 years, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Saley

texts.en:
A villager living in Kratie province, Saley is 47 years old. She is a mother of four children, three of whom are still in school. 

To support her family, she grows cassava and makes wood charcoal to sell. Moreover, she can get extra income growing soybeans. Her cassava did not grow well in this year. She has farmed cassava for 29 years and makes only 11,200 KHR per day. 

This is her first micro loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed to support better yields. She hopes that she can get a decent income from her cassava farm to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed to improve her yields.

loans.name: Korn

texts.en:
Korn is a 44-year-old woman with seven children from Kratie province. Five of her children are still dependents and four are still in school. 

She earns income to support her family by farming rice and working as a laborer for others. Her rice did not grow well because of the drought. 

For about 20 years her daily income has been about 15,200 KHR. This is her third micro loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she fully repaid her past loans. With her previous loans, she was able to upgrade her living standards and also support her children’s education. 

She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer, seed and organic pesticide to improve her yield. She hopes that her farmland produces a good yield and more income, so she can further improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seed and organic pesticide to improve her farm's yield.

loans.name: Tuychiboy

texts.en:
Tuychiboy lives in the J. Rumi region. He is 28 years old, married and has one child. Tuychiboy is a modest and hardworking person. 

He raises livestock and also does home renovations. Tuychiboy enjoys his work. Thanks to his hard work, his family has a good quality of life. Tuychiboy always takes care of his relatives. Tuychiboy is experienced in raising livestock and does this work well. 

Now is the season to expand his herd and increase his revenues. The working capital he already has is insufficient. This is why he has applied for a loan and is hoping to get assistance.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of livestock.

loans.name: Srey Ne

texts.en:
Srey Ne, 31, lives with family members in a rural village of Kratie province. She is a mother of four children, two of whom are in school. The other two are too young. 

Her family’s income is earned from rice growing and working as a labor for others. Her rice farm has been damaged by flood, so this is her main challenge in her farming. She has been involved with her rice farm for 13 years and makes a daily income of about 38,200 KHR per day. 

This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she wisely paid back her past loan. She has used her past loan to improve her living conditions. She will spend her loan to buy more farmland, seeds and fertilizer to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can earn more income from her rice crop to upgrade her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy more farmland, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of Kratie province, Sokhom is 31 years old and a mother of three children. She has grown rice as her single main source of her income for 13 years. 

The drought is the main challenge in her farming. She can earn income of about 26,800 KHR per day and can save from her daily income only 8,700 KHR per day. 

This is her second micro loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She fully repaid her past loan which she used to improve her family’s living conditions. She will use her portion of the loan to expand her farmland, buy seed and pay for plowing fees to produce more yields. 

She hopes that she can get a higher yield than before, so her family can live in better conditions.

loans.use: To expand her farmland, buy seed and pay for plowing fees to produce a better yield.

loans.name: Kheuy's Group

texts.en:
Originally of the Kratie province, Kheuy is 33 years old and married. She is a mother of three dependent children, one of whom is in school. The other two are too young. 

She earns income by growing cassava and working as a laborer for others. Her cassava did not grow well because it was destroyed by insects. She has been involved with her cassava farm for seven years. 

For Kheuy, this is her second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she fully repaid her past loan. With her previous loan, she improved her family's living conditions. 

She leads a group of four to get a new loan. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy organic pesticide to gain better yields on her farm. She hopes that she can grow more cassava than before.

loans.use: To buy organic pesticide improve her yields.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Niño Salvador Del Mundo Group

texts.es:
Niño Salvador del Mundo se llama este grupo el cual está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité de mujeres. Cada una está luchando para poder crecer en lo que cada una está haciendo para poder ayudar a su familia.
La Sra. Romina es una de las que integra este grupo, es una mujer que está capacitándose a través del programa de comité de mujeres, y participa siempre de manera muy activa. Ella se dedica a vender ropas, muy variadas y las cuales vende para poder ganarse la vida de una manera digna.
Romina es una mujer muy emprendedora que lucha y pide este préstamo para poder comprar remeras, camisas, pantalones, y otros, para poder continuar ayudando a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
"Niño Salvador del Mundo" is the name of this group which is their 5th loan cycle with the Woman's committee program. Each of the members is struggling to grow in what they are doing to be able to help their families.

Romina is one of the members of the group. She is a woman who is studying through the Woman's Committee Program and she always participates actively. She works selling a great variety of clothing which she sells in order to earn her living in a dignified manner.

Romina is a very enterprising striving woman and she is requesting this loan to be able to buy t-shirts, shirts, pants and others to continue to help her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, shirts, pants and others.

loans.name: Kun

texts.en:
Kun is 60 years old, and a married mother with five children in her care. She resides in a community in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. 

She makes some income from making clay piggy banks and other souvenirs to sell and has been in this work for over 10 years. Her husband is a 58-year-old construction foreman. 

One of her children works in a factory and other three children attend school. Together, they earn approximately $16 per day. Kun lacks the money to buy a motorcycle for her child to commute to work and for the family's use. 

With this loan, she will be able to buy a motorcycle for her child. In the future, she wants to expand her business, renovate a proper house and support her children to earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her child to commute to work and for the family's use.

loans.name: Moises 5 Group

texts.en:
Ediliana is one of the members of Moises 5. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo, in a community district called Los Alcarrizos. These five women are dedicated to working hard and developing their businesses to bring changes to their families and their community.

Ediliana makes her home in a simple structure with two of her three children. She has a partner and lives together with him. She is excited to be taking out her seventh loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She runs a beauty salon, and this loan is intended for purchasing miscellaneous hair and beauty supplies. She will use the profits to cover her home expenses and to provide her children what they need. Also, she is planning to reinvest in the success of her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy hair and beauty products.

loans.name: Nhit's Group

texts.en: Nhit’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia.  Nhit makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sokhuoen's Group

texts.en:
A mother of one child living in Kratie province, Sokhuoen is 25 years old. She grows cassava and works as a laborer for others to support her family. Insects destroyed much the cassava on her farm, so it did not grow well. 

She has been involved with her cassava for two years. For Sokhuoen, this is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She fully repaid her past loan which helped her family live better. 

She is the group leader of her group of three. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy organic pesticide to support her cassava farm to increase yields. She hopes that she can earn more income to upgrade her living standard.

loans.use: To buy organic pesticide to increase yields.

loans.name: Lim's Group

texts.en:
A local resident from Kratie province, Lim is 57 years old and a mother of six children. She earns income growing cassava and raising pigs. Her cassava did not grow well, so she has to sell it at a lower price than last year. 

She has been involved her current businesses for 39 years and makes about 34,500 KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of five to get a new loan. She will use her entire loan portion to buy more piglets and pig feed to support her pig-raising. She hopes that her business grows well and earns more income to her to upgrade her family’s living.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Gulhumor

texts.en:
Gulhumor was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1972. She is married and has three children. Her husband is an emigrant and works in Russia. For five years she has been a cook in kindergarten, as he likes children and does her cooking and meals with pleasure for the children.

She had a dream to educate her daughter at medical college as her daughter wishes to be a doctor. She heard about IMON’s service and appealed to get a loan to help pay her daughter’s tuition fee of college. She requested a loan from IMON and Kivaand awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to get a loan to help pay her daughter’s tuition fees of college where she is studying medicine with the intention of becoming a doctor.

loans.name: Sơn

texts.en:
Mrs Sơn is 54 years old and she is married She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Sơn lives in Quang Xuong district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the income from this job is unstable because when some diseases on poultry happen, she has nothing to sell and she will be in trouble with finance.

Her family has a 2 holes latrine but it is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build toilet.
This is Sơn first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her small dream come true.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Rosanie

texts.en:
Rosanie is 32 years old, married and has four children, all in school. Rosanie works very hard to provide for her family.

Rosanie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, shampoo, milk, drinks, spices, soap, snack foods, bread, eggs and personal care products.

Rosanie has been in this business for 10 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her business. 

In the future, Rosanie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, shampoo, milk, drinks, spices, soap, snack foods, bread, eggs and personal care products

loans.name: Snomie

texts.en:
Snomie is a married woman, 30 years old with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Snomie has a food vending business in the Philippines. Snomie requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients such as fish, meat, spices, cooking oil and additional utensils for her food production business.

Snomie has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as fish, meat, spices, cooking oil and additional utensils for her food production business

loans.name: Violy

texts.en:
Violy is 44 years old, married with five children.

Violy works hard to provide for her family. He runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, shampoo, milk, drinks, spices, soap, snack foods, bread, eggs and other personal care products.

Violy has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. He has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Violy aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, shampoo, milk, drinks, spices, soap, snack foods, bread, eggs and other personal care products

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en: Mao’s Group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Mao makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help group members safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Sokhoeun, 21, is a university student who lives in Battambang province. She earns income by teaching to support her family and her studies for two years. She earns about 7 USD per day. 

This is Sokhoeun's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use her entire loan portion to pay her tuition fees to pursue a bachelor's degree in banking. She hopes that she can get a good job after graduating.

loans.use: To pay her tuition fees to pursue a bachelor's degree in banking.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Saem's Group

texts.en: Saem’s Group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Saem makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help both of these women safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en: Sreymom’s Group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Sreymom makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help group members safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Cheng's Group

texts.en: Cheng’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Cheng makes a living cultivating rice. He also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Suliveta

texts.en: Suliveta is 47 years old and married with six children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as sugar, chicken, salt, sausages, and snacks. She has been doing this for three years. Suliveta needs a loan to buy toiletries, freezer goods, snacks, and a display cooler. She hopes to use her profits to expand her store. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy toiletries, freezer goods, snacks, and a display cooler.

loans.name: Sese

texts.en:
Sese is 58 years old and married woman with 8 children. She runs a small business selling ice cakes and chips in her community to earn a living and has been doing this for 3 years. Sese has requested a loan to buy sack of sugar, plastic cups, chinese candy and etc.

She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Sese will hope to support her family financially and to save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy sack of sugar, chinese candy, plastic cups etc.

loans.name: Tupito

texts.en:
Tupito is 39 years old and single woman with 1 child. She runs a small business selling chicken & chips, curry etc in her community and has been doing this for 2 years.

Tupito has requested a loan to buy boxes of chicken, potatoes, curry, rice etc. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tupito will hope to extend her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy boxes of sausages, chicken, sugar, rice, potatoes, curry etc.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
El Sr. Leonardo es dueño de un vehículo en el cual trabaja de Taxista, es una persona luchadora que se esfuerza para ganarse la vida de una manera digna y honesta.
Leonardo está esforzándose y pone todo de sí para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar cubiertas para su auto, y de esa forma poder seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Leonardo is the owner of a vehicle which he uses to work as a taxi driver. He is a fighter who makes an effort to earn his living in a dignified and honest way.

Leonardo is exerting himself and putting all his effort into being able to help his loved ones. He is requesting this loan to be able to buy tires for his car and in this way continue to provide good service to his clients.

loans.use: to buy tires for his taxi.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 49 years old, married and has seven children, four in school.

Rebecca is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer, corn seed and other farm supplies.

Rebecca has been farming corn for 20 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, corn seed and other farm supplies

loans.name: Shierlita

texts.en:
Shierlita is 62 years old and single.

Shierlita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, shampoo, milk, drinks, spices, soap, snack foods, bread, eggs and personal care products.

Shierlita has been in this business for 20 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, shampoo, milk, drinks, spices, soap, snack foods, bread, eggs and personal care products

loans.name: Evelinor

texts.en:
Evelinor is 57 years old and married with three children. Evelinor works very hard to provide for them.

Evelinor runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, shampoo, milk, drinks, spices, soap, snack foods, bread, eggs and other personal care products.

Evelinor has been in this business for 20 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, shampoo, milk, drinks, spices, soap, snack foods, bread, eggs and other personal care products

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Josephine is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts, gasoline and to pay for maintenance for motorcycle.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, gasoline and to pay for maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Mary Joy works hard to support his family.

He has a buy and sell eggs business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell cooking oil and sugar.  Mary Joy is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to  purchase more tray of eggs to sell to her local market.

Mary Joy has been sustaining her business activities through his past 2 loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help his attain his dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more tray of eggs to sell to her local market

loans.name: Seang's Group

texts.en:
Seang, 26, lives with family members in a rural village of the Battambang province. He supports his family by farming rice. He also works as a laborer for others. 

He has been involved with farming for ten years and earns about 38,400 KHR per day. 

For Seang, this is his first micro loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He leads a group of two to take new loan. He will spend his portion of the loan to purchase fertilizer and seed and to pay for plowing fees to increase his farm yield. 

He hopes that he can earn more income to upgrade his lifestyle and wants expand his farmland in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seed and to pay for plowing fee to increase his yield.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Domingos

texts.en:
Domingos built his home a few ago, with his own working capital. Now he has plans to repair it and plans to add another room. He wants to take a loan to purchase the materials to repair his house. 

He is requesting a loan of $1,500 from the Tuba Rai Metin to add to his capital. He will buy materials like sand, iron, stone, ceramic, wood, cement, and nails. He is very hopeful that with this money he can finish repairing his house.

loans.use: To buy sand, iron, stone, ceramic, wood, cement, nails and other materials.

loans.name: Idalina

texts.en: Idalina has been involved in business activities for a few years. She started with her own working capital of (USD) $400. Idalina is requesting a loan of (USD) $600 to improve her business. She sells gasoline in places where only she has this business.  She is earning a good income from this business. Idalina lives near the main road and every day many people come to buy her gasoline so she is happy with her business.  When Tuba Rai Metin offered the loan for her, she felt very happy because she can improve her business. She is taking out this loan to buy more gasoline.

loans.use: To buy gasoline.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Members of Chanthy’s group live in a rural village in the Battambang province of Cambodia. Chanthy works as farmer to support his family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and Chanthy to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for family members.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Vat's Group

texts.en: Vat’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia.Vat makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as farm laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Vuthy's Group

texts.en:
Members of Vuthy’s group live in a rural village in the Battambang province of Cambodia. Vuthy works as farmer to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Nov's Group

texts.en: Nov’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Nov makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factorty laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en: Phan’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Phan makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as seller and tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Khern's Group

texts.en: Khern’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Khern makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is a 50-year-old widowed mother with two children living in Takeo province of Cambodia. She fattens ducks and chickens at home and has been in this business since 1999. Two of her children are garment-factory workers. Together, they earn approximately $24 per day. 

This is her second loan cycle with Kiva. Phuong would like to request a loan to buy more duck and chicken feed. This loan will help her have enough feed for her chickens and ducks and earn more income. In the future, she would like to expand her fattening and build a new proper house.

loans.use: to buy more duck and chicken feed.

loans.name: Salai

texts.en:
Salai is a 34-year-old married woman with four children. She runs a small business selling chips and ice cake in her community and has been doing this for two years.

Salai requested a loan to buy a sack of sugar, salt, plastic cups, chinese candy, cordial, etc. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Salai hopes to support her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy a sack of sugar, salt, plastic cups, chinese candy, cordial, etc.

loans.name: Ida

texts.en: Ida is a 65-year-old woman who is married with ten children. She runs a business sewing and selling t-shirts and puletasi (traditional two-piece garments) in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Ida has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine, scissors, thread, materials, etc. She plans to use her profits to start a sewing shop. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, materials, scissors, thread, etc.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 46 years old and married with three children, all in school. 

Nancy is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Nancy requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Nancy has been in this business for five years, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Martinha

texts.en:
Martinha has been involving in running her livestock business since 2014, with her own working capita of $ 200. She is married. Her husband is a farmer and was very supportive of her business. 

She is requesting a loan of $600 from the Tuba Rai Metin to combine with their capital to buy more cows. She wants to expand her business. She was very happy with the loan offered by the Tuba Rai Metin, because she can increase her business.

loans.use: To buy cows.

loans.name: Jennylyn

texts.en:
Jennylyn is a 25-year-old woman with four children, three of whom are in school. 

She is a very hardworking entrepreneur with a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Jennylyn has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy variety of vegetables to sell.

Jennylyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jennylyn would like to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is 55 years old and married with eight children. Loida works very hard to provide for them.

Loida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Loida has been in this business for six years. 

In the future, Loida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Lincha

texts.en:
Lincha is a married man, and he has five children. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in an area good for retail and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

Lincha will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman with three children. She describes herself to be dedicated. She operates a retail business where she sells cabbages, carrots, potatoes, onions, and tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for five years, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the perishability of products.

Catherine will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits. Her business goal is to be a prominent business lady within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is a 35-year-old married woman with three children in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Merly has a food vending business in the Philippines. Merly has requested a PHP 5,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Merly has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Merly would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 35 years old and married with two children in school. Marife works very hard to provide for them.

Marife runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Marife has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Marife would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Marilou works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from selling vegetables. Marilou is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell.

Marilou has sustained her business activities through her one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion is 54 years old and married with five children.

Presentacion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, snakc foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

Presentacion has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF. She has been running the general store for five years and earns additional income from food vending.

Presentacion aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman, who is 52 years old with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Edna has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of ready to wear like dresses, pants, blouses, and shirts to sell to her customers.

Edna has been in this business for 30 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of ready to wear like dresses, pants, blouses, and shirts.

loans.name: Eufrosina

texts.en:
Eufrosina is 54 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Eufrosina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries. She has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Eufrosina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Manisa

texts.en:
Manisa, aged 33, is a resident of a small village of Kandi in the state of West Bengal. She lives there with her husband and two sons. They are studying in grades 11 and 10 respectively. Her husband is engaged in a bakery business.

Manisa runs a small animal husbandry and rears cows to sell milk to her neighbors and the local market. With just a little monthly income, her family is constantly at risk of falling into financial strain. Realizing that she should improve her business to give her family complete financial stability, she is keen to expand her small-scale business by selling more milk and cattle by-products like cottage cheese, cow dung, etc. She intends to buy another dairy cow to quickly scale up the size of her business. Thus, Manisa seeks a loan from Kiva's partner, BJS.

She hopes her income will increase substantially and that she will be able to provide financial sustenance to her family.

She is very much grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her milk and dairy products-selling business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 40 years old and started a business selling goats a few years ago with her own working capital of $300.  

Her husband is a farmer and was very supportive of her business. She is requesting a loan of $700 from Tuba Rai Metin to combine with her money to buy more goats. 

She was very happy with the loan offered by Tuba Rai Metin, so that she can build her business and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy goats.

loans.name: Leafa

texts.en:
Leafa is 47 years old and married woman with two children. She runs a small business selling tomatoes, beans, cucumbers, etc in her community. She has been in this business for three years. 

Leafa has requested a loan to buy chemicals, seeds, a rake, and a spade. She joined SPBD three years ago to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Leafa hopes to increase her income and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, seeds, fertilizer, a spade, and a rake.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago Catherine started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Kigumo, a remote village in the Chuka area of Kenya. 

Today, this humble mother of three children sells milk, eggs, maize and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has about farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow. That makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk sales, she lacks a proper dairy unit and is seeking a loan to build one. A good dairy unit provides a place where cows can relax and also prevents them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. 

Catherine believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have increased milk production. She will save the money she has had to use to treat her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Catherine patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To construct a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Lenah

texts.en:
Lenah, who is 60 years old, is a charismatic young woman and a strong example of hard work.

Lenah is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers throughout the food business. On her farm she keeps cows, poultry and has a small cash crop garden and trees. To earn additional income, Lenah arranges the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers and makes a commission on those sales. She has been doing this business for over a decade. She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships because reputation is everything in her line of work.

Given that Lenah can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her good understanding of market conditions and prices to sell the produce at a profit. Your loan will help Lenah’s clients to focus on production rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn a better income to uplift their livelihood.

Support Lenah's dream by giving her a loan!

loans.use: to buy products from farmers to resell.

loans.name: Tulilima

texts.en:
Tulilima is 48 years old and married with ten children. 

She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for three years. Tulilima has requested a loan to buy sacks of flour, sugar, cooking oil, fry pans, etc. 

She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tulilima will hope to start another business to increase her earning to support her family and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, yeast, cooking oil, fry pans, etc..

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.es:
El Señor Osvaldo es dueño de una chapería la cual está ubicada en un lugar estratégico de la ciudad donde tiene muchos clientes que siempre acuden hasta su negocio.
Osvaldo es una persona muy trabajadora que cumple siempre muy bien con los pedidos de sus clientes, y es por ello que le está yendo muy bien.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar herramientas para su chapería y de esa forma poder seguir esforzándose por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Osvaldo is the owner of a auto body shop which is located in a strategic place in the city where he always has lots of clients coming to his business.

Osvaldo is a very hard-working person who always fulfills the clients requests very well and because of this things are going well.

He is requesting a loan to buy tools for his auto body shop and in this way be able to continue to make an effort to improve his living conditions

loans.use: to buy tools for his auto body workshop.

loans.name: Tanushree

texts.en:
Tanushree is a 24-year-old humble and hardworking woman from Kandi. Her family comprises her husband and one son who is a toddler. Her husband is engaged with a spices business, and she is engaged with a milk-selling business.

To provide a better living, Tanushree has been engaged in cattle breeding and supplies milk to her neighbors to earn more for her family. Now this business is a strong financial support to the family. As the prices of essential commodities are increasing by leaps and bounds, she has to work hard so that she can be able to generate more income.

So, she has decided to purchase one more cow and expand her business. For this reason, she is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a dairy cow and fodder in terms of getting more milk for sale. This will enable her to provide good education to her only son and be able to expand her business with the increased profit.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Swarnalata

texts.en:
Swarnalata is a married woman living with her family in a small village, Kamarpara, in Kandi, West Bengal. She is a 47-year-old woman. Her family consists of her husband, two sons and a daughter. Her husband manages household work, her elder son is associated with masonry work, and her younger son runs a small tea stall. Her daughter is married.

Swarnalata has been engaged with a sewing business for many years. She stitches ready-made garments like blouses, petticoats, pants, shirts, frocks, etc. and sells in her local area.

Yet, the family income is insufficient to maintain the family of five, and she faces hardship to run her family smoothly. For this reason, she wants to expand her sewing work business. To fulfill her customers' demand, she has to increase her volume of sewing work and products as well. Thus, Swarnalata seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a sewing machine to enhance the volume of her business.

This would let Swarnalata increase the family's income as well as her family’s savings. With the acquired profit, she dreams to build a concrete house for her family in the future.

Swarnalata is very much thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to develop her sewing work business.

loans.name: Anatua

texts.en: Anatua is 28 years old and single with no child. She runs a small business selling pork buns in her community and has been doing this for two years. Anatua has requested a loan to buy sacks of flour, sugar, oil, frying pans, etc. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Anatua will improve her business and support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, sugar, oil, frying pans, etc.

loans.name: Faalanu

texts.en:
Faalanu is a 51-year-old married woman with five children. She owns and operates a small store, selling daily items such as sugar, salt, soap, noodles, snacks, etc.. She has been doing this for five years. 

Faalanu needs a loan to buy frozen goods, drinks, cigarettes, toiletries, snacks, a cash machine, etc.. 

She hopes to use her profits to start a new business and to extend her shop. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy frozen goods, drinks, cigarettes, toiletries, snacks, a cash machine, etc..

loans.name: Faafete

texts.en:
Faafete is 30 years old and married with three children. She runs a small business selling cabbages, cucumbers, etc. in her community. She has been doing this for three years. 

Faafete has requested a loan to buy seeds, chemicals, a rake, a spade, etc.. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Faafete hopes to provide a good education for her kids and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, seeds, fertiliser, a spade, a rake, etc.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana is a 34-year-old woman who is single with three children. 

She runs a business designing t-shirts and puletasi in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Mariana has requested a loan to buy materials such as paints, sponges, design board, etc. She plans to use her profits to increase her family's development. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, design board, paints, sponges, etc.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a married man. He has four children. 

He operates a transportation business transporting customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to service his motorcycle. His business goal is to buy a motorvehicle within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace 20 años, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside y con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para continuar con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Ana aged 46 lives in her own house with her husband and two children. For 20 years, she has dedicated to growing corn and beans; she sells her products in the surrounding areas where she lives, and with the obtained profits, she manages to get ahead. She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pest controls, herbicides, etc. to continue her work and to have better income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pest controls, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman, and she has six children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she grows maize and other crops. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate rain.

Alice will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy seeds for planting. Her business goal is to be a large scale farmer within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. She will use the anticipated profits to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from motorcycle transportation. Susan is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her tailoring business like fabric, thread, needles and maintenance for her sewing machine.

She successfully repaid her previous loans and now has requested another loan to further build her business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to  provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business like fabric, thread, needles and maintenance for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 20 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Joan runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

Joan has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Joan would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Emsan

texts.en:
Emsan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle transport business.

Emsan has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from a general store.

Emsan has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her business

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 72 years old, and married with four children.

Valentina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Valentina has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Valentina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 42 years old and has two children. She is married and her two children are in school.

Rowena is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rowena has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is 41 years old and married with one child, who is currently in school. Leila works very hard to provide for her family.

Leila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, noodles, sanitary pads, canned goods, detergent soap, etc.

Leila would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anjali

texts.en:
Thirty-two-year-old Anjali lives in a remote village, Netaji Para, of Dhupguri, West Bengal. She lives with her husband and three children (one daughter and two sons). Anjali attended school up to grade 7, but she is willing to provide her children with higher education.

Her husband has been a car driver for many years, and his earnings are hardly enough to cover the educational expenses of their children after managing the household expenses. Her younger son, Tukai, is now studying in grade 10 in Dhupguri High School (XII) and is very much serious with his studies as well as with his examinations. He is busy in his studies all day long, as he has no private tutor. Since he is going to appear for his first board exam in the next year, he needs private tuition very badly to secure a good result.

Anjali learned about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and applied for a loan for her son Tukai's smooth education and for making him a deserving student in appearing for the state board examination without any problem. With the loan amount, she will pay the private tuition fees and examination fees, and buy necessary articles like books, notebooks, pens, a geometry box, exercise copies, and a bicycle to let her son precede a step forward for achieving good skill and knowledge. She wants her son to fulfill his dream of being a teacher in the future by acquiring proper education.

Anjali and her son Tukai (in the photo) are grateful to BJS and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to purchase study materials and pay fees for her son's class 10 education.

loans.name: Marlita

texts.en:
Marlita is 54 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marlita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, peanuts, home care products, and other groceries.

Marlita has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Marlita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, peanuts, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Forty-five-year-old Parbati is an enterprising woman. She lives in Kururpara village in Kandi, West Bengal. She lives there with her husband and one son. Her son is studying in grade 10. Her husband is engaged in a grill business.

Being a housewife, the strong determination of Parbati led her to overcome the social barriers and she managed to convince her family to run a milk-selling business to provide a better life to her family members. Out of her family’s small income, she was hardly maintaining her family. For additional income, Parbati wants to purchase a dairy cow to sell milk in her locality. Thus, she has asked for a loan from Kiva's partner BJS.

With her efforts, she hopes she might increase the family's income for her family’s well-being and secure the family's future.

She conveys her thanks to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for starting her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 37 years old and married.

Daisy is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Daisy has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Daisy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wire, chemicals, seeds, weed spray, etc.

loans.name: Reinerio

texts.es:
El Sr. Reinero es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha por poder salir adelante por medio de sus ventas de hamacas, frazadas y otros productos variados. Comenta que su anterior préstamo le ha sido de mucha ayuda para poder seguir mejorando en su emprendimiento.
Reinero pide este nuevo préstamo para poder comprar nuevamente hamacas, frazadas y sábanas y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Reinero is a hard-working person who strives to get ahead through his sales of hammocks, blankets and an assortment of other products. He comments that his last loan was very helpful in being able to continue to improve his business.

Reinero is requesting this new loan to once again buy hammocks, blankets and sheets and in this way continue to struggle to improve his living conditions and those of his family.

loans.use: to buy hammocks, blankets and sheets.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be outgoing. He operates an agrovet where he sells animal feed and agrovet products. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are farmers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price changes. He will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of agrovet products. His business goal is to expand the business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his family's wellbeing. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of agrovet products.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Nkabu is a remote village in the Chuka area of Kenya where most of the villagers suffer from poverty and malnutrition. Doris is a smallholder farmer from Chuka who has been practicing farming on a small inherited piece of land for the past six years. 

To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and a variety of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in other small personal businesses. The Chuka area has a high demand for poultry products. Like many farmers from her region, Doris finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” 

Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks the funds to increase her poultry farm, so she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being from a marginalized community, she finds that accessing funds is very challenging. However, through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. 

With the loan, she will be able to provide more eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market. This will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry business to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income will be used in fully repaying the loan, permanently changing her living conditions, and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Natercia

texts.en: Natercia built her house in 1999. Now she has plans to repair her house, but she does not have enough money to buy more materials, so she is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin. She needs to buy cement, stone, sand, iron, wood, nails and other materials. She is very happy with the loan offered by Tuba Rai Metin, because with this loan she can repair her house.

loans.use: To buy cement, stone, sand, iron, wood, nails and other materials.

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Meet Jemimah. She is a smallholder farmer with extremely humble beginnings. She is based in Kerugoya in the central region of Kenya. Her upbringing was difficult. She never managed to finish her secondary education, but she is very determined to give the best life to her children.

Ten years ago, Jemimah started farming on her husband's quarter-acre farm. She did it mostly for subsistence until recently. She keeps a dairy cow that gives her ten liters of milk every day to sell. She also grows vegetables that she uses to prepare food and also to sell.

Jemimah is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy goat. The goat will produce additional milk to sell. This investment will not only double the income that Jemimah is making from milk, but will also mitigate risks associated with having just one productive cow. The additional income will enable her to comfortably handle food and education costs, which are her highest expenses. Consider lending a loan to Jemimah to help her improve her economic activity.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy goat.

loans.name: Sandhya

texts.en:
Fifty-year-old Sandhya hails from a small village of Kandi. She is blessed with four children (a son and three daughters). Her three daughters are married, and her son is a driver.

Sandhya and her husband are associated with a cottage cheese business. Sandhya actively helps her husband in the cottage cheese-making process. Cottage cheese is made from whole, part-skimmed, or skimmed pasteurized cows' milk. It is locally known as “chhana” and makes a delicious light breakfast or lunch in rural areas.

They purchase cows' milk in large quantity and prepare cottage cheese at her home; then sell it to the local market. There is a huge demand for this product in her rural area. Now she wants to enhance her business, but the main challenge is her lack of capital. So, Sandhya seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy cows' milk and other necessary ingredients on a large scale for more production.

She hopes she will earn more profit for her family’s well-being. In the future, she dreams to construct a new concrete house for them.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase cows' milk and necessary ingredients for their cottage cheese business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she grows maize and other crops. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area for farming and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy seeds for planting. Her business goal is to be a large scale farmer within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to buy land.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia is a 37-year-old woman who is married with six children. She runs a business sewing and selling clothes in her community. She has four years of experience with this business. 

Apolonia has requested a loan to buy materials, a sewing machine, needles, thread, etc. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and to support her family financially. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, sewing machine, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Mousumi

texts.en:
Twenty-year-old Mousumi is a cheerful and hardworking woman. She is married and has one son. She raises her son together with her husband. They live in a small village of Kandi in Murshidabad District.

Mousumi’s husband is engaged in the almirah (a type of furniture) business. His earnings are hardly sufficient to cover all the household expenses. So, to assist her husband financially, Mousumi is involved in a business of sewing. She sews varieties of garments like blouses, petticoats, pants, etc. Her neighbors are her main customers. They appreciate her work. Thus, she has goodwill in her neighborhood.

Currently, she would like to purchase a more modern sewing machine, which will work better and stitch higher-quality clothing. So, she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

She hopes for a better income and to ensure financial stability in her family. This will enable her to fulfill her dream of providing a good education to her only son.

Mousumi is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for her existing sewing work business.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia works hard to support her family. Basilia is married and has a bamboo weaving business in the Philippines.

Basilia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of bamboo for her business.

Basilia has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Basilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bamboo for her business.

loans.name: Antoliano

texts.es:
El Sr. Antoliano es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha por poder crecer y salir adelante, trabaja y se esta esforzando para poder mejorar cada día. El utilizo su anterior préstamo para poder mejorar y seguir ayudando a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder arreglar nuevamente su taxi, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir mejorando.
texts.en: Antoliano is a very hardworking person who struggles to grow and move forward. He is working and putting much effort to improve every day. He used his previous loan to get better and keep on helping his family. He is requesting this loan to fix his taxi once more, and in this way continue working as he has been doing so far. He is grateful for this new opportunity to keep on getting better.

loans.use: to pay for expenses to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is a married woman with three children. She describes herself to be intelligent. 

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour, cereals and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread and other items. Her business goal is to expand business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, flour, bread and other items.

loans.name: Ibraheem

texts.en:
Ibraheem is a 23-year-old single man from Jabalia city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and regularly suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. 

Because he is not able to save enough money, Ibraheem took a USD loan from FATEN.  With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower. This can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. The solar system will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy is 49 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Remy works very hard to provide for her family.

Remy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, such as junk food, canned goods, and other groceries.

Remy has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like junk food, canned goods, and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena started her business of selling rice in 2014 with her own working capital of $200.00. She had a lot of difficulties because she did not have good management to run her business, so she had the idea to request a loan of $ 700.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her management. She said with the borrowed money she could count the income and expenditure in one day. 

Elena is taking this loan because she wants to use it to buy more rice, so that people who need to buy any rice can come in her home,. She has been busy with her business and she is happy to do that.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Taeao

texts.en:
Taeao is 51 years old and married with seven children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for three years. 

Taeao has requested a loan to buy sacks of flour, sugar, oil, frying pans, etc. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Taeao will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, sugar, oil, frying pans, etc.

loans.name: Elvio

texts.es:
Elvio es una persona muy trabajadora, que se esta ganado la vida a través de su carpintería, hace ya un buen tiempo que se dedica a este trabajo y de esa forma se gana la vida de una manera honrada y ayuda a su familia a darles todo lo que el no pudo tener.
Comenta que su anterior préstamo le ha servido para poder comprar insumos para su carpintería, y seguir con su trabajo. Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar madera, clavos, y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con el negocio de su carpintería.
texts.en: Elvio is a very hardworking person. He earns his living through carpentry. For a long time already, he has worked in this job. This way he makes his living in an honest way and helps his family to give them all he could not have. He comments that he used his previous loan to buy inputs for carpentry and continue with his work. Today, he is asking for a new loan to buy wood, nails, and other things, and in this way to be able to continue with his carpentry business.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails and other things.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 25 years old with one child. She runs a small business selling buns, doughnuts, meat pies, etc. in her community. She has been doing this for two years. Jane has requested a loan to buy flour, rice, sugar, chicken, etc. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Jane will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, sugar, chickens, etc.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 35 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She operates a food vending business in order to support the daily needs of her family. She started her business 10 years ago. 

Juliet requested a loan, which she will use to buy raw ingredients to prepare food to sell. This loan will allow her to continue serving a greater variety of food to satisfy her customers' tastes and needs, resulting in higher sales and income. Juliet will have more financial stability and enjoy a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 19-year-old, from Deir Al-Balah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, next to the refugee camp with the same name. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income.
