This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

So, Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Ahmad’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 52 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, Sonia works very hard to provide for her family.

Sonia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as candles, bread, home care products, and other groceries.

Sonia has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Sonia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as candles, bread, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita is 65-year-old widow with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Purita has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines, and has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more used clothes for resale.

Purita has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Elesia

texts.en:
Elisa is 48 years old and married.

Elisa is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Elisa has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Elisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 54 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Adelaida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy school supplies, junk food, and other groceries for her store.

Adelaida has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, junk food, and other groceries for her store.

loans.name: Terencia

texts.en:
Terencia is a 52-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Terencia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for food production.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Terencia has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Terencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Gladys Mae

texts.en:
Gladys Mae is a 41-year-old married woman with two children in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Gladys Mae has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like spices, noodles, fish, meat, etc. for her business.

Gladys Mae has been in this business for one year. In the future, Gladys Mae would like to save enough to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like spices, noodles, fish, meat, etc..

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cordials, bags of sugar, foam cups,a freezer, etc.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.en:
Khurshed is a careful father. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1966. He is living in a remote district with his family. He is married and has one teenage child. 

For about a year he has worked at a closed joint stock company as an engineer. He likes his job and tries to work well. 

He wants to educate his son. His son is going to enter the university. Khurshed has requested a loan to pay his son’s education costs at university. He hopes to be supported by KIVA lenders and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to pay his son’s education costs at university.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is 27 years old and married with four children. With all four children in school, Belen works very hard to provide for her family.

Belen has a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Belen has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items, such as sugar, soap, canned goods, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna is 50 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Paterna runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, school supplies, and other groceries.

Paterna has been in this business for 20 years. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Paterna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, school supplies, and other groceries.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is a 51-year-old married woman with seven children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Amelita has a buy-and-sell ice cream business in the Philippines and requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ice cream to sell, as well as other supplies to use in her business.

Amelita has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ice cream to sell, as well as other supplies to use in her business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Lydia, 46 years of age, a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Gatwe, a remote village in Kerugoya. She is happily married and is blessed with three adorable children. 

Lydia has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. 

The Kerugoya area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. 

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and that she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. 

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Pascoela

texts.en:
Pascoela is 53 years old. She is very interested in her business, so that she is not overly dependent on her husband to be responsible for the household. 

She has a kiosk and is always busy with her business. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to combine with her capital to buy more goods such as detergents, cooking oils, slippers, notebooks, sugar, water, biscuits, eggs, milk, pens, noodles, soft drinks and other things to sell. 

She has plans to open a bigger business in the future. The first time she opened her business was in 2013 with a capital base of $500.

loans.use: To buy detergent, cooking oils, slippers, note books, sugar, water, biscuits, eggs, milk, pens, noodles, soft drinks and other things.

loans.name: Telesase

texts.en:
Telesase is 20 years old and single with no children. She runs a small business selling chips in her community and has been doing this for two years. 

Telesase has requested a loan to buy oil, a cooking pot, paper, bananas, etc. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Telesase will improve her business and support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy paper, bananas, oil, cooking pots, etc.

loans.name: Umu

texts.en:
Umu is 58 years old and a widow with five children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for four years. 

Umu has requested a loan to buy sacks of flour, sugar, oil, frying pans, etc. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Umu will use it to improve her business and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, sugar, oil, cooking pots, etc.

loans.name: Kifah

texts.en:
Kifah is 36 years old and divorced, living in a house that she owns. She has had a beauty salon in her home for one year. 

Kifah has many customers as she does a very good job. With her profits, Kifah is able to move forward with her family. She is applying for a loan in order to buy products for her beauty salon, such as creams, shampoo, scissors, hair pins and other things that she needs. With these items, Kifah can earn higher profits, thus giving her greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy products for her beauty salon,

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El Señor Julio es de la ciudad de Santaní, es dueño de una despensa y también de una muy surtida mercería. El Sr. Julio es una persona trabajadora, responsable y muy honesta, comenta que empezó a trabajar con un pequeño kiosco ventas de comidas rápidas y poco a poco ha podido mejorar su vida.
Julio es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser verduras, carnes, panificados, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Julio is from the city of Santaní. He owns a grocery store and also one for general merchandise. Julio is a hard-working person, responsible and honest. He explains that he began working from a small kiosk, selling fast food and little by little has been able to improve his life.

Julio is a very hard-working person, who struggles and does his best to be able to grow and get ahead. He is asking for thiis loan to buy materials for his grocery store, including vegetables, meats, and baked goods, so as to be able to continue with the sales he is achieving.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, baked goods, etc.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie is 39 years old, married and has four children who attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Girlie operates a snack food vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years. 

Girlie requested a loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more snack foods to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 36 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Josephine has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bicycle for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Josephine has been in this business for five years. In the future, Josephine would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bicycle for her business.

loans.name: Phearun's Group

texts.en:
Phearun is 24 years old and living in the Siem Reap district of Siem Reap province. He is a married father of a small child who is under school age. He has worked as a construction worker to support his family for five years. He earns around 42,000 KHR per day and saves about 10,000 KHR each day after his family’s expenses. 

Phearun has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one cycle already and he repaid the loan successfully. He has better living condition because of his past loan. 

He has decided to take a new loan via VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. He is the group leader of a group of three. Through this loan, he will renovate his old house for his family.  He hopes this second loan will enable him to provide all his family members a healthy and hygienic environment so that it will reduce the cost of health care.

loans.use: to renovate his old house for his family.

location.town: Siem Reap district, Siem Reap province

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El Señor Pedro es de la ciudad de Santaní, él se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de corral, por medio de su trabajo se gana la vida de una manera digna y sin privaciones como las que él tuvo que atravesar.
Es un señor muy trabajador, responsable y muy honesto, comenta que tiene una despensa bien surtida en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas, hasta muy tarde en la noche.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar bebidas, frutas, verduras, panificados, y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas, y cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Pedro is from the city of Santaní, he makes a living raising and selling poultry, through his work he makes an honest living and no longer suffers the deprivation that he had to overcome.

He is a very hardworking, responsible and honest man, he says that he has a well-stocked store and that every day he works from very early in the morning until very late at night.

He is requesting this loan to be able to buy drinks, fruit, vegetables, bread, and other items, and this way he can continue with his sales, and can fulfil his customers’ orders as they come in.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, bread and other items.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer de 41 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos de 4, 8, 11 y 14 años, y su negocio es la sastrería.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, dedicada, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad Caracterizada por su belleza natural, diversidad de especies, y condiciones óptimas para la práctica de deportes extremos. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados. 
Isabel es de tez trigueña, ojos pardos, cabello castaño largo, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (al centro, viste una bufanda marrón). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como transportista asalariado y con sus hijos; los 3 mayores estudian en la escuela y el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa propia construida de madera con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. 
Debido a la necesidad de mejorar sus ingresos formó una banca de personas con negocios como; panadería, artesanía en yeso, venta de queso, venta de comida, confección de tejidos, venta de salteñas y venta de productos médicos naturales, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la sastrería; dónde su creatividad y experiencia se ajustan a la medida de sus clientes. Entre paños, linos, agujas y moldes han transcurrido los últimos 10 años, ella confecciona pantalones y chaquetas a medida y también modifica todo tipo de prendas según el capricho de sus clientes. En la mesa de corte es donde comienza la aventura; con agilidad, precisión, rapidez, esmero y dedicación, el resultado es una prenda de vestir hecha a la medida, “confecciono todo tipo de prendas, también realizo arreglos como subida de bota pie, ancho de cintura, ancho de espalda…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con cliente continuos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una máquina de coser industrial. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio,  ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de una máquina de coser industrial para reponer su máquina antigua. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Isabel solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser industrial para reponer su antigua máquina y continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Isabel is a woman of 41. She is married and has four children, ages 4, 8, 11, and 14. Her business is tailoring.

She is a good mother, entrepreneurial, dedicated, patient, responsible, and very hard-working. She runs her business in the southern zone of the city. The area is] characterized by its natural beauty, diversity of species, and optimal conditions for the practice of extreme sports. It has a warm, subtropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 21 and 35 degrees [centigrade].

Isabel has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long brown hair, short stature, and a robust physical build. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks in her area, and she speaks Spanish because of general culture and for her business. (She is in the center, wearing a brown scarf.) She shares her life with her husband, who works as a salaried driver, and with her children. The three older ones go to school, and the youngest is still not of school age. They live in a house of their own, which is made of wood with a tile roof and cement floor. It has potable water, electrical energy, and sewer service.

Because of the need to improve their income, she formed a bank with people with businesses such as a bakery, artesania in plaster, selling cheese, selling food, making knitted wear, selling meat pies, and selling natural medical products in order to apply for a loan and improve their businesses. Her business is tailoring, where her creativity and experience adjust [articles of clothing] to the measurements of her customers. The last ten years have been spent among fabrics, linens, needles, and forms. She makes pants and jackets to measure, and she also modifies every type of clothing according to the whims of her customers. The cutting table is where the adventure begins, with agility, precision, speed, care, and dedication. The result is an article of clothing that is made to measure. "I make every type of clothing. I also do alterations such as raising pants hems, expanding the waist, or expanding the back," she comments. 

The good thing about her business is that she has long-term customers. The problem is the lack of capital for the purchase of an industrial sewing machine. Her dream is to improve her business. She wants to expand her business through the purchase of an industrial sewing machine to replace her old machine. This is her second loan sequence with the institution in the 10 years that she has had this business independently.  It is for these reasons that Isabel is applying for a loan for the purchase of an industrial sewing machine to replace her old machine.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine to replace her old machine.

loans.name: Noche Buena Group

texts.es:
La primera locomotora de vapor que recorría las vías trasportando pasajeros  fue “La Prieta Linda”  iniciando con el crecimiento de la ranchería hasta convertirlo en municipio, con el paso de los años el tren dejo de ser un medio de trasporte (pasajeros) para transportar azúcar, por ello la bestia continua recorriendo las vías.

En una de las colonias de la novia de sol se ha formado un grupo el cual lleva por nombre “noche buena” las clientas lo eligieron pues la flor llamada noche buena les agrada, por lo que se identifican con dicho nombre.

El grupo está integrado por:

Elsa – Elotes Y Esquites
Marlen -Ropa Y Calzado
Karen -Ropa 
Guadalupe, Beatriz – Antojitos 
Teresa, Sofía -Abarrotes
Josefa - Cosméticos, Elaboración Y Venta De Ladrillos.
Manuel – Bolsas De Mano Y Sillones 
Adriana –Club Nutricional

Por las mañanas es  una ama de casa normal, atiende las labores del hogar, el lonche de su hijo, después de mediodía inicia su labor como vendedora, pone a hervir  los elotes, otros más los rebana para el esquite,  en una tarja acomoda: servilletas, mayonesa, limón, chile, palitos para elote,  vasos, cucharas, sal, la mesa, posteriormente las vaporeras,  para trasladarse al centro y alistar su puesto todo ellos lo hace Elsa una mujer emprendedora de 28 años y madre soltera de 2 hijos.

Desde hace 15 años Elsa ayudaba a la señora de la casa donde vivía pues ella era quien vendía elotes, chicharrones y esquites al principio para Elsa era difícil servir los esquites pues se quemaba con el caldo, al poner el elote en el palo se quemaba las manos, mas a basase de sacrificios y motivada por la señora quien le decía “eres como mi hija y el día que yo falte quiero tu continúes con el negocio” siendo esas las palabras que siempre están en la mente de Elsa, dando  todo cuanto puede, uno puede disfrutar de un elote, esquite o chicharrón a partir de las 5:00 pm que es cuando el puesto está listo y es recogido a las 9:00 pm hora promedio en que se termina lo que lleva.

Con las ganancias obtenidas solventa los gastos del hogar, reinvierte en la compra de elotes, queso, crema, picante, palos, vasos, servilletas de acuerdo a su requerimiento.

El préstamo anterior lo invirtió en la compra de elotes, queso, crema, gas y un nuevo quemador para mantener calientes los elotes, pretendía iniciar con la venta de ropa interior para dama más la situación económica le hizo invertir el 100% de préstamo en su actividad, en esta ocasión comprara elotes, crema, queso, picante, limones, vasos, servilletas en ,mayor cantidad.

“soy la mujer más feliz del mundo al ver contentos a mis hijos y solventar los gastos del hogar, gracias  a cada una de las personas que hace posible se nos otorguen nuevos préstamos”

*Ellas son las integrantes del grupo noche buena, Elsa es quien viste blusa a rayas y pantalón negro.
texts.en: The first steam locomotive That Travelled the rails Transporting passengers was "La Prieta Linda." Starting with the growth of the village Until it became a municipality, with the passage of years the train stopped Being a Means of transportation for passengers Transporting sugar, so the . continuous beast roaming the roads . In one of the colonies it has sun bride FORMED a group Which is called "good night" clients chose him as the flower called Eve pleases them, so Identify With That name The group Consists of: Elsa - Elotes And Esquites Marlen -Clothes -Clothes Footwear And Karen Guadalupe, Beatriz - Antojitos Teresa, Sofia -Abarrotes Josefa - Cosmetics, making and selling bricks. Manuel - Handbags & Armchairs Adriana Nutritional -Club the morning is normal housewife, housework Attend, your child's lunch, after noon ITS Begins work as a saleswoman, boil the corn, others for esquite the slices in a plaque accommodates: napkins, mayonnaise, lemon, pepper, sticks to corn, cups, spoons, salt, table, Then the steamers, to move to the center and enlist His post Elsa 28 Makes them all one enterprising woman and single mother of two children. Elsa Helped 15 years the lady of the house she lived Where WHO Because she was sold corn, greaves and popcorn was at first to Elsa difficult to serve the popcorn as it burned With the broth, to put the corn on the stick burning the hands, more to basase sacrifices motivated by the WHO lady Told him "you are like my daughter and the day I want you to continue missing the business "being Those Words That are always on the minds of Elsa, giving everything I can one can enjoy a corn, or crackling esquite Which is from 5:00 pm When the office is ready and is Collected at average time at 9:00 pm Which leading ends. With the proceeds solves the household expenses, reinvest in buying corn, cheese, cream, spicy, sticks, cups, napkins According to your requirement. The previous loan was Invested in the purchase of corn, cheese, cream, and to new gas burner to keep warm the corn, Aimed to start selling underwear for women the economic situation did you spend 100% of your loan activity, This Time to buy corn, cream, cheese, spicy, lemons, glasses, napkins, more. " I am the happiest to see my children happy and solve each household expenses thanks to Woman Who Allows us to grant new loans "* They are the members of the group good night, Elsa is who wears striped blouse and black trousers.

loans.use: To buy corn on the cob, cheese, cream, spices, glasses and napkins.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: El señor Gustavo de 26 años de edad vive y trabaja actualmente en domicilio y terreno de su padres, no tiene hijos que dependen de el ni esposa, el señor Gustavo es solo vive en el departamento de Chuquisaca. Su principal actividad del señor Gustavo es la producción de miel de abeja. Es por eso que requiere un préstamo que será destinado para la compra  de materiales y equipamiento para la apicultura, con la compra de la misma empezara su actividad ya que tiene la necesidad de facilitar su trabajo con la producción de miel ya que en la zona se tiene un buen rendimiento de esta actividad por lo tanto podrá generar buenos ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida en su hogar y su diario vivir con su padre ya que esta actividad requiere de menor inversión y menos trabajo en mano de obra una vez establecida la actividad
texts.en:
Gustavo is 26 years old, and currently, he lives at his parent's home and works their land. He no children depending on him , nor does he have a wife. Gustavo lives alone in his parent's house, in the department of Chuquisaca.

Gustavo's principal occupation is the production of honey, and that is why he needs a loan for the purchase of agricultural materials and equipment. With this purchase, he will get his activity started, as he needs to facilitate his work with the production of honey because it is pretty profitable in the zone.

In this way, he will be able to generate a good income and improve his living conditions at home and in his daily life with his father, as this activity requires less investment and labor once it becomes established.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural materials and equipment in order to set up a business that will generate a better income.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en: Glenda is 33 years old, married and the mother of four children, all of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 8,500 loan from NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, personal care products, and groceries. She has been in this business for two years and would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is single and a very hard working entrepreneur. She operates a photocopy business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for one year. 

Jessica requested a loan from NWTF for 9,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional materials for her business such as bond paper, ink, etc. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials such as bond paper, ink, etc.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 61 years old and married with three children. Jovita works very hard to provide for her family.

Jovita runs a general store  in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Jovita has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future, Jovita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Lewelyn

texts.en:
Lewelyn is 53 years old and married with four children, one in school. Lewelyn works very hard to provide for her family.

Lewelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like rice, eggs, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Lewelyn has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Lewelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, eggs, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: Doña María es una clienta con 52 años de edad, casada  y tiene 5 hijos. Actualmente vive con su esposo y dos hijos. La comunidad en la que vive es rural y se llama Campo cinco de Cariari. Es una señora muy trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación. Se dedica a la venta ambulante de oro y plata laminada, también vende por catálogo. Hace varios años inició su negocio con la finalidad de ayudar a su esposo económicamente en las necesidades del hogar, debido a que el ingreso de su esposo es inestable porque su trabajo es de taxista. Fue integrante de un Banco Mujer, el cual tuvo una excelente moral de pago.  También ella tenía la necesidad tener independencia económica y sentirse bien al socializarse con las demás personas. Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y personas de su misma comunidad. Éste es el tercer crédito bajo la modalidad de crédito individual, y se ha caracterizado siempre por su excelente comportamiento de pago. Ella busca crecer y poder aportar más a su hogar, porque está pasando una situación familiar muy difícil. Ésto la motiva a invertir en más variedad de joyería y ahora en ropa de mujer, para tener más ingresos y poder cumplir con sus objetivos, el cual es ahorrar y poder construir un techo digno, asi mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria is a 52 year old, married client with 5 children. She currently lives with her husband and two children. She lives in a rural community called Campo Cinco of Cariari. She is a very hard working woman and has a strong desire for self improvement.
She makes a living as a street vendor of gold and silver leaf jewelery and supplements the job with catalog sales. Several years back she started her business with the goal of helping her husband economically with the needs at home as his income varies because he is a taxi driver. She was a member of a Woman's Bank, which had an excellent payback track record. She also had the need to have economic independence and feel good by socializing with other people. Her clients are neighbors, family members and other people in the community.
This is the third loan of the individual credit type and she has maintained an excellent habit of repayment. She is looking to grow and be able to contribute more to the household because she is going through a tough family situation. This motivates her to invest in a broader variety of jewelery and now even women's clothing in order to have more income and be able to meet her objectives. For now they are to save money and be able to build a dignified residence, improving in this way the life conditions.

loans.use: purchase fine jewelry.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 54 years old, married, and the mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who runs a a food-vending business in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan from NWTF to buy ingredients to use to make more food to sell. Jocelyn has been in this business for six years, and would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her food-making business.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 40 years old and married with one child who is in school. Luisa works very hard to provide for her family.

Luisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, snack foods, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Luisa has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Luisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, snack foods, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Ingris Bacilia

texts.es:
Ingris, de 21 años de edad, es una mujer visionaria, estudió hasta sexto grado, está acompañada y vive con su pareja, su suegra y sus cuñados, su pareja se dedica a la venta de pan dulce por toda la comunidad. 

Ingris, se dedica a la venta de productos de revista, como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes y ropa, dicho negocio lo inició en los últimos meses del año 2014, cuando una amiga la motivó a que se inscribiera y observó que le estaba yendo bastante bien, es el primer negocio independiente que tiene y le está dando buenos resultados.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar pollos, concentrado y para reestructurar una galera donde estarán alojados; pues planea también tener una crianza de pollos de engorde, porque es otro negocio muy bueno, de esa manera espera poder obtener otras fuentes de ingreso, que le ayuden a mejorar su calidad de vida.

Ingris, sueña con tener un negocio fuerte de venta de pollos, con lo cual pueda satisfacer sus necesidades personales y las de su familia.- También sueña con darle una buena calidad de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Ingris, 21, is a visionary woman who has a sixth grade education. She is married and lives with her partner, her mother-in-law and her partner's siblings. For a living, her partner sells baked goods throughout the community.

Ingris sells catalog products for a living, such as perfumes, creams, deodorant and clothing. She started this business in the final months of 2014 when a friend motivated her to enroll and she noticed that it was going quite well for her. This is the first independent business she has had and she is getting good results.

The loan she is requesting is to buy chickens, feed and to restructure the pen where they will be living. She is also planning to breed chickens to fatten, because it is another great business. This would allow her to have other sources of income which will help her improve her quality of life.

Ingris dreams of having a strong chicken selling business, with which she could meet her personal needs and those of her family. She also dreams of giving her son a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed and to restructure the pen where they will be living.

loans.name: Maria Concepta

texts.en:
Maria Concepta is a 59-year-old married mother of seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Maria Concepta has a buy-and-sell used shoes business in the Philippines. Maria Concepta requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy bundles of used shoes to sell.

Maria Concepta has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Maria Concepta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used shoes to sell

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophelia is 54 years old and widowed with four children, one in school. Ophelia works very hard to provide for her family.

Ophelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional item to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

Ophelia has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Ophelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 48 years old, married, and has one child who attends school. She works very hard to provide for them. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 24 years. 

Regina requested a loan from NWTF for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase snack foods, home care products, and other groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase snack foods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Chirla

texts.en:
Chirla works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Chirla would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Jeslie is 17 years old and studying for a Bachelor of Science degree in Business Administration. She is currently in the second year of this four-year course, and her mother has requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to pay her tuition fees for the current semester. Jeslie's plans for the future are to graduate and be gainfully employed

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Generosa works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear. Generosa is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy garments and other materials needed for her business for her tailoring business.

Generosa has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy garments and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is 55 years old, married and the mother of six children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan from NWTF to buy items to sell such as biscuits, snacks, personal care products, and other groceries. Rosalina has taken out and repaid two prior loans from NWTF and has been running her general store for ten years. She supplements her income by selling food. Rosalina's goal for the future is to save enough money  to provide a secure future to her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is a hard working husband who is engaged in the wholesaling and retailing business. Danilo is 32 years old, married, and has three children going to school. His wife is a housekeeper and his partner in managing their business.

Danilo is a dealer of soft drinks in their village. He also has a sari-sari store. Danilo rounds different villages in his motor cart to deliver and sell drinks. Danilo wants to succeed with the business they have. Through the profit they earn from the business, Danilo is able to finance their children's fees in school.

Danilo wants to sell more soft drinks and be able to extend the products he sells. Thus, he is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy soft drinks to sell. He will also use the loan to buy groceries to sell. Danilo hopes to increase his earnings and further sustain his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to sell. He will also use the loan to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma.jovena

texts.en: John Christopher is 17 years old and the oldest of three children in his family. His mother Ma.Jovena supports the family by running a general store in the Philippines. John Christopher is studying for a Bachelor of Science degree in Marine Transportation and is currently in the second year of a three-year course. Ma. Jovena is requesting a loan for PHP 4,500 to pay tuition fees for the current semester. John Christopher's plans for the future are to graduate and be gainfully employed

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Solidaria Mujer Muve Group

texts.es: Solidaria Mujer MUVE se formó hace un mes. Escogieron éste nombre que para ellas significa Mujeres Unidas Virtuosas y Esforzadas. Se formó con el objetivo de iniciar actividades productivas o reforzar las que ya la tienen. Son señoras de la comunidad de Llano Bonito, comunidad rural, que se unen para tener la facilidad de financiamiento, ya que ven la oportunidad de crecer por medio de éste. Las cinco socias desean obtener más ingresos para poder ayudar en sus hogares y salir adelante con sus familias. Algunas de las socias cuentan con salarios temporales, ya que en ocasiones trabajan en las bananeras que hay en su comunidad para poder ayudar y cubrir algunos gastos personales y de salud. Pero sin embargo éste no es obstáculo para que ellas puedan realizar sus diferentes actividades productivas, porque cuentan con el apoyo de sus familias. Damaris es una mujer jefa de hogar y con tres hijos, todos menores de edad y solo uno cursa la primaria. Vive junto con su madre, la cual le cuida a sus hijos cuando ella sale a trabajar a la bananera, debido a que es la única fuente de ingreso en su hogar y es temporal. Por éste motivo ella busca emprender la cria de pollos y tiene la facilidad de venderlos a la comunidad o fondas de las bananeras. Una de sus metas es generar ingresos y poder ahorrar para comprarse una casa y darle una estabilidad a sus hijos. Ellas quieren superación para mejorar la calidad de vida de ellas y sus familias. Las otras cuatro socias invertirán sus préstamos en la venta ambulante de ropa íntima, manualidades, productos de catálogos y cria de pollos.
texts.en:
Solidaria Mujer MUVE [Women’s Solidarity MUVE] formed a month ago. They chose this name which means Mujeres Unidas Virtuosas y Esforzadas [United, Skilled and Hardworking Women]. The group formed with the goal of starting new businesses or strengthening the ones they already have. They are women from the community of Llano Bonito, a rural community, who have joined together to have access to credit, which they see as an opportunity to grow.

The five members would like to increase their income to help in their homes and support their families to get ahead. Some of the members have seasonal salaries, because they sometimes work in the banana plantations in their community to be able to help and cover some personal or health expenses. However, this is not an obstacle that will get in the way of their realizing their different businesses, because they have the support of their families.

Damaris is a lady, and head of her household with three children, all minors and only one yet at school. She lives with her mother, who looks after the children while she goes to work in the banana plantation, because that is the only source of income in her home, and it is seasonal. For this reason she is looking to start a business raising chickens; she has the ability to sell them to the community or to the banana plantation. One of her goals is to generate income and be able to save for a house, to give stability to her children.

The women wish to make improvements to their quality of live and that of their families. The other four members will invest their loans in selling underwear, arts and crafts, catalogue products and raising chickens.

loans.use: to buy chickens and supplies

loans.name: Agustinho

texts.en:
$1,000.00 is offered to Agustinho to improve his business. He sells animals, which many people come to buy. He will buy some swine. He has been involving himrself in business activities since 2011. He feels so comfortable to run his business because he can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Agustinho independent because he can be responsible for himself and also help his family. He hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy swine

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia was married, and she was a business women. She has a small business, so he has an idea to request a loan from Tuba Rai Metin. 

She wants to make her kiosk into a bigger store, but her capital is not enough, so she is requesting a loan of $1000.00 to improve her business. She will use this loan to buy cooking oils, milk, sardines, candies, biscuits, aqua, cigarettes, including soft drinks and other things to sell. 

She started her business in 2003, with her own working capital. She is taking this loan because she also wants to improve her management for her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy cooking oils,milks,sardines,candies, biscuits, aqua, cigarettes, including soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 50 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver in a private company. They help each other to give a better way of life to their four children.

Marietta manages a hog raising business, particularly hogs for breeding. Marietta has been in this business for twenty years. That’s why she is doing her best to continue operating the business as a continual source of income as well.

Her earnings from the business serve to provide enough food for her children and sustain her children's needs in pursuing their studies. Therefore, Marietta is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy feed for her piglets and sow.

She will also use the loan to buy vaccine and pay for the veterinary who will inject her piglets. Marietta wishes for further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her piglets and sow.

loans.name: Benvida

texts.en:
This loan of $ 1000 will allow Benvida to send her son to primary secondary school. She will use the loan to pay for tuition, textbooks, and school supplies.

Benvida loves her son very much and hopes that further education will help them to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy tuition, textbooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a married woman with six children, five of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 34 years old.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.

Leonila has been in this business for three years. In the future, She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 51 years old and has five children, one of whom attends school. She is married.

Juana is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Juana has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Juana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Fe is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Augusta

texts.en: Augusta has built her house but the money is not enough to buy more materials for her house to be completed, and she was hoping for a quick finish for her house. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her capital so that she can complete her house. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more materials such as sand, stone, iron, brick, cement, nails, wood, and other materials to use. She is very happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her, because with this loan she hopes that she can complete her house.

loans.use: to buy sand, stone, iron, brick, cement, nails, wood, and other materials to use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction supplies for members to sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
This borrower's name is Marivic. She is 42 years old and from the province of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Edwin, an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker), and they have two children who are both still in high school. Although her husband is an OFW, she thought of opening a small general store to keep herself busy and to earn extra income to adequately meet the growing needs of her family.

Marivic has been operating her store for three years already. Her earnings have greatly helped cover their daily needs. She sells dry and packaged commodities directly to consumers. All products are essential food items. She earns an income by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store means a lot to her since it has been their main source of income before her husband was an OFW.

To help her expand her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to fill her store with canned goods, instant noodles, sugar, soda, candies, etc. Although there are times she has difficulty collecting her receivables from some of her customers, she still maintains her faith that they will have enough for their day-to-day needs.

Marivic dreams of having a big grocery store someday and finding more ways to increase their income. She wants her chidlen to finish their studies to allow them better opportunities in life. She faithfully meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell personal care products. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy shirts, underwear, etc., to sell for her buy and sell ready to wear business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy shirts, underwear, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Erlina

texts.en:
Erlina is 56 years old and has four children.

Erlina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Erlina requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Erlina has been in this business for 7 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Erlina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 55 years old and married with one child currently in school. Anecita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like candies, biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, beer, etc., to sell.

Anecita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, beer, etc. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like candies, biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, beer, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mirasol is 40 years old and has two children who are in school.

Mirasol has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Mirasol requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

Mirasol has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Mirasol would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Trinah

texts.en:
Trinah is a married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 38 years old. .

She has a buy and sell beverages business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of beverages to sell.

Trinah has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of beverages to sell.

loans.name: Janita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Janita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell recycled materials business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Janita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of recycled materials to sell.

Janita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of recycled materials

loans.name: Theary's Group

texts.en: Theary’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Theary works as a farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, as well as save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Agustinha

texts.en:
Agustinha is requesting a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is married and she was very interested in business. Her business is selling gasoline. She is doing this business because she earns a good income from this business and every day many people come to buy her gasoline.

She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more gasoline.

Agustinha started her involvement in business activities a few years ago; she started with her own working capital of $300.

With this loan, she hopes she can improve her business.

loans.use: To buy gasoline.

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna is 34 years old and single with two children who are still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Donna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, shampoo, milk, drinks, spices, soap, snack foods, bread, eggs and other personal care products.

Donna has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, shampoo, milk, drinks, spices, soap, snack foods, bread, eggs and other personal care products

loans.name: Dina Grace

texts.en:
Dina Grace is a single woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dina Grace is 24 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Dina Grace requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more assorted fish to sell to her local market.

Dina Grace has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more assorted fish to sell to her local market

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 68 years old. She is a married woman and the mother of three kids. She has a house of her own. Maria is a retired woman and she has a retirement fund. Maria used to be a nurse when she was working. This time Maria needs a loan to buy  construction materials such as bricks and and cement to fix her house. She hopes you can help her again.

loans.use: to buy  construction materials such as bricks and and cement to fix her house

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
San Isidro se llama este grupo que se formó en la ciudad de Curuguaty, una zona lejana de la capital del país, de difícil acceso, donde cada una de las integrantes lucha para poder crecer.
La Sra. Isabel es una de las integrantes, ella tiene su pequeño negocio de Ropas y zapatos  seminuevos ella trabaja en este  plan de negocio, tiene su local en el centro mismo de la ciudad, y por medio de su trabajo gana los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. Isabel es una mujer muy luchadora que se viene abriendo camino con lucha y sacrificio.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar ropas y calzados seminuevos para poder vender y continuar así con sus ventas.
texts.en:
San Isidro is the name of this group which was formed in the city of Curuguaty, a zone far from the country's capital, with difficult access, where each of the members struggles to be able to grow. Isabel is one of the members, she has a small business selling semi-new clothing and shoes. She works on this business plan, she has her retail space in the center of the city, and through her work, she earns the means to be able to help her family. Isabel is a very determined woman who is making her way with a lot of struggle and sacrifice.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase semi-new clothing and shoes to be able to sell and, so, continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy semi-new clothing and shoes for re-sale.

loans.name: Linda Vista 2 Group

texts.es:
En una de las comunidades cuya producción de caña de azúcar es la fuente principal de empleo, algunos adultos mayores hablan náhuatl y preservan la cultura en su vestimenta, comida típica y costumbres.

En una de las comunidades del municipio de formo un grupo  llamado “linda vista 2” pues pertenecían al grupo linda vista y no quisieron cambiar de nombre, el grupo lo integran:

Abigail – Cosméticos 
Carlota –Refresco 
Nancy - Bisutería
Rosaura – Calzado Por Catalogo
Martha – Tamales Y Chiles Rellenos
Ines - Antojitos
Maria – Ropa De Cama 
Aeropajita – Refacciones Para Electrodomésticos
Edith – Farmacia, Ropa Interior Para Dama 
Gabriela – Ropa 

Edith tiene 39 años de edad, vive con sus padres, desde hace ya 4 años Edith emprendió su propio negocio en el cual ejerce su carrera, en la calle principal puso una farmacia de similares donde además de obtener ganancias se desempeña como doctora “desde niña siempre soñé con un día ser doctora y ayudar a todos cuantos pudiera, con esfuerzo y sacrificios lo he logrado” son las palabras que la conmovieron al momento de contar la historia.

Durante los cuatro años que tiene con su farmacia apoya a sus padres con los gastos como muestra de gratitud de todo lo que han hecho por ella, este es el primer ciclo de Edith en  VFMéxico y comenta el préstamo lo invertirá en la comprar de lencería para dama por catálogo pues es su otra actividad.

La farmacia tiene un horario de 8:00 am  a 8:00 pm, da empleo a dos personas cada una en distinto turno, comenta que si algún cliente necesita consulta por la noche con gusto lo atiende en su casa o en el domicilio del paciente “lo más importante es el paciente y todo medico realiza un juramento el cual debemos respetar”
El nuevo propósito de Edith tener una franquicia de farmacias en las comunidades de difícil acceso y brindar trabajo a médicos que al igual  que ella tenga el deseo de apoyar.

“gracias por la chispa de luz que me han dado al otorgarme el préstamo sé que será el inicio de lo mejor”
Las integrantes del grupo agradecen por la nueva oportunidad que han recibido.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el consultorio donde trabaja Abigail y desde donde a su vez vende cosméticos, Edith es quien viste blusa color vino, dos de las clientas de VFMéxico están con sus hijos.
texts.en:
In one of the communities sugar cane production is the principal source of employment. Some older adults speak Náhuatl and preserve the cultural dress, food, and customs.

In one of the communities within the municipality the group called "Linda Vista 2" was formed. They belonged to the Linda Vista Group and didn't want to change the name, so they integrated. 

Abigail – Cosmetics 
Carlota –Refreshments 
Nancy - Imitation Jewelry
Rosaura – Shoe Catalog
Martha – Tamales and Chiles Rellenos
Ines - Snacks
Maria – Linens
Aeropajita – Spare parts for appliances
Edith – Pharmaceuticals and womens' lingerie
Gabriela – Clothing 

Edith is 39 years and lives at home with her parents. Four years ago Edith began to learn the business that would become her career. On the main street they put up a pharmacy where she not only generates her income but also acts as a doctor. "Since I was a little girl I always dreamed of one day becoming a doctor and helping everyone as much as possible, with determination and sacrifice it's what I've achieved" are the words that moved her telling the story.

During the four years she's had the pharmacy she's supported her parents with expenses to demonstrate her gratitude for all they've done for her. This is the first loan cycle for Edith with VF México and she states that she would invest the loan to purchase ladies' underwear for a catalog, which is her other business. 

The pharmacy's hours of operation are from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. She employs two people, each on different shifts. She says that if any customer needs consultation during the evening she gladly attends to them at her home or the patient's domicile. "The most important thing is the patient and all doctors recognize the oath that we must respect."

Edith's latest proposition is to have a franchise of pharmacies in communities that are difficult to access and to bring work to doctors that like her have the desire to help and support. 

"Thank you for the ray of light you have given by granting a loan which will be the beginning of better things to come." The members of the group thank you for the new opportunity they have received.

*The photograph was taken in the office where Abigail works and sells cosmetics. Edith is wearing the wine colored blouse, two of the group members are with their children.

loans.use: to purchase ladies' underwear for retail.

loans.name: Paz Y Bien Group

texts.es: Maria de 39 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos. Ella Pertenece a la Alcancía comunal “paz y bien” la cual lo conforman 7 socios que trabajan honradamente y con ganas de progresar. Ella hace más de 6 AÑOS que se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su pequeña bodega el cual le va muy bien. Gracias a su constante dedicación logro sacar adelante a  su familia. Su mayor deseo es ampliar su negocio y así mejorar su calidad de vida Solicitó el crédito para la compra de arroz azúcar menestras y fideos. La Alcancía “paz y bien” agradece a los Inversionistas de Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Maria es la primera del lado izquierdo viste polo a rayas.
texts.en: 39-year-old María lives with her partner and has 2 children. She belongs to the "Paz y bien" communal bank, whose 7 members work are honest workers who very much want to make progress. She has been selling groceries in her small shop for 6 years and the business is doing very well. Thanks to her unstinting dedication she has managed to support her family. Her greatest wish is to develop her business and thereby improve her quality of life. She has requested the loan to buy rice, sugar, vegetables and noodles. The "Paz y bien" communal bank thanks Kiva lender for the support they provide. In the photo, María is the first on the left and is wearing a striped top.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans and noodles

loans.name: Jecel

texts.en:
Jecel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jecel is 31 years old and has one child still in school.

Jecel has a beauty parlor business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a stock of beauty products and materials for her beauty parlor business.

Jecel has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of beauty products and materials for her beauty parlor business.

loans.name: Naren Andrea

texts.es:
Naren es una joven de 21 años de edad con hambre de triunfo, una persona que decidió volverse emprendedora porque quiere cambiar su realidad, ella aspira a estudiar, apoyar a sus padres, ser reconocida como una gran empresaria y está dando los primeros pinitos en la actividad de cría de aves.

Al ser tan joven pocas entidades confían en ella y para Naren le es difícil conseguir ese apoyo económico para invertir en su negocio, tocando puertas, llego a interactuar donde encontró un si te apoyo, y ahora con mucha alegría desea solicitar un apoyo económico para la compra de pollos, alimento de engorde y materiales para adecuar sus galpones y ampliarlos.

Esta joven no quiere parar, espera progresar diariamente y junto con interactuar llegar a ser una gran empresaria.
texts.en:
Naren is a 21-year-old young adult who is hungry for success, a person who decided to become an entrepreneur because she wants to change her reality. She aspires to study, help her parents, and be recognized as a great entrepreneur. She is taking her first steps in the business of raising poultry.

Because she is so young, few entities believe in Naren. For her, it is difficult to obtain financial support to invest in her business. Knocking on doors, she arrived at Interactuar, where she found a "yes, we will help you". Now, with much joy, she would like to request financial support to buy chickens, chicken feed, and materials to adapt and extend her pens.

This young woman does not want to stop. She hopes to progress every day, and along with Interactuar, become a great entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed, and to adapt and expand the chicken pens.

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es:
José, de 32 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene dos hijos de 8 y 5 años de edad y están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad.

José, se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería desde hace 15 años, esta actividad la aprendió de su padre, pero además tiene un grupo musical y cubren eventos en los pueblos cercanos.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar pasto para el ganado, porque debido a la sequía, se le termino el pasto que tenía y no a podido sembrar maicillo para hacer silos. 

José, sueña con incrementar su ganadería y tener mayores ganancias y mejorar el nivel de vida para sus hijos; además quiere procesar leche y comercializar con lácteos.
texts.en:
José, 32, has a partner and two children, ages 8 and 5, who go to the community school. José has been working in agriculture and raising cattle for 15 years. He learned this skill from his father, but he also has a band that plays at events in nearby towns. 

He needs this loan to buy grass for his cattle, because due to the drought, the grass he had ran out, and he has not been able to plant sorghum for silage.  José dreams of expanding his herd and having greater profits to improve his children's quality of life. He also wants to process milk and sell dairy products.

loans.use: to buy grass for his cattle.

loans.name: Hernan Ernesto

texts.es:
Hernán es un hombre de 49 años de edad, con deseos y anhelos de iniciar un negocio propio, es padre de 3 hijos, vive con su pareja y su aspiración es iniciar a trabajar rápidamente su propia empresa.

Hernán cuenta con un lote para tener un parqueadero, pero necesita un capital para cercarlo, poner un portón y un servicio de lavado y es ese el motivo por el cual solicita un préstamo ya que con el dinero logrará implementar lo que necesita y un valor agregado es que generara un empleo de tiempo completo.

Apoya a un empresario que tiene como sueño darle una excelente calidad de vida a su familia, un apoyo no solo beneficiara al señor Hernán, ayudara a crear un empleo de tiempo completo.
texts.en:
Hernán is a 49 year-old man with wishes and desires to begin his own business. He is a father of three children and lives with his partner. His aspiration is to quickly start working on his own business. 

Hernán has a lot where he can have a parking lot, but he needs capital to fence it in, and install a gate and a washroom, and this is why he is asking for a loan. With the money he will be able to implement what he needs and an added bonus is that he will create one full time job as well. 

Support an entrepreneur whose dream is to give an excellent quality of life to his family. This support will not only benefit Hernán, but will also help create full time employment for someone.

loans.use: to start a parking business; he has the land, but needs to fence it in, and install a gate and other small details.

loans.name: Mayra Gisela

texts.es:
Mayra, de 35 años de edad, es una persona muy dedicada a realizar su trabajo de sastrería y cosmetología como profesión, también se dedica a la venta de ropa, es dueña de un bazar donde ofrece a sus clientes ropa y perfumería, todo lo ha logrado tener gracias a créditos, está casada y es madre de 1 hijo.

Mayra, tiene 10 años de experiencia en realizar estas actividades, de esta manera ha podido salir adelante y a pagado los estudios de su hijo y solventar sus compromisos crediticos, de esta manera mantiene un buen record e historial de pagos y es caracterizada en su comunidad, como una persona muy responsable. 

El dinero será utilizado para comprar más ropa y perfumes para su negocio, todo para tener más variedad de productos y mejorar las instalaciones de su bazar, de esta manera mejorara sus ingresos económicos.- En la fotografía ella sale mostrando los perfumes que vende.

Las metas que tiene a futuro son, tener mejores instalaciones para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y colocar un salón de belleza en otro municipio.
texts.en:
Mayra is 35, married and has one child. She is very dedicated to her work as a seamstress and cosmetologist. She also makes her living selling clothes as well as owning a boutique where she sells clothing and perfume. She has been able to do all of this with credit.

Mayra has 10 years of experience in this line of work so she has been able to get by, pay for her child's schooling and pay off her loans. As such she has maintained a good credit history and is considered to be a very responsible person within the community.

This money will be used to buy more clothing and perfumes for her business in order to provide a greater variety of products and improve the inventory of her boutique and thus improve her income. Her goals for the future are to have greater inventory to better serve her clients and to open a beauty salon in another municipality.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Concepción, de 51 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, todos son independientes, su esposo se dedica a hacer viajes en su pick-up y también se dedica a la pesca artesanal, porque viven cerca del estero, con ella viven 4 nietas menores de edad y todas asisten a la escuela.

Concepción, tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace 4 años, antes vendía frutas y verduras de manera ambulante, pero por la delincuencia dejo de vender de esa manera y fue en ese momento en que inicio con su tienda.- Su esposo sale a pescar 2 veces por semana y el pescado que consigue es para su alimentación y el excedente lo venden a los vecinos y por las tardes asiste a la iglesia con su esposo y sus nietas.- En la fotografía ella sale mostrando la red con la que pesca su esposo, que es una de las fuentes de ingresos de su familia. 

Concepción, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos para su tienda como jabón, detergente, lejía, shampoo, pan, arroz y café, de esa manera tendrá todo lo que sus clientes necesitan y con esto ayudara a que sus ingresos sean seguros.

Concepción, sueña con ver a sus nietas convertidas en profesionales.
texts.en:
Concepción is 51 years old and went to school until the second grade. She is married and has three sons all of whom have left home. Her husband makes a living doing trips in his pick-up and artisanal fishing as they live near the estuary. Her four young granddaughters live with her and they all go to school.
Concepción has run a small shop for the last 4 years. She used to sell fruit and vegetables on the street but stopped doing this because of the level of crime; it was at this point that she set up her shop.
Her husband goes fishing twice a week, they eat the fish he catches and sell the surplus to their neighbors . In the evenings she goes to church with her husband and granddaughters. She is photographed here showing the net that her husband fishes with, which is one of the family's key sources of income.
Concepción needs a loan to buy supplies for her shop such as soap, detergent, bleach, shampoo, bread , rice and coffee. This will allow her to have everything in stock that her customers require and help secure her income. Concepción's dream is to see her granddaughters become professionals.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her shop, such as soap, detergent, bleach, shampoo, bread, rice and coffee.

loans.name: Theary's Group

texts.en: Theary’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Theary works as a farmer and she also does extra work as a seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Karla Yaneth

texts.es:
Karla, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja como motorista, tienen 2 hijos y están estudiando.

Karla, desde hace un año tiene un comedor, la necesidad y el deseo de ayudar a su pareja la motivo a colocar este negocio; antes vendía tostada de plátano, enchiladas y refrescos, pero lo hacia de casa en casa, hoy lo hace en un solo lugar, la ubicación del comedor es a 2 kilómetros de su casa y su jornada comienza a las 4:00 a.m. para preparar lo que va a llevar, porque a las 6:30 a.m. ya tiene que haber hecho los desayunos para sus clientes.

El crédito sera invertido para comprar una mesa, sillas, bebidas, golosinas y pan para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Su sueño es ver graduarse a sus hijos de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Karla is 34 years old. She went to school until third grade. She lives with her life partner who works as a motorcyclist. They have two children who attend school.

For over a year Karla has been running a cafeteria. She started up this business out of necessity and due to her desire to help her husband out. Previously she sold toasted banana, enchiladas and soft drinks and she sold these products door to door. However, now she does it all from one place; a cafeteria which is only 2 kilometres from her house. Her day starts at 4:00 am when she begins preparing her food. At 6:30 she has already made breakfast for her clients.

The loan will be used to buy a table, chairs, drinks, sweets and bread in order to offer a better service to her clients

Her dream is to see her children graduate from university with a degree.

loans.use: to buy a table, chairs, drinks, sweets and bread in order to offer a better service to her clients

loans.name: Chanly's Group

texts.en: Chanly’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chanly works as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sampov's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Siem Reap province, Sampov is a 35-year-old married mother of two children who are both in school. The sources of her income are from growing rice, selling snacks and growing cassava to earn income to support the family. She has been involved in these businesses for 17 years. She could earn income about 46,000KHR per day. After expenses, she is able to save around 15,000KHR each day.

Destroyed by insect pests, her crops couldn’t produce high yields.

This is Sampov’s second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she paid back her past loan completely. With the previous loan, she could earn better good income than before.

She is now leading a group of two to get a new loan of 1,200,000KHR and her group member is seeking 1,500,000KHR.

As the group leader, she is going to use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees to support her farmland.

She hopes this loan will help to boost her crop yields so that she can earn more income, which enables her to save sufficient capital to support her business next year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees to support her farming

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Bros's Group

texts.en: Bros’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Bros works as farmer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sambo's Group

texts.en: Sambo’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sambo works as a farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.
