Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, as well as save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their families.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Wilma is 58 years old and has one child still in school.

Wilma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Wilma requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more assorted fish to sell at her food stall.

Wilma has been in this business for 13 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more assorted fish to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Lipika

texts.en:
Lipika lives in a small village of Kandi, in the Murshidabad district of West Bengal. She is a married woman of 27 years. She attended school up to grade 10. Lipika has a family of three members consisting of her husband and one daughter. Her daughter is too small to go to school.

Her husband Sujay is engaged with Almirah manufacturing works. Lipika has been managing a business of stitching and selling garments in her locality for the past five years. As she has a sound knowledge of stitching from her childhood, she has chosen this business.

She sews cotton ladies' garments like blouses and petticoats for her customers. She and her husband, with their small income, are maintaining their family in a low profile. Now she wants a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase a better and modern sewing machine.

She hopes for the expansion of her existing sewing business. With the profit, she hopes to give a good education to her daughter and to manage the family’s financial hurdles.

Her full thanks go to her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Orn's Group

texts.en: Orn’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Orn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer and farm laborer  to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

texts.en: Saen’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Saen makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. She has one young son in her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Chita Pa Bay(Vsla)

texts.en:
In July 2012, Yzmael gathered 30 people in his community to create a village savings and loan association. He learned the techniques thanks to a training provided by a local NGO.

Yzmael's group has 23 women and 7 men who are involved in small economic activities. Most of them are retailing personal products in flea markets. Yzmael's group has made progress since its connection to Fonkoze last year. He successfully repaid his first loan and the members of his group have had savings to pay their kids' education fees for this new school year.

Your contribution to this loan will support the development and the improvement of their life conditions, as Ysmael's group operates in an area where 50% of the people are still living with less than $2 dollars per day. From left to right in the picture: Levanel (secretary), Ysmael (Leader), Losane (treasurer), Alita (member), and Elia (member).

loans.use: to buy sacks of personal products to sell.

loans.name: Tikariy Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal TIKARIY, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia Gladys  tiene 36 años de edad es casada y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de materiales de construcción, la socia lleva bue tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cemento, piedras entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con el cronograma establecido.
La socia que sale adjunta a la foto pidió permiso para llegar tarde por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The member is a part of the communal bank TIKARIY, which is located in the Province of Cusco.

The member, Gladys, is 36 years old, married, and has 2 children. She alternates her time between her regular daily activities and her business that sells construction materials. She has had her business for a good while, and it has been thriving thanks to the effort she puts in day to day. She wishes she can remain working as she has been so far so she can continue supporting her family.

Gladys requests a loan for the purchase of cement and rocks, among other things.

The members of the group are grateful for the loans they have been granted and pledge to meet the established time-frames.

The member's whose picture is displayed separately requested permission to arrive late due to a scheduling conflict with her work.

loans.use: buy cement and rocks, among other things.

loans.name: Eberto Enrique

texts.es: Eberto es un emprendedor de 50 años que administra desde hace quince  años su negocio familiar ubicado en un barrio al suroccidente de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Él manifiesta que  toda la vida ha estado involucrado en la actividad de venta de cervezas, pues lo heredó de su madre y ante la falta de oportunidades de trabajo lo tomó como su modo de vida; con un horario de 8 horas diarias de domingo a domingo,  atiende con la ayuda de su cónyuge y su hija de 16 años a sus vecinos, amigos y transeúntes a quien les vende cervezas, bebida conocida  en la costa caribe Colombia como “Frías”, pues resulta muy atractiva para contrarrestar el calor que caracteriza esta región. Eberto manifiesta que su capital actual es insuficiente para captar el total de la demanda originada por la ola de calor que afecta a las Barranquilleros, por lo cual está tramitando su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que planea invertir en la compra de un mayor volumen de cervezas que por supuesto se reflejarán en mayores ingresos y mejores utilidades. Su sueño de prosperidad es ver crecer  su negocio para tener un mejor nivel de vida y sacar adelante a su hija.
texts.en: Eberto is a fifty-year-old entrepreneur who for the past fifteen years has run his family business located in a neighborhood in the southwest of Barranquilla. He says that all of his life he has been involved with beer sales, since he inherited the business from his mother, and faced with a lack of work opportunities, it is how he makes his living. Working eight hours a day from Sunday to Sunday, with the help of his wife and his sixteen-year-old daughter he serves his neighbors, friends and passers-by, selling them beer, a drink known along Colombia's Caribbean coast as "Frías" (cold ones), since it is very appealing to combat the heat that characterizes the region. Eberto says that the working capital he has on hand is insufficient to meet the demand caused by the heat wave affecting the residents of Barranquilla, so he is applying for his first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which he plans to use to invest in buying larger quantities of beer, which would of course result in greater income and earnings. His dream for prosperity is to grow his business, to have a better quality of life and help his daughter succeed.

loans.use: buy beer in greater quantity.

loans.name: Dharitri

texts.en:
Dharitri, 37, is an energetic, hard working lady who hails from a small village of Angul district, Odisha, India. Being a widow, going through many bad times in her life, and raising two children on her own, Dharitri has not given up her dream of improving her quality of life and being a businesswoman.

She has a lovable personality and has a good reputation in her society. She is the only bread winner in her family and never leaves any stone unturned in order to uplift her livelihood. Her strong will power and courage has always helped her overcome each big and small hurdle in her life.

Dharitri owns a grocery shop near her house and earns her living by selling grocery items. She sells flour, oil, bread, rice, pulses, jellies, pickles, jams, chips, and semi processed food items in her store.

She is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR in order to increase the inventory level of her store. She will add more items to her store and this will help her in fulfilling her customer's demands and make them delighted, thus increasing her cash flow. Dharitri is eagerly awaiting for your kind help.

loans.use: to increase the inventory level of her store

loans.name: Debjani

texts.en:
52-year-old Debjani is a woman of courage and strength. She hails from a small village in Kandi. She is married to Sanatan. They are blessed with two grown up sons and two grown up daughters who have gotten married. One of his sons is a driver by profession and another one is a student of M.A (Master of Arts).

Debjani's husband is engaged in agricultural work, the income from which is hardly sufficient for the family. To help her husband financially, Debjani decided to start a milk supply business. As there is a great demand for cow milk in her rural area, this ambitious and energetic lady wants to avail the opportunity; she wants to start her business by selling milk and cattle by products like cow dung, which is used as fuel in rural areas. But due to lack of capital, Debjani seeks to take a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to buy a dairy cow.

With this business, she is expecting an increase in her monthly income. With the increased income and savings, Debjani will be able to expand her existing business. By running her own business, she hopes to be able to gain better profit, support her family, and save for a secure future.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk supply business.

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Noviana

texts.en: Noviana lives in Liquisa, she is married and she was one of the entrepreneurs in her business selling animals. Her husband was very supportive in selling the animals. She started to sell animals in 2013 with own working capital. So now she is requesting a loan of $800 from the Tuba Rai Metin to add to their capital to buy more cows, as it's become their activity. She was very happy with the loan offered by the Tuba Rai Metin because she could use this loan for improving her management. She is taking this loan because she wants use it to buy more animals like cows, goats and pigs.

loans.use: to buy cows, goats and pigs.

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en: Ly’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Ly makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sonali

texts.en:
Sonali, a 49-year-old woman, stays in a small village of Kandi, in the Murshidabad district of West Bengal. She is blessed with three grown up children (one son and two daughters). Her son is engaged in a small income generating work and her daughters are married. Being a housewife, Sonali takes care of her livestock and her husband is engaged in the vegetable business.

Sonali has cows in her herd and sells milk to the villagers. Her husband’s income is quite inadequate for the family so Sonali devotes her full time to her small milk selling business to support her family.

Because of growing expenses, it has become necessary for her to increase her income. She now wants to expand her business by buying a new dairy cow, so Sonali seeks a loan from Kiva's partner BJS. She will purchase a cow and its fodder as well for her cattle maintenance.

She is very hopeful that this investment will support her in earning some extra income and help her to save money for strengthening her family economy. With the profit she expects she can further expand her milk selling business.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk selling business.

loans.name: Adari

texts.en:
Adari, 33 years old, hails from Dhupguri. She is a rural housewife living with her husband and two sons and one daughter. All her children are students. Her son reads in grade 12, her daughter is pursuing her bachelor's degree, and her youngest son is a student of grade 8.

Adari's husband is a mason by profession. But the income is uncertain and is hardly enough to meet the daily needs of the five members of his family, so it would be difficult for him to finance his children's education.

Adari's youngest son, 13 year-old Amrit, is a prospective student of Kalirhat D.C.High School (XII). He studies in grade 8. He is an average student who can improve with proper guidance and sufficient educational help. But he dislikes burdening his parents with the cost of his studies. Due to lack of money, his family is not in a position to continue to support his studies. It is for this reason that his mother Adari is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

She will use the loan for Amrit's educational expenditures. The loan will enable Adari to provide her son with necessary educational articles, a bicycle, school fees, private tuition fees, etc., so he can continue his education.

Adari and Amrit (in the photograph) are grateful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase educational equipment and pay all educational fees for her youngest son.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis de 25 años es un microempresario que inició su propio negocio de peluquería ubicado en el municipio de Soledad;  el cual organizó desde hace 10 meses aprovechando su experiencia laboral en esta área durante 5 años. Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y referidos a los que les ofrece el servicio de peluquería y otros tratamientos de belleza diariamente durante 12 horas al día. Él deseaba ser su propio jefe, tener libertad de horarios, poner en marcha un proyecto personal y ejercer su profesión vocacional para lo cual estudió en una academia. Para Luis la mejor arma para mantenerse en el negocio es la calidad, factor primordial para fidelizar a sus clientes y evitar ofrecer servicios mediocres que le resten competitividad y es precisamente por la búsqueda de mejorar la calidad de su servicio, que está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que planea invertir en la compra de equipos de peluqueria que requiere en la realización de su trabajo. Su meta es modernizar cada vez más su sala de belleza y a largo plazo adquirir su casa propia.
texts.en: Luis is twenty-five years old, he is a micro-entrepreneur who started up his own salon business located in Soledad; he opened the salon ten months ago, taking advantage of his five years of work experience in this area. His customers are neighbors, relatives and referrals, who he offers hair styling and other beauty treatments every day for twelve hours a day. He wanted to be his own boss, set his own hours, get a personal project up and running, and practice the profession he studied for at an academy. To Luis, the greatest strength for sustaining a business is quality, a fundamental factor for earning customer loyalty, and avoiding offering mediocre services which would damage his competitive edge. With the goal of improving the quality of his services, he is applying for his first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which he plans to use to invest in purchasing salon equipment which he needs for his work. His goal is to continue to modernize his beauty salon, and over the long term to buy his own house.

loans.use: to buy equipment for his salon.

loans.name: Kolap's Group

texts.en: Kolap’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Thom province in Cambodia. Kolap makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. She has one young son in her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
