Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Vaiuta

texts.en: Vaiuta is a 38-year-old woman who is married with 9 children. She runs a business selling daily goods such as sugar, rice, flour, tinned fish, etc in her community. She has 5 years experience in this business. Vaiuta has requested a loan to buy canned food, frozen goods, drinks, toiletries, snacks, etc. She plans to use her profits to extend her business and to pay for her children's education. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy canned food, frozen goods, drinks, toiletries, snacks etc

loans.name: Banco Mujer Los Girasoles Group

texts.es: Doña Iris es una mujer divorciada y madre de varios hijos. Actualmente es jefa de hogar y dependen de ella dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales cursan la secundaria. Inició su actividad hace siete años con la finalidad de obtener ingresos y poder salir adelnate con sus hijos. Es una mujer con grandes cualidades de lidereza, y por éste motivo la escogieron como presidenta del Banco Mujer Los Girasoles. Vive en una comunidad rural llamada Maravilla, en donde la mayor fuente de empleo son bananeras. Ella se dedica al comercio ambulante de ropa de mujer y hombre, tanto de niño como de adulto, le va bien y sus clientes son la comunidad y empleados de las diferentes fincas bananeras que hay en el lugar donde y vive y zonas aledañas. Éste grupo se formó hace varios años, porque las señoras que lo integran buscaban fines en común como es la superación y crecimiento en sus actividades productivas, debido a que ven la oportunidad en la Fundación de llegar al éxito en sus negocios con los financiamientos para reforzarlos. Algunas de las socias con jefas de hogar pero otras si tiene esposos o compañeros, las cuales buscan de sus actividades generar ingresos , debido a que los salarios que perciben sus familiares no son suficientes para cubrir todas las necesidades del hogar, asi ellas se sienten útiles porque tienen independencia económica y ayudan a sus familias. Todas buscan mejorar las condiciones de vida de ellas y sus familias. Junto con Iris están cinco socias más que van a invertir sus préstamos en actividades comerciales, de servicios y pecuarias, con la finalidad de aportar en sus hogares y cumplir sus metas en común, siempre sin descuidar a sus familias.
texts.en:
Iris is divorced and the mother of several children. Currently she is the head of the family and her children are in secondary school and depend on her. She started her business 7 years ago with the aim of obtaining income and be able to get ahead with her children. She is a woman with great leadership qualities and for this reason she was chosen as the president of the "Banco Mujer Los Girasoles" group.

She lives in a rural community called Maravilla where the main source of income is bananas. She works selling women's and men's clothing itinerantly as well as children's clothing. Things are going well and her clients are her community and the workers on the different banana farms in the community where she lives and the surrounding areas.

This group was formed a number of years ago as the woman that belong to it have common goals such as improving and expanding their business activities. They see an opportunity in the Fundación to become successful in their businesses with the loans to support them.

Some of the members are the the head of their family but others have spouses or companions. They look to business to generate income as the salaries of their family members aren't sufficient to cover all the household expenses. Thus they feel useful having their financial independence and helping their families. They are all looking to improve their living conditions and those of their families. Along with Iris are five other members who will invest their loans in commercial businesses. services and agriculture, with the goal of supporting their households and achieve their common goals while not neglecting their families.

loans.use: to buy clothing for women and men.

loans.name: Domiciano

texts.es: Domiciano es un joven muy esforzado que se desempeña en labores agrícolas, específicamente a la siembra y producción de chayotes. Solicita un préstamo de mil doscientos dólares ($1,200), para la compra y colocación de postes con el fin de mejorar y facilitar el desarrollo de este cultivo.
texts.en: Domiciano is a very hard-working young man who works in agriculture, particularly in planting and raising chayotes (vegetable pears). He is applying for a loan of $1,200 to use to purchase and set up posts, with the goal of improving and facilitating raising his crop.

loans.use: to buy posts for growing pears.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en: Frank intends to use the loan funds to buy more animal drugs and pesticides to sell to farmers in Kamwenge, Uganda. He had used his previous loan to buy animal medicines to sell. He has personal goals of educating his children, buying a car and building a permanent house. He still sells animal drugs and also gets more income from livestock rearing. He faces hardships of price fluctuations, inflation, customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to purchase stock. However, he has a vision of diversifying his business to include farming, hiring employees to help expand his business and expanding his business to a more permanent location.

loans.use: to buy more animal drugs and pesticides to sell.

loans.name: Islomiddin

texts.en:
Islomiddin is a cheerful girl. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1992. She is living in a remote district with her parents. She is divorced.

She has been a business lady for about a year and a half. She does business buying and selling spare parts and accessories for cell phones. She is a communicative, confident and goal oriented person.

She wishes to help to educate her sister. She appealed to IMON, asking for a loan to pay her sister’s tuition fee at university. She is hoping to be supported, and awaits KIVA lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to pay her sister’s tuition fee at university

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 56 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Diana is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Diana has been raising livestock for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 25 years old and has two children. Elizabeth is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Elizabeth is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Elizabeth has been raising livestock for 2 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Elizabeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Los Girasoles Group

texts.es: Banco Mujer Los Girasoles se formó hace tres años en una comunidad rural de Pococí llamada Maravilla. Seis señoras se organizaron para poder accesar al crédito y pertencer al programa de Fundación Mujer. Éste es el tercer crédito que obtienen y se han caracterizado por su responsabilidad en la fecha pactada de pago. Éstas mujeres cumplen con los requisitos como las Reglas de Oro para seguir perteneciendo al programa, porque ven la  oportunidad de crecer en sus actividades productivas, debido a que la mayoría son jefas de hogar y cuentan con un aporte mínimo de pensión alimenticia para sus hijos, éste es el motivo principal de luchar en sus actividades económicas para poder salir adelante cion sus hijos. Doña Ileana es una mujer soltera y madre de cuatro hijos. Vive en unión libre con el padre de ellos. Tres de sus hijos cursan la secundaria académica y uno está en primaria. Ella inició su actividad porque tiene una familia grande y el salario que percibe su compañero es poco en relación a la manutención de ésta. Ella se dedica a la cría de pollos en el patio de su casa, para luego venderlos. Sus clientes son al comunidad y se venden muy bien. Ella cuida sus animales sin descuidar a su familia. Este Banco Mujer buscan crecimiento y superación para ellas y sus familias. Junto con Ileana están cinco socias más que inevrtiran sus préstamos en el comercio ambulante de ropa, ventas por catálogos, cría de pollos y materia prima para una soda. Todas son mujeres muy trabajadoras que quieren lo mejor para ellas y sus familias, por eso buscan financiamientos para reforzar sus emprendimientos y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
The Mujer Los Girasoles (Sunflower Women) credit group was formed three years ago in a rural community of Pococí called Maravilla.  Six women came together so that they could gain access to credit and join to the Fundacion Mujer program.  This is their third loan and they have always responsibly made their payments by the agreed-upon date.  These women fit the requirements to continue participating in the Reglas de Oro program because because they see the opportunity to grow in their productive activities, and the majority of them are the heads of their households and count on a minimum contribution of child support for their children.  This is their main motivation to work hard so that they can move ahead with their children.  

Ileana is a single woman and mother of 4 children.  She lives in a common-law marriage with their father.  Three of her children are in secondary school and one is in primary school.  She started this business because she has a big family and the salary that her partner makes is too small to maintain her family.  She makes a living raising chickens on the patio of her house and selling them later.  Her customers are from the community and sales are good.  She takes care of her animals without neglecting her family.  

This women's credit group is seeking growth and improvement for themselves and their families.  Besides Ileana, there are five more group members who invest their loans in various businesses such as traveling clothing sales, catalog sales, raising chickens and buying primary ingredients for a restaurant.  All of the women are very hard workers who want the best for themselves and their families.  They are seeking financing to reinforce their business ventures and fulfill their dreams.

loans.use: to buy chickens and supplies

loans.name: Toel's Group

texts.en:
Toel is 43 years old and a farmer living in Siem Reap province. She has six kids, five of whom are dependent on her and need her to support their studying. She has been growing cassava and rice paddy as the main sources of income. Additionally, she raises ducks and works for a labor fee to get extra income. She can only earn income of about 35,000 KHR per day as the crops have been destroyed by insect pests and ducks got sick so that she could sell them for a lower price in the market.

This is the first time for Toel to get a Kiva loan via VisionFund. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy seed and pay for plowing and labor fees to produce higher yields than before. She hopes to earn more income than last year to upgrade her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy seed and pay for plowing and labor fees to produce higher yields than before.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Marcosa

texts.en:
Marcosa is 59 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school, Marcosa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sardines, noodles, shampoo, etc. to sell. Marcosa has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sardines, noodles, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Kerugoya, Kenya has a beautiful landscape made up of endless rolling hills and valleys stretching as far as the eye can see. In her small but clean mud house, Martha, pictured above with her husband, has been able to raise her angelic looking children, who give her the determination to keep pushing on even when things get rough.

Thanks to practicing mixed farming, Martha can see a bright future. Each morning at 5:00 a.m., she arises to go to her farm in the remote village of Mukure. She passionately loves green house farming of vegetables and dairy farming, and has nicknames for her cows. Because of her great knowledge of farming, farmers from her village view her as a mentor. However, the biggest challenge Martha faces is satisfying the overwhelming demand for milk in her village.

She is seeking a 102,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy another dairy cow of good quality. She believes that another cow will enable her to sell more milk, improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children.

Having gone through training with Juhudi Kilimo, Martha is confident that the skills she acquired will help her increase her business, and that she will be able to pay back the loan. She is confident that if she invests in her dream, she will have a positive impact on the life of her family.
Martha is very motivated by this plan because it could be the tipping point for a bright future for her family. Triumph in her efforts to elevate the family’s life will do her proud.

Her biggest dream is to be the leading supplier of milk in her county. She hopes to receive your support and that in a few years, you can come and visit her dairy farm.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Damazo

texts.en:
Damazo used his previous loan to buy more crates of beer and soda to sell in Kamwenge, Uganda. He still owns a bar as his main source of income, runs a butchery then also sells produce to earn more income in order to improve his standard of living and look after his family. Damazo has personal goals of re-investing his profits realized so as to become a prominent businessman and educating his children to higher levels. His main hardships are high competition, increased inflation and inadequate capital to meet the increasing demands of his customers.

He is requesting a loan to buy more crates of beer and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 35 years old and has four children. She is married, and three of her children are currently in school.

Editha is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has been in this business for three years, and she has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Lunimar

texts.en:
Lunimar is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a duck-raising business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and ducks to raise for her raising ducks business.

Lunimar has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from a general store and food vending. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Lunimar has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She aspires to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and ducks to raise

loans.name: Meng Huot

texts.en: Meng Huot works as a goldsmith and lives with his wife, at Khnorng Pos village. As a goldsmith, Meng needs to spend a long time to finish each product. His work consumes his night times, too. Because he needs to consume a lot of energy in order to finish each piece, he spends a lot of money on the car battery he uses for energy. He needs to charge it very often. Meng Huot is not happy with his current energy source, because it is so time-consuming and expensive. After having learned the benefits of a solar home system, he decided to apply for a Kiva loan in order to buy this system. He believes a solar home system can reduce his energy costs and give his family comfortable conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home energy system.

location.town: Khnorng Pos Village, Dar Commune,Chetr Borei Distr

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn is 35 years old and single. She has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising a pig in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds, rice bran and vitamins for her pig.

Lyn has been raising her pig for two years now, She has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds, rice bran and vitamins for her pig

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Marjorie requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy a stock of household goods to sell, like soap, shampoo, coffee, chips, etcetera. Marjorie has been in this business for 10 years. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of household goods to sell, like soap, shampoo, coffee, chips, etc.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 30 years old and married with three children, two of whom who are currently in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippine, and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Jovelyn has been raising livestock for 10 years now and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 52 years old and married. She has two children. With one child in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF, which she will use to buy items to sell. She will buy items like candles, personal care products, and groceries. She has been in this business for nine years.

In the future, Evelyn would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like candles, personal care products, and groceries.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is 56 years old and married with two children. Roseline works very hard to provide for them.

Roseline runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, milk, drinks, spices, snack foods, bread, eggs, soap, shampoo and other personal care products. Roseline has been in this business for one year.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, milk, drinks, spices, snack foods, bread, eggs, shampoo, soap and other personal care products.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with twelve children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maria is 63 years old now.

Maria has a food vending business in the Philippines. Maria requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Maria has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Maria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mary Jean works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, she also earns additional income from a jewelry repair shop. Mary Jean is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like rice, milk, sugar, etc. for her food vending business.

Mary Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Corina

texts.es: Doña Corina es una señora con 47 años de edad, casada y madre de cinco hijos. Actualmente de los cinco solo uno menor de edad vive en la casa con ella y su esposo. Tiene aproximadamente 30 años de casada y siempre se ha dedicado a la familia. Es una mujer trabajadora y con gran interés de crecimiento a nivel personal, familiar y de negocio. Inició la actividad productiva de una panadería porque un sobrino le dió la gran idea, debido a que en la comunidad en la que vive no hay, solamente pulperías y es ahí donde venden pan. No tiene competencia de vender el pan y la repostería fresca porque es un lugar rural llamado Perlita. La mayor fuente de empleo son bananeras y piñeras. El negocio es familiar, ahí trabaja ella, su esposo, un hijo y un yerno el cual es el repostero. Es la principal fuente de ingreso para la familia. Tiene la experiencia en la cria de animales pero por diferentes razones ya no quieren seguir con esa actividad. Lograron vender un terreno que tenia y con eso construyeron el local y compraron parte de la maquinaria y materia prima necesaria para emprender su negocio. Cuentan con contratos de vender el pan y la repostería en diferentes pulperias de comunidades aledañas y con Fondas de algunas bananeras de su comunidad. También la comunidad son sus clientes, ya que prefieren comer algo rico y fresco. Es primera vez que solicita financiamiento para reforzar su negocio. Va a invertir el préstamo en comprar equipo como una batidora industrial, ya que la que tiene es casera, además de moldes y materia prima para hacer pan y repostería. Cuenta con referencias crediticias positivas. Ella busca obtener mejores ingresos para mejorar la economía familiar y las condiciones de vivienda. Por éste motivo emprende su negocio e incluye a su familia, ya que es parte importante de ella.
texts.en:
Corina is a 47-year-old married woman with 5 children. Currently, only one out of the 5 children is a minor and lives at home with her and her husband. She has been married for approximately 30 years and she has always been dedicated to her family. She is a hard-working woman with a great interest in growth at the personal, family, and business level.

She started her bakery business because a nephew gave her the great idea, thanks to the fact that the community that she lives in doesn't have any bakeries, only general stores where bread is sold. There isn't any competition for selling bread and fresh pastries in the rural area of Perlita where she lives. The major source of employment is banana and pineapple plantations.

The business is family-run, and she works there with her husband, a son, and a son-in-law who is the pastry chef. The business is the principal source of income for her family. She has experience raising animals, but she doesn't want to continue with that activity for various reasons. They were able to sell a plot of land that they had and use the proceeds to build a shop and to buy part of the machinery and primary materials necessary to undertake the business.

They have contracts to sell bread and pastries in different general stores in the surrounding communities and with small restaurants on some of the banana plantations in her community. Her customers are also from the community since they prefer to eat something delicious and fresh.

This is the first time that she is requesting financing to reinforce her business. She is going to use the loan to buy equipment such as an industrial blender, since the one she has is a household blender, as well as molds and primary ingredients to make bread and pastries. She has positive credit references. She is looking to obtain more income to improve her family's economic situation and the conditions of their home. That's why she started her business and includes her family in it, since that is important to her.

loans.use: to buy equipment and primary ingredients.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is one woman who is very interested in business. Even though she is married, she is not overly dependent on her husband to be responsible for her family, because she is always busy with her business.

She is requesting a loan of $ 1,000.00 from the Tuba Rai Metin to add to her capital to buy more goods such as tea, noodles, biscuits, coffee, eggs, pens, candies, milk, soft drinks , hard drinks and other things to sell because she plans to open a bigger business in the future.

She first opened her business in 2008 with a capital base of $ 100.00. So, she was happy with the loan that was offered by Tuba Rai Metin for her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tea, noodles, biscuits, coffee, eggs, pens, candies, milk, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
Jose es un campesino humilde de 50 años de edad, viene de una familia muy trabajadora que se dedicaba a trabajar el campo para ganarse la vida y gracias a los conocimientos que le transmitieron sus familiares hoy en día se dedica a la cría y comercialización de cerdos. Trabaja desde las primeras horas de la mañana para cuidar y alimentar los animales, los cuales vende por libras o en pie según el requerimiento de sus clientes, que principalmente son propietarios de fincas de la región; de esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. 

El titular se caracteriza por ser pujante, activo y trabajador; impulsado por las ganas de seguir progresando, solicita el apoyo de un crédito con el que desea comprar 2 lechones para cría y engorde y desea ampliar aprovechar el espacio que tiene disponible en su corral, en el que adecuara una nueva porqueriza.

Esto le ayudará a aumentar su producción, especialmente para satisfacer la demanda creciente que tiene por la época que se aproxima, en la que sus ventas tienden a incrementar, beneficiando las finanzas familiares. 

Es así como Jose quiere seguir luchando día a día, con empeño y dedicación, pues su ideal es seguir asumiendo la responsabilidad económica de su casa, velar por el bienestar de su esposa y disfrutar junto a ella una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is a humble 50 year old man from the countryside. He comes from a hard working family that works on the farm to earn a living. Thanks to the knowledge that his family provided to him, he earns a living raising and selling pigs. He works from the very early hours in the morning to take care of and feed the animals. He sells them by the pound or live depending on the requirements he gets from his customers. Most of his customers are farm owners from the region. This is how he earns a living and maintains his home.

The borrower is known because he is a thriving man, active and hard-working. He is motivated because he wants to continue to succeed. He is requesting a loan which he will use to buy 2 pigs to raise and fatten them. He also wants to take advantage and expand the space he has in his farmyard to accommodate a new pig pen. This will help him increase the production, especially to meet the growing demand due to the upcoming season in which the sales usually increase and help the family finances.

This is how Jose wants to continue, working day by day with effort and dedication. His goal is to continue to be responsible for the finances of his home, take care of his wife and enjoy a better quality of life with her.

loans.use: to buy 2 pigs to  raise and fatten them. He also wants to take advantage and expand the space he has in his farmyard.

loans.name: Jimel Humberto

texts.es:
El señor Jimel tiene gran experiencia en el área de panadería, hace algún tiempo inicio con su propia panadería que hasta ahora le ha generado muy buenos resultados.

Siempre ha preferido trabajar independiente, trabaja todos los días desde las 8:00 Am hasta las 9:00 Pm

Actualmente necesita un auxilio para comprar insumos como Harina, queso, levaduras, entre otros.

El préstamo le permitirá trabajar en unas mejores condiciones y podrá garantizar la calidad de sus preparaciones a traves de uno buenos ingredientes.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener una gran panadería que surta diferentes tiendas y restaurantes en la región.

Con esta ayuda podrá trabajar de una manera más organizada y con un amyor y mejor cantidad de insumos.
texts.en:
Jimel has a lot of experience working in a bakery. Some time ago he started his own bakery and so far he has generated very good results. He has always preferred to work independently. He works every day from 8:00 am until 9:00 pm.

He currently needs help buying supplies such as flour, cheese, yeast and other items. The loan will allow him to work under better conditions and he would be able to guarantee the quality of his work by means of good ingredients.

His biggest dream is to have a large bakery that supplies different stores and restaurants in the region. With this help, he could work in a more organized and devoted manner, with a better amount of supplies.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour, cheese, yeast and other items.

loans.name: Magola Isabel

texts.es:
Magola una madre de una joven de 17 años de edad,  al cual ama y da la vida por él, se dedica a la venta de mercancía, una actividad que inicio por gusto al trabajo independiente que descubrió cuando era estudiante y vendía cosas a sus amigos, aprendió sola de esta labor.

Trabaja diariamente durante 4 horas pues debe alternar este oficio con el cuidado de su familia. 

Quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido de ropa y calzado al por mayor, de esta forma podrá abastecer su negocio y su inventario. 

El mayor objetivo en su vida es poder tener un negocio sostenible con buenas ventar y poder comprarse una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Magola is the mother of a 17-year-old son, whom she loves and for whom she gives her life. She works selling merchandise. She started this business because she enjoys independent work, which she discovered when she was a student and sold items to her friends. She learned this profession on her own.

She works every day for four hours, since she has to divide her time between her work and caring for her family.

She would like to request a loan to buy an assortment of clothing and shoes on a wholesale basis. In this way she will be able to stock her store and increase her inventory.

Her main goal in life is to have a sustainable business with good sales, so that she can buy a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of clothing and shoes in order to stock her business and increase her inventory.

loans.name: Leanghuoy

texts.en:
Leanghuoy is a 51-year-old married homemaker with a dependent child. She is a factory worker living in the Takeo province of Cambodia. Her husband is a 54-year-old construction worker. Together, they can earn approximately $17 each day.

To improve the family’s finances, Leanghuoy would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle for her husband to run as a motorcycle taxi service when he is free after work. This loan will help her husband earn more income for the family. In the future, she is going to save money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her husband to run as a motorcycle taxi when he is free after work.

loans.name: Lola

texts.en:
Lola is a careful mother. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1966. She is living in the district with her family. She is married and has three children.

She has been a teacher for many years. Recently, she has worked at a kindergarten. She likes children, and patiently takes care of them all.

She is sick. She needs to recover and heal in order to continue her activity. She appealed to IMON, asking for financial support to pay for her medical treatment at the hospital. She hopes to be supported by KIVA lenders, and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to pay for her treatment at the hospital.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a widowed woman, 59 years old. She has nine children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Nenita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy materials for her business, like fishing net, gasoline for her boat, bamboo and others. She has been in this business for 15 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business, like fishing net, gasoline for her boat, bamboo and others.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 50 years old and married. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Gina has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Purisima

texts.en:
Purisima is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Purisima is 52 years old and has one child in school.

Purisima has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Purisima requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy garments and other materials needed for her business.

Purisima has been in this business for 37 years. In the future, Purisima would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy garments and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 49 years old and married with nine children, four of whom are still in school. Emelda works very hard to provide for them.

Emelda runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, cooking oil, etc. Emelda has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, cooking oil,  etc.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa, de 44 años de edad, es una señora entusiasta y muy trabajadora, vive con su esposo, sus hijos y sus nietos; su esposo trabaja en la agricultura y es el apoyo más grande que tiene, sus hijos trabajan y estudian.

Teresa, tiene una tienda en su casa, en donde vende productos de primera necesidad, como bebidas y granos básicos, su tienda es la principal fuente de ingresos para ella y su familia.

Teresa, necesita el crédito para surtir su tienda con golosinas, bebidas, pan, arroz, azúcar, frijoles y café, para ofrecer una amplia gama de productos de primera necesidad a sus clientes. 

Ella desea que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa, age 44, is an enthusiastic and very hard-working woman. She lives with her husband, her children and her grandchildren. Her husband works in agriculture, and he is her greatest source of support. Her children are working and studying.

Teresa has a store in her home, where she sells basic necessities, such as drinks and everyday foods. Her store is the main source of income for her and her family.

Teresa needs the loan to stock her store with snacks, drinks, bread, rice, sugar, beans and coffee, to offer a wide range of basic staple products to her customers.

Her desire is for her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her store with snacks, drinks, bread, rice, sugar, beans and coffee.

loans.name: Anly

texts.en:
Anly works hard to support three children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Anly requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Anly is aware that by using the solar lamp she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Solar Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Solar está en su ciclo número 15  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, a través del cual ellas luchan por mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las que integra el grupo es la Sra. Elva, quien vende platerías variadas, comenta que con sus ventas se gana la vida de una manera digna y honesta. Ella ayuda a sus seres queridos dándoles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
La Sra. Elva  solicita de este préstamo para la compra de sus platerías tales como aros, anillos, pulseras, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Elva está contenta con la ayuda que recibe, ya que con este préstamo y las capacitaciones podrá mejorar bastante.
texts.en:
The group called Solar is in its 15th cycle of the women's committee program through which they all strive to better their lives. They all work and are conducting research on the elimination of poverty.

One of the women who makes up the group is Elva, who sells a variety of silverware. She states that with her sales, she earns a living in a dignified and honest manner. She helps her loved ones giving them all that she could not have.

Elva is requesting this loan to purchase silverware like earrings, rings, and bracelets and this will help her set her business plan which will help to improve her income. Elva is pleased with the help she receives, since with this loan and training she will be able to improve considerably.

loans.use: to purchase silverware to sell: earrings, rings, bracelets, and others.

loans.name: Azel

texts.en:
Azel is 22 years old and married with one child. Azel works very hard to provide for the family.

Azel runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, cooking oil, etc. Azel has been in this business for two years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Huverlina

texts.es: Huverlina era una tradicional ama de casa dedicada al cuidado y educación de sus 3 hijos, y que ante la falta de trabajo y con la idea de generar ingresos, hace quince  años decidió montar un negocio familiar y emprendiendo el proyecto desde su hogar. Con la ayuda de su familia invirtió todos sus ahorros en el negocio de venta de almuerzos que atiende diariamente de 6:a.m. a 2:00 p.m. y que se ha convertido en el motor de su vida, pues su cónyuge y ahora sus hijos están involucrados en el negocio. Adicionalmente al negocio de comidas, ella elabora y vende productos de aseo, como desinfectantes, limpiadores, escobas y traperos, los cuales comercializa  entre su clientela conformada por vecinos y familiares. Huverlina  está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que le permitirán un capital base para realizar la compra de los víveres como carnes, arroz, verduras, legumbres al por mayor con el fin de obtener mejores costos y por supuesto un mayor margen de utilidad.   Su meta a corto plazo es arreglar su vivienda de habitación y a largo plazo lograr organizar su restaurante en un local propio.
texts.en:
Huverlina was a traditional housewife who spent her time caring for and educating her children. Faced with the lack of work, but determined to generate an income, she decided fifteen years ago to start a family business, and began by installing it in her house.

With help from her family, she invested all her savings in her lunchroom business, where she works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. The business has become the driving force in their life, because her husband and now her children are also involved.

In addition to her food business, she also makes and sells cleaning products such as disinfectants, cleansers, brooms, and mops, which she sells to her clients, who are mostly her neighbours and friends.

Huverlina is applying for her first credikiva with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and will use the funds as a base capital to buy provisions such as meat, rice, vegetables, and beans in bulk so that she can get better prices, and of course, have a better profit margin.

Her short-term goal is to improve the house where they live, and in the long term to set up her restaurant in its own space.

loans.use: to buy provisions such as meat, rice, vegetables, and beans in bulk.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
While many young people in the Kerugoya area of Kenya dream of getting well-paying jobs, Jane, from the Kerugoya area of Kenya, has never secured one and she opted to become a full-time smallholder farmer. Jane is totally a life warrior - despite not securing a formal job she goes out every day to work in her small farm, showing that women are also involved in farming. Jane decided that she would be independent and contribute to her community by practicing mixed farming.

Jane is married and blessed with three lovely children who she refers to as “my heart beat.” Her primary sources of income are selling milk, pig farming, and some personal business that she does to supplement her meager income. Deciding to practice pig farming was not a difficult decision for Jane. She has earned a decent income from pig farming for six years. The demand is overwhelming and she wants to increase the number of pigs, but the biggest challenge is lack of funds, so she seeks a loan to purchase additional pigs.

Pig farming has become one of the most important aspects of agriculture in Kenya, because it creates business opportunities for entrepreneurs and it’s a kind of business that will always be needed. Pig farming is a less strenuous activity and it is profitable. Many pig farmers find a sense of fulfillment having pigs all over their homestead. If taken seriously, pig farming has the potential of being a big business because the demand for pork products is always high. With your loan, Jane is going to earn more income that will enable her to take care of her family's expenses. Jane is doing all she can do to ensure that her family's basic needs are met.

You can be a part of this dream: contribute with a loan.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs.

loans.name: Ilsen De Jesus

texts.es:
Ilsen es una mujer de 36 años de edad, la cual siempre ha destacado y sobresalido, por su carácter, por su compostura, por ser una mujer correcta que solo le gustan las cosas bien hechas.  Tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y fruto de ese amor se conformó una linda familia que la terminan de conformar sus tres hermosos hijos dos mujeres de 8 y 10 y el mayor de 14 años de años.
Ilsen se dedica a fabricar calzado, alrededor de su máquina de confección podremos ver algunos  los calzados que usa, los cuales son muy apetecidos por su público en gran parte gracias a la buena calidad, excelente acabo y comodidad.
Su sueño de pagar la educación de sus hijos y superarse como empresaria, la motivan a solicitar un préstamo con el ánimo de comprar más materia prima para la elaboración de mayor cantidad de calzado.

Ilsen desea tu apoyo, un incentivo le servirá a ella para progresar y sacar su negocio adelante.
texts.en:
Ilsen is a 36-year-old woman who has always distinguished herself and excelled because of her character and composure and for being an upstanding woman who only aspires to do good. She is married and her marriage has turned into a beautiful family with three children, 2 girls who are 8 and 10, and the oldest who is 14 years old.

Ilsen makes a living making footwear. Some of the footwear that she makes can be seen around her sewing machine. Her footwear is in high demand by the public, thanks in large part to its good quality, excellent finishing, and comfort.

Her dream of paying for her children's education and exceeding as a entrepreneur motivated her to take out a loan with intention of buying more primary materials to make a larger quantity of footwear.

Ilsen wants your support as an incentive that will serve to move her and her business forwards.

loans.use: to buy soles, leather, molds, fabric, and complete accessories for making footwear.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is 39 years old, married, and has two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, cooking oil, etc.

Criselda has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Criselda aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana lives and works at a local marketplace in her home town of Belaya Tserkov. She is 36, married with two children. Svetlana is a small entrepreneur selling women's clothing merchandise: blouses, sweaters, dresses, skirts, tights. Svetalana owns two vending locations at the same market. She has been running this business for over 19 years. Today it is a self-sustainable business bringing her good income.

Svetlana always seeks ways to expand her trade and diversify offered merchandise to keep up with clients' demand. This fall she is planning to invest 100 000 Grivnyas in a variety of seasonal jackets, dresses, pants and blouses to increase assorted clothing inventory she offers for sale in her vending kiosks.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of seasonal jackets, dresses, pants and blouses to increase her assorted clothing inventory.

loans.name: Al Kinan Group

texts.en:
Soriya is the featured borrower of Al Kinan group, she joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends, where at the same time they work hard to develop their families living through developing their businesses.

Soriya is the first lady at the far right side of the picture with the white top. She is 48 years old, married and mother of four children, who has been running her home products sales shop since July 2011, with a seven years of experience.
Soriya started a Mouneh business which she used to run from her house, until she decided in 2011 to open her current business and is working hard developing it, to cover her family's increasing living needs.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her business merchandise with new released home products and increase her selling, since her increasing family needs limit her from developing her business as she plans to.
As for the other group members, Amira is the first lady at the far left and Layal is the lady at the center.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with new released home products and to increase her sales.

loans.name: Meshach

texts.en:
Meshach who lives in Hoima Uganda is aged 54, married with 5 children, who all attend school. He deals in poultry keeping, supplemented by farming mainly growing cassava and beans. He intends to grow and expand his business the more only to be limited by inadequate capital and high prices of chicken feeds.

Meshach is taking a second loan from Hofokam expecting to grow his poultry project to another level and increase his profits plus family standards at large. He is seeking for credit to buy more chicks for keeping.

loans.use: to buy more chicks, for expanding his current poulty business

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines, and she is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and rice burns for her pigs. She supplements her income with earnings from her food vending.

Merlinda dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and rice burns for her pigs

loans.name: Alvaro Wilson

texts.es:
El trabajo del campo es una de las labores más difíciles hoy en día por el gran esfuerzo que se debe hacer para progresar y poder salir adelante, pero Álvaro es un hombre que nunca se ha rendido a pesar del clima o las circunstancias que puedan pasar, el siempre está dispuesto a conseguir los recursos para su familia.

Se levanta desde primera hora de la mañana para desplazarse a distintas fincas para cumplir con sus obligaciones laborales como jornalero.

Este oficio lo alterna con la venta de leche que obtiene de sus propias vacas.

El desea aumentar su capital de trabajo para garantizar el sostenimiento de sus negocios y es esta la razón que la lleva a solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de una vaca lechera que le de un buen impulso a su negocio y le permita tener una mejor calidad de vida para ofrecer a su familia.
texts.en:
Working in the fields is one of the hardest jobs nowadays due to the great effort that must be made to get ahead in it, but Álvaro is a man who has never given up regardless of bad weather or unfortunate circumstances. He is always willing to get the resources his family needs.

He wakes up first thing in the morning to go to different farms to fulfill his obligations as a day-worker. He alternates this activity with the sale of the milk he gets from his cows.

He wishes to increase his working capital to guarantee the success of his businesses, and it is for this reason that he requests a loan to invest in the purchase of a dairy cow that will boost his business and allow him to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase a dairy cow that will boost his business.

loans.name: Loeun

texts.en:
Loeun, a farmer and also a businessman, lives in Achen Village with his wife and two children. Besides farming, he buys fishes from suppliers and retails to customers in his area.

Loeun needs to get up early to prepare his shop before the sun rises. Currently, he uses a car battery to supply his business' energy but a car battery is not reliable. It has short a life span and is easily damaged. Sometimes the car battery runs out during the night time. After getting a good recommendation from a neighbor who uses a solar home energy system, Loeun decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a solar home system. He believes this decision will improve his energy supply for running his business and also save on utility fees.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home energy system.

location.town: Achen Village, Kampong Cham Commune, Sambo Distric

loans.name: Thottiyam Jlg - 055 Group

texts.en:
Gomathy is the leader of the group, Thottiyam JLG - 055.The group comprises of 4 other members. Currently, their are generating very low income from their respective jobs. Gomathy is 27 year old. She is married and mother of 2 kids. With a strong desire to educate her kids, she wants to make a better living. GMF, Milaap’s partner is known for its training with loan support model helping women like Gomathy to make a better life for themselves and their families. Gomathy got trained on the art of making Kundan jewellery. ( "Kundan is a traditional form of Indian gemstone jewellery involving a gem set with gold foil between the stones and its mount, usually for elaborate necklaces")

Now she wants to set up her own business. So do the other members of the group. This is why they have applied for a loan from GMF. Together, they need a loan of Rs. 100,000. They are confident of setting up their own micro enterprises and creating a better life for their family. They thank their lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for starting her Kundan jewellery making business

loans.name: Natali Nicol

texts.es:
Natali Nicol es un joven estudiante de medicina, ella solicita un prestamo para poder cubir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia: Nombre es Natali, nací en la Vega, tengo dos hermanos y vivo con mis padres.  Mis estudios primario fueron en el Colegio Parroquial Cristo Rey, mi secundaria fue en el Liceo Reverendo Adres Amengual (Fe y Alegría) y actualmente estoy e n la Universidad Católica Tecnológica del Cibao (UCATECI) en la cual estudio Medicina; el motivo para estudiar esta carrera es porque me gusta y he tenido vocación por la misma, y dentro de las materias que he dado me gustan la química y biología. 
Mi familia es de escasos recursos, por lo que no pueden pagarme los estudios, si no logro el préstamo sería muy forzado para mí ya que tendría que trabajar para poder continuar con mis estudios y esta carrera me exige tiempo y dedicación por lo que me vería obligada a tomar menos materias y me atrasaría mucho y no lograría mi sueño en el tiempo estimado.
Cuando termine mi carrera mi meta principal es trabajar en un centro de salud, ejercer mi profesión y luego hacer una especialidad. Mi familia se sentirá orgullosa de mí y yo podre ser ejemplo a seguir de mis familiares estudiando y de nuestra sociedad.
texts.en:
Natali Nicol is a young student of medicine. She is applying for a loan so that she can pay for her education expenses.

This is her story:
My name is Natali and I was born in Vega. I have two brothers and I live with my parents. I went to primary school at Colegio Parroquial Cristo Rey and secondary school at Liceo Reverendo Adres Amengual (Fe y Alegría). Right now I am studying medicine at the Universidad Católica Tecnológica del Cibao (UCATECI). The reason I chose this degree is because I like medicine and I want to practice it. Out of the classes I have taken, I like chemistry and biology.

I come from a low-income family, so they can't pay for me to go to school. If I don't get this loan, things will be stressful for me since I will have to work in order to be able to continue studying. The degree that I have chosen requires a lot of time and dedication, so I will be forced to take fewer classes. I will get behind and I won't be able to achieve my dream on time.

When I finish my degree, my main goal is to work in a health center and practice my profession and later develop a specialty. My family will feel very proud of me and I will be able to be an example to follow for my family members who are studying and for society.

loans.use: to cover higher education expenses.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
A sari-sari store is somehow the same as a convenience store but a smaller version. You’ll see this in every barrio, barangay or even in cities. You can find here a variety of items that can be bought at a cheap price since they sell items by volume, kilos or by the piece. Sari-sari stores are rampant in the Philippines since Filipinos can take care of their family while doing the business. Most sari-sari stores are located in the comfort of their own home where they just put up a grill or screen as a protection against theft. In front, you’ll see products hanging such as biscuits, candies, and snack foods to attract customers.

Elma is engaged on this type of business. She has been a 58 year old, Center for Community Transformation (CCT) partner since January 20, 2010 and a dedicated member as well. She’s managed her own sari-sari store business for 10 years now and also a videoke business. It’s another business in the Philippines where people rent equipment which includes a television, a videoke machine and a catalogue where you’ll find hundreds of songs to choose from. Each song has an equivalent number. Once the number is entered in the machine the chosen song will be played with a subtitle. Since Filipinos love to sing, at every celebration they include renting a videoke machine, so that’s why the business is growing. Her estimated earnings are PHP 28,000 every month.

Elma believes that CCT helps aspiring entrepreneurs in their businesses by granting loan requests. Since she wants to have additional capital for her business’ growth, she decided to apply for a PHP 35,000 loan to add items for the business such as bottled drinks, sacks of rice, school supplies, grocery items and add additional equipment for her videoke business.

Elma regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience in the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to add items for her business such as bottled drinks, sacks of rice, school supplies and grocery items.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is a 29-year-old, single man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Because the economic situation in Gaza is not good, a few years ago, Mustafa started his own business. He manages a stall for selling kitchen tools and household equipment.

This is the only source of income for the family. Mustafa took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy a new collection of kitchen tools including also dishes, spoons, cups... for his store. This will increase his sales and also his income. Mustafa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of kitchen tools and household equipment

loans.name: Fenilyn

texts.en:
Fenilyn is a 39-year-old widowed woman with two children who are both currently in school. 

She is a very hard working entrepreneur in the Philippines who does business buying and selling peanuts. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of peanuts to sell.

Fenilyn has been in this business for 11 years. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of peanuts to sell

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Corazon is 49 years old and has three children who are in school.

Corazon has a buy and sell personal product care business in the Philippines. Corazon requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like perfumes, lotion, etc..

Corazon has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Corazon would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like perfumes, lotion, etc.

loans.name: Morita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Morita works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and also earns income from farming sugarcane and buying and selling rice.

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase materials like zippers, chalk, linen, etc. for her tailoring business.

Morita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials like zippers, chalk, linen, etc. for her tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more vegetables such as cabbages and onions for sale.

loans.name: Gilmar Gabriel

texts.es: Gilmar es un joven emprendedor de 20 años de edad que hace tres años aprovechó la oportunidad de tener su propio negocio, cuando su tío le ofreció venderle su negocio de café internet por motivos de viaje;  desde entonces todos los días de 10:00 a.m a 8: p.m. ofrece a vecinos y transeúntes del sector donde reside el servicio de llamadas, internet, scanner entre otros. Gilmar está convencido que un buen servicio le garantiza el retorno de sus clientes y muestra de ello es que cada vez incrementa su clientela, para lo cual planea la adquisición de dos nuevos computadores, recursos que está solicitando a través de su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Su sueño de prosperidad es terminar su carrera universitaria y abrir una sucursal en un sitio estratégico que le permita generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Gilmar is a young 20-year-old entrepreneur who took advantage of the opportunity to start his own business three years ago when his uncle offered to sell him his internet cafe business because of travel reasons. Since then he has offered telephone, internet, and scanner services, among other things, to his neighbors and passers-by from the area from 10 A.M. to 8 P.M.

Gilmar is convinced that good service guarantees the return of his customers and the proof is that his clientele increases every time. Therefore, he is planning to buy two new computers, resources that he is requesting through his first Kiva loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. His dream is to finish getting a university degree and open a branch at a strategic site that will allow him to generate more profit.

loans.use: to buy two new computers.

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be honest.

Kache operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables and she has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the perishability of some goods. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of onions, potatoes and bananas. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of onions, potatoes and bananas.

loans.name: Dyna

texts.en:
Diana Mae is 18 years old and is only child in the family. Her mother Dyna supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Diana Mae is studying Bachelor of Tourism Management and is currently in her 3rd of this 4-year course.

Dyna is borrowing 46000 to pay for tuition fees of her daughter for the 1st semester of the school year 2015-2016.

When she graduates, Diana Mae plans to graduate and be gainfully employed

loans.use: to help pay tuition fees for her daughter to graduate with a BA in Tourist Management.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Angelita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Angelita is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like slippers, pants, etc. for her buy and sell ready to wear business.

Angelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like slippers, pants, etc.

loans.name: Mansueta

texts.en:
Mansueta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business raising livestock in the Philippines.

Mansueta requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Mansueta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Ledecia

texts.en:
Ledecia is 53 years old and married with four children. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ledecia has been in pig fattening for three years now and has borrowed from NWTF two times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a 29-year-old married woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a food production/vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Rowena has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jaime Esteban

texts.es:
Jaime es un hombre campesino de 19 años de edad que, se dedica a realizar todas las tareas del campo pues es propietario de un cultivo de frijol en el municipio de Don Matías; trabaja en estas actividades desde hace 2 años, día a día sin descanso, con el ánimo de generar recursos que le permitan aportar a la economía de su hogar. 

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar abonos agrícolas al por mayor y productos para el cuidado de la tierra como fertilizantes, fungicidas, pesticidas, entre otros, con lo que podrá aumentar la producción y mejorar los ingresos que percibe. 

Este apoyo para el significa aumentar su nivel de ventas, además tendrá la posibilidad de sacar una cosecha de frijol mucho más productiva gracias a los cuidados que le dará con los insumos agrícolas. 

Jaime manifiesta su interés para darle continuidad a su labor, pues su sueño es poder ampliar y fortalecer aún más su negocio para que éste le genere mayor rentabilidad y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
19-year old Jaime lives in the countryside in the municipality of Don Matias. He is the owner of a plot of land where he grows beans and does the other work that living in the country entails. He's been earning his living this way for two years, day after day, without a break as he wishes to contribute economically to his family.

Now Jaime is seeking a loan to buy agricultural supplies at wholesale prices and products for the care of his land such as fertilizer, fungicide, pesticide etc. Then he will be able to increase production and improve his income.

The assistance he receives means Jaime will increase sales as well as provide him with the possibility of a much greater bean harvest thanks to the care that these products will provide for his land.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies at wholesale prices and products for the care of his land such as fertilizer, fungicide, pesticide

loans.name: Gachwe

texts.en: Gachwe is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be reliable. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. His business goal is to have a large scale grocery store within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 28-year-old woman who lives in the area of Kitale. It is a thriving area full of people like Elizabeth, who, with hard work and honest work, make this town a very productive town. She is married and lives with her family. She has five children who are her greatest motivation in life to persevere, because she wants to provide for them a better future. Elizabeth was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past 10 years. Elizabeth always says, “I have always had an affinity for farming, and it runs in my blood.”

She is able to get between 10 and 15 liters of milk a day and this helps her support crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements and that is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, she will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels.
Elizabeth believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Elizabeth’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Sophor's Group

texts.en:
Sophor’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sophor makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a seller to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Yert's Group

texts.en:
Yert’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Yert makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a construction worker to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a first-year student at Kepler in Rwanda. After an application process that considered her grades, test scores, and personal interview, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants. She chose Kepler because of its academic quality as well as her desire to earn a degree from a high quality institution.

Cynthia plans to major in Health Care Management and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, she hopes to manage a hospital or international health organization. She is committed to lifting up vulnerable communities, especially children, and works best in teams.

Outside class, she is most interested in participating in debate, translation work, and taking on leadership and organization roles.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Kanha's Group

texts.en:
Kanha is ages 26 year old and a married mother of two dependent children, living in Banteay Mean Chey province. To overcome her family’s hardship, she grows cassava as the main source of her family’s income and works as a labor worker to earn additional income to support her family. She has been involved in these businesses for six years and it earn her about 41,000KHR per day and it is enable her to save about 20,000KHR after offsetting her family’s expense. Recently, her cassava did not grown well and having low demand in the market, it caused her to earn very low income in the previous season.

Due to not having enough working capital to grow her cassava, she is now leading a group to apply for a Kiva loan with the amount 1,200,000KHR and her group member is seeking for 1,000,000KHR. This is the first loan cycle for her group and she is willing to take her loan portion to buy fertilizer to increase productivity of her crop. She hopes this loan will help her to gain more yields and earn more income to expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase productivity of her crop.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a productive place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to be a large scale farmer within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Mugusu B Abmwe Group

texts.en:
Olivia is a member of Mugusu B Abmwe Group where members guarantee each other. She is aged 45 with 5 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. She is a retailer and at the same time does farming that adds her more income. This group has members who operate several businesses like retail trading, farming and charcoal businesses.

It is now servicing the ninth loan with Hofokam which has seen them improve on their feeding habits and educating their children. She is faced with challenges of customer delaying to pay her for those who buy on credit. Besides that, she has hopes of educating all her children to higher levels of learning. Olivia has asked for a loan to buy sugar, soap and other products for sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and other products for sell.

loans.name: Happines

texts.en:
Happines is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be achiever. She operates a farm where she grows vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be pests.

She will use the Kes 55,000 loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer. Her business goal is to be a large scale supplier of vegetables within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a renown business lady. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a single woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a farm where she grows maize, french beans and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a productive place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high costs of farm inputs.

She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to export farm products within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 62 year old hardworking married farmer living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He mainly grows bananas, coffee and maize from which he can earn more income. He wants to start rearing cows since he will be there to take good care of them, as he is not working.

The challenge affecting his business though is inadequate capital and limited land to set up a good farm for the animals he will acquire. He works for 6 days a week since 2010.
He is requesting for a loan to buy cattle for rearing.

loans.use: to buy cattle for rearing.
